loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old and married with nine children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods and other groceries.

Teresita has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Teresita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Niazan

texts.en:
Niazan is a hardworking lady. She initiated her business of selling milk, as it was difficult to run household activities with the small income of her husband. She is a 55-year-old married woman. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Niazan’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them.

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Niazan has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина, 24 года, замужем, есть дочь, ей 4 года. У Тахмины среднее образование, она уже 4 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Тахмины, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 0,64 ГА собственного земельного надела, где она ежегодно выращивает картофель и кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации, есть фруктовый сад. Также в хозяйстве есть 8 коров и лошадь. Ежемесячный доход от сельскохозяйственной деятельности составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тахмина обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) для покупки телят и овец для откорма, летом она отгонит их на пастбище. Тахмина намерена развить свой бизнес и в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
Tahmina is 24 years old, married, and has a four-year-old daughter. Tahmina has a secondary education. For four years, she has been raising crops and livestock. Thanks to hard work and determination, Tahmina currently has 0.64 hectares of her own land, where she annually grows potatoes and corn for internal consumption and for sale, and she has a fruit garden. Also on her homestead, she has eight cows and a horse. Her monthly income from agricultural activities amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homstead, Tahmina applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase cattle and sheep for fattening. In the summer, she will drive them to pasture. Tahmina intends to develop her business even further.

loans.use: to buy some calves and sheep for  fattening

loans.name: Zoila Ines

texts.es: Zoila tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil casada vive en un lugar muy alejado  de la ciudad donde no existe transporte y carecen de algunos servicios básicos, su esposo  se dedica a cultivar plantas frutales, el negocio con el cual ha podido cubrir las principales  necesidades del hogar es la   crianza de  cerdos pequeños los alimenta con plátano, algunas frutas que perecen en el tiempo, hasta que crezcan para poder venderlos.  Zoila necesita el dinero para construir una chanchera proteger a sus cerdos de depredadores que existen en el lugar evitando perdidas en su negocio aumentando sus ingresos para poder seguir pagando alimentación y algunas medicinas que necesitan.
texts.en:
Zoila is 56 years old and married. She lives far from the city where there is no means of transportation or basic services. Her husband cultivates fruits. His work has been able to cover the main household needs by raising pigs with bananas and by letting some fruits ripe over time until they are ready to be sold.

Zoila requests a loan to build a pigpen to protect their pigs from predators. This would avoid losses in their business to increase their income so that they can continue to pay for food and medicines needed.

loans.use: to build a pigpen.

loans.name: Beangkhamdai Group

texts.en:
Khanxaiyavong is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Khanxaiyavong and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.

The water filter Khanxaiyavong and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years. Khanxaiyavong and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Khanxaiyavong and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 35 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Elvie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Elvie has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Elvie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, noodles.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario es un hombre trabajador de 59 años de edad que vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas de 26 y 24 años de edad a las que ha logrado sacar adelante y aun las apoya en sus estudios superiores. Él presta sus servicios como director de un centro educativo, en el cual muestra todas sus cualidades para apoyar a los alumnos y buscando la manera de mejorar cada día su lugar de trabajo. Mario desea reparar el muro de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para reparar el muro de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Mario is 59 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters at the ages of 26 and 24. He managed to get ahead and even support them through higher education. He serves as a director of a school where he demonstrates his character to support students and find ways to improve the workplace every day.

Mario wants to repair the wall of his home. It has been deteriorated. He requests a loan through FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to repair the wall of his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to repair the wall of his home.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a resident of Badian, a municipality in Cebu. She is a married woman with four children. Her eldest is thirteen and the youngest is two.

Joan works hard to provide for her family. To supplement the income that her husband earns from taking care of a fish pond and driving their tricycle she also sell soft brooms locally known as "walis tambo". As most households in the Phillipines don't own a vacuum, people will use a soft broom instead to sweep the floors.

She is asking for a loan to buy more fiber and bamboos to be used in making soft brooms. This means more production once her materials are ready. Joan hope to expand her business and earn more to have a better income so she can buy what her children need.

loans.use: to buy fiber and bamboo poles.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
56-year-old Eugenia engages in cosmetology services. She provides manicure and pedicure services. She is married and has two children. One of her children is still attending school. Her husband helps defray the family's expenses by engaging in tricycle transportation services. He transports passengers within their locality.

For the past 20 years, she has been serving locals in her place. Her work is done either house-to-house or by appointment with a particular fee.

Eugenia has requested a loan to purchase nail polish, materials like a pusher and items for tricycle maintenance like change oil. With these, she will be able to continue to manage her business and her husband will be able to continue to operate his daily livelihood activity. In the same manner, it allows Eugenia to purchase materials needed in he daily undertaking.

She is hoping that she will be successful in her career and will be able to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, materials like a pusher, and items for tricycle maintenance like change oil.

loans.name: Gibson

texts.en:
Gibson is a married man. He has 4 children. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 39 years old, a teacher, and an entrepreneur. She performs well in her job as a teacher and efficiently manages her direct selling business, photocopying services, and school canteen. It’s amazing how she tackles all these tasks besides raising her five children with Rufino, also a businessman. 

Just recently she was promoted in her direct selling business. It means she has to handle and train several dealers under her. At times she has to pay in advance for pre-ordered products for her dealers, especially if the dealers have insufficient capital. Adelaida needs supplementary capital to sustain her new responsibility. A PHP 20,000 would be very helpful for her. She will use it to pay for shoes, sandals, ready-to-wear clothes, bags, personal care and household products. 

All of her endeavors are geared toward complete college educations for her five children. She also wishes to purchase a lot for future investment. Regarding her business, she envisions it will expand from municipal to provincial wide. She’s a woman of many dreams and big faith to achieve all of them. 

Adelaida is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for shoes, sandals, ready-to-wear clothes, bags, personal care and household products

loans.name: Lorilyn

texts.en:
Lorilyn works hard to support her family. Lorilyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Lorilyn has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Lorilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Razelda

texts.en:
Razelda is 45 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are in school. Razelda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, etc.

Razelda has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future Razelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk and canned goods.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia  is 56 years old, a married woman and a mother of 4 children. She has been doing the business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the household expenses and the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family. 

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has requested a loan of 50000 PKR  to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces in order to meet orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Safia  hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces in order to meet orders on time

loans.name: Lidia Dinora

texts.es:
Lidia, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en construcción y sus tres hijos estudian.

Lidia, se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, como lociones, cosméticos, entre otros; pero el negocio que le genera mayores ganancias es la venta de pupusas en el mercado del pueblo, en donde vende todos los días y se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para preparar los insumos que ocupa para hacer las pupusas.- Ella inicio vendiendo comida típica a la orilla de la carretera principal, pero fue víctima de la delincuencia y decidió irse de ese lugar y opto mejor  por comprar un puesto en el mercado y sus ingresos han mejorado.

Lidia, está solicitando un préstamo para comprar sillas, mesas, utensilios de cocina e insumos para la venta de pupusas, porque ahora que tiene el nuevo local, tiene que adecuarlo para brindar un excelente servicio a sus clientes.

Los sueños de Lidia son, mejorar su vivienda, que sus hijos estudien y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia is 36 years old, studied through high school, and is in a relationship. Her partner works in construction and her three children are in school.

Lidia works selling products by catalog, such as lotions, cosmetics, among others. But the business that generates the most income for her is the sale of pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) in the town market. She sells there every day and wakes up at 4:00am in order to prepare the ingredients she uses to make the pupusas. She started selling food typical of the shore on the main road, but was a victim of crime and decided to leave that location. She decided it was better to buy a post in the market and her income has increased.

Lidia is requesting a loan to buy chairs, tables, cooking utensils, and ingredients to make pupusas. Because she is now in a new location, she has to adapt to it by offering excellent service to her customers. Her dreams are to improve her home, that her children continue to study, and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, cooking utensils, and ingredients to make pupusas.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is the father of five children, is aged 41 years, and lives in Hoima, Uganda.

He deals in stationery, predominantly selling books, pens, and papers, among other items. This is supplemented by farming, mostly growing cassava, beans, and rice.

He hopes to grow and expand his business more, only to be limited by insufficient capital. He will use the loan facility to buy more books and papers to sell.

loans.use: to buy  more books and papers to sell.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Like many women, it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging Riffat to approach Kashf Foundation in search of a loan. Riffat is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children.

In order to support her husband (also shown in the photo) in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good-quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated.

She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo, to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo, to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Del Sector Perez Group

texts.es: Maria es mujer casada con una linda familia por la que se esfuerza todos los días. María como muchas personas han logrado superarse gracias con los créditos que han obtenido en ADICLA, ella cuenta que con su crédito pudo comparar sus hilos y una variedad de güipiles elaboro para venderlos. Maria nuevamente se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más hilos de tipo seda, alemán y lustrina, pues la época navideña se está acercando y con ello la demanda de ropa, con esta inversión espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes. Su esperanza de vida es fortalecer su negocio, y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a married woman with a beautiful family for whom she strives everyday. María, like many people, has be able to overcome thanks to the loans that she has obtained through ADICLA. She says that with her loan, she was able to buy her threads and a variety of elaborate huipiles (traditional blouses) to sell them.

Again María sees the need to request a loan to buy more silk, German, and embroidery thread since the Christmas season is coming and with it the demand for clothing. With this loan she hopes to better meet the needs of her customers. Her life hope is to strengthen her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy silk, German, and embroidery thread to make typical clothing.

loans.name: Ka

texts.en:
Ka, a village chief in Tropaing Ampil village, lives with wife (both in the picture standing in their house back yard) and 5 children. He wants his family to live in better conditions and also for his 5 children to pursue higher education.

As a village chief and also a farmer for over 15 years, he wants his children to be highly educated at least to get a bachelor degree; however, his family is living in a remote area without power grid. As a result, Ka is applying for a Kiva loan to buy high quality solar home systems for his family's safety and his future goal.

His children will be able to study at night time better than before. His whole family also can live in a safe environment.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Tropaing Ampil Village, Pro Snoeb Commune, Rolea P

loans.name: Sofia Susana

texts.es: Sofía tiene 23 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 3 años de edad al que siempre buscan la manera de brindar lo mejor. Ella es una mujer visionaria que siempre buscando la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida presta sus servicios en una venta de calzado, lo cual le permite salir adelante, además cuenta con el apoyo económico y moral de su compañero de vida. Sofía desea mejorar su vivienda, ella sabe que son muchas las  necesidades de su hogar, pero lo que actualmente le preocupa es el piso de su vivienda, el cual es de tierra y el agua se filtra convirtiéndola en lodo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI el cual utilizara para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo de piso y mano de obra para mejorar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sofía is 23 years old and she lives with her life partner and her 3 year old son, for whom they always seek a way to give him the best. She is a visionary woman who is always looking for the way to improve her quality of life. She works selling footwear, which allows her to get ahead. She also has financial and moral support from her life partner.

Sofía wants to improve her house. She knows that her house needs many things, but what currently worries her is the floor of her house, which is made of dirt and the water filters through it turning it into mud. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI which she will use to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick flooring, and manual labor to improve the floor of her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick flooring, and manual labor to improve the floor of her house.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 65 years old, married and a hardworking entrepreneur. Adela operates her sari-sari store (small grocery store) while her husband works as a carpenter.

Adela's store is in front of the street and a lot of customers patronize her store since she opens it as early as 4 am for those who want to have coffee and biscuits.

Adela depends only on themselves for their everyday expenses and maintenance medicine for her illness since they have no children to support them.

Adela is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to buy 5 kilos of sugar, 20 pieces of coffee, biscuits, eggs and other items to sell in her store.

Adela wants to sell breakfast in front of her store in the future to not just for their maintenance medicine but to save up for their old age and unplanned events.

loans.use: to buy 5 kilos of sugar, 20 pieces of coffee, biscuits, eggs and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
La socia Ana es una joven que se dedica a trabajar en una empresa que vende pizzas, con eso se sustenta a diario, pero sus sueños de ella es empezar un negocio de una jugueria.
Socia solicito el préstamo para poder dar los primeros pasos de su negocio, ella necesita el dinero para comprar papaya ,plátano y leche.
Ana está muy agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por confiar en ella y permitirle comenzar a emprender lo que tanto anhela.
La socia se compromete a pagar sus cuotas del crédito puntualmente.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman who makes a living working for a company that sells pizzas. She can support herself from day to day, but her dream is to start a business selling juices.

She asked for a loan in order to take the first steps toward her goal. She needs the money to buy papaya, banana, and milk.

Ana is very grateful to the Kiva investors for trusting in her and helping her to realize her dream. She promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy papaya, banana, and milk.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, de 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos trabajan y el más pequeño está estudiando bachillerato.

Ana, se dedica al comercio informal de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a eso, con su trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles la oportunidad que estudien; Ana, ha decidido comprar un local fijo, para poder invertir más en su negocio y no tener que salir a las calles a vender.
 
Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar mercancía para surtir su nuevo puesto y pagar un adelanto por el local, dice que se siente emocionada de poder tener su propio local, porque por su edad se le dificulta salir caminando a vender. 

Los sueños de Ana, son continuar con su negocio y que su hijo asista a la universidad.
texts.en:
Ana is 57 years old.  She is a single mother.  She has three children, of whom two work and the youngest one is studying in high school.  

Ana works selling informally clothing for women, men, and children.  She has more than 20 years experience in that.  With her job, she has been able to get ahead with her children and give them the opportunity to study.  Ana has decided to buy a permanent store to be able to invest more in her business and not have to go out in the streets to sell.
 
Ana needs the loan to buy merchandise to stock her new store and to pay an advance for the location.  She says that she is excited to be able to have her own place because at her age it is difficult to go out walking to sell.

Ana's dreams are to continue with her business and that her son goes to college.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her new store and to pay an advance for the location.

loans.name: Señor De Los Temblores De Quello Quello Group

texts.es:
La socia   pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores de Quello Quello”, el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Quello Quello del distrito de Pisaq de la provincia del Cusco. 
La socia Lourdes sigue dedicándose a l negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia continua criando a su animales  para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y espera mediante su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta manera continuar apoyando a su familia, a la vez la socia también sigue con su negocio de agricultura, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes  entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Señor de los Temblores de Quello Quello” communal bank, which is located in the Quello Quello community in the Pisaq district, Cusco province. Lourdes, a member, continues with her business of raising small animals. She continues raising her animals in order to later sell them to her customers that request them.

Lourdes is an enterprising woman who hopes to get more earnings through her business. In this way she will continuing supporting her family. At the same time, Lourdes continues with her farming business. This is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs, among others. She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her established payments.

The person with their face covered does not belong to the communal bank. The member whose photo is attached asked permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, among others.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.es: Ronel, tiene la edad  de 39  años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hija, la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de repuestas para hacer la reparación de su vehículo el cual es de suma importancia para hacer el traslado de los materiales utilizados en los trabajos de la finca. Con esta compra espera poder realizar una buena reparación del vehículo y poder tener los materiales a tiempo en la finca y así los cultivos tendrán su asistencia en su momento requerido. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ronel is 39 years old. He is married. He lives with his wife and his daughter who is his main priority.

With the loan he intends to buy parts to do the repairs on his vehicle, which is very important to moving the materials that he uses on the chores of the farm. With this purchase, he hopes to be able to do a good repair of the vehicle and to be able to have the materials on time at the farm, and thus the crops will have his assistance at the required moment.

It is the first loan that he received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans before in the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him the loan with better faculties and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair his work vehicle.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is a married 54-year-old woman who has 2 children. Her husband is a farmer. Laura has been in a bakery & retail business for 20 years and her income is better from this. Her previous loan was used for additional capital for her bakery business. She has repaid her previous loan successfully and is now planning to apply for a new loan to buy goods for the small store. The rest of the net proceeds will be used to repair their house for the safety of her family. She hopes for stability for her business in order to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy goods for the retail business & to be used for home repair

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 50 años de edad está casada, su esposo es jornalero viven en  una zona muy lejana carecen de  algunos servicios básicos,  tiene tres hijos Bizmar de 17, Jenny de 16 y Dadison de 11 años de edad ellos están estudiando en escuelas gratuitas del sector,  cultiva mora, naranjilla, siriota, este pequeño negocio ha sido el único sustento desde hace 10 años atrás para su familia. Olga necesita el dinero para comprar abono  mejoraría asi su producción y obtendría ingresos para seguir alimentando y educando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olga is 50 years old and married. Her husband is a day laborer. They live in a very remote area. They lack some basic services. She has three children: Bizmar is 17, Jenny is 16, and Dadison is 11. They are all attending free schools in the area.

Olga grows blackberries, naranjilla and chayote. This small business has been the sole means of support for her family for the last 10 years. Olga needs the money to buy fertilizer to improve her production and obtain income to continue feeding and educating her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her plants, increasing her production.

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en:
Sughra was living a tough life some years ago; it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is a 61-year-old, married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband.

She has buffalo for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.

She has two children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 60,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income, in order to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
La socia Placida es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, trabaja casi todo el día, y las necesidades de fin de año son diversas es por eso que la socia solicito el préstamo para comprar aceite, papa, pollo y carne; víveres que necesita para su hogar y sus tres hijos.
la socia está contenta y complacida con el préstamo porque así ella seguirá adelante y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
The member, Placida, is a very responsible and hard-working person who works almost all day. Her year-end needs are varied and that is why the member applied for the loan to buy cooking oil, potatoes, chicken and meat; groceries that she needs for her household and three children.

The member is happy and satisfied with the loan because with it she will move ahead, and she promises to make the agreed upon installment payments.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, potatoes, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, tiene la edad  de 54 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su esposo, el cual es su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de ropa para la venta a clientes de la comunidad y a su alrededor, y de esta manera poderle ofreces a los clientes una mayor cantidad de productos para el uso personal y todos de buena calidad. Con esta compra pretende tener mejores ingresos para invertir más en su negocio y cumplir metas que en el futuro le mejorará su calidad de vida para él y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Maritza, age 54, is in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband, who is her greatest priority. She plans to use the loan to buy clothes to sell to customers in the community and surrounding areas. This way she will be able to offer her customers a greater quantity of products, all good quality, for their personal use. With this purchase she plans to have better earnings in order to invest more in her business. She also plans to meet goals that will in the future improve her quality of life and that of her family.

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not previously had other loans with state banks. FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with the easiest terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sell clothes.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen a is 41-year-old, married woman with two children. She has been providing services of flour grinding in her community to contribute in the family income.

She knows the techniques of grinding very well and has much experience in this work. By this time, she has become famous for providing fine quality flour and earns enough to support the needs of her family members.

In order to purchase a new grinding machine, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). It would help her to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

She wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Katia Liseth

texts.es: Con 25 años de edad Katia siempre muestra todo su empeña en la realización de sus actividades diarias, ella es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos una niña de 2 años y un varón de 5 años de edad. Katia es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a prestar sus servicios de atención al cliente en una venta de calzado, lo cual le permite brindar lo mejor que está en sus manos a sus hijos. Katia desea construir un pasamanos en el corredor de su vivienda, ya que por la edad de sus hijos, ella siente que necesitan mayor seguridad, además las láminas que ha colocado para cerrar son un peligro para ellos por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro para construir un pasamanos en su corredor para proteger a sus hijos y evitar el peligro de las láminas.
texts.en:
At 25 years old, Katia always gives 100% to carrying out her daily activities. She is a single mother who lives with her two children: a 2-year-old girl and a 5-year-old boy. Katia is a hard-working woman who works in customer service at a shoe store. This allows her to provide her children with the best within her reach.

Katia wants to build a railing in the corridor of her home, because, based on her children's ages, she feels that they need more security. Besides, the pieces of sheet metal that she arranged to enclose it are hazardous. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, bricks and wrought iron to build a handrail in her corridor to protect her children and avoid the danger from the sheet metal.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and wrought iron to build a railing on her hallway to protect her children and avoid the danger from the sheet metal.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa continua dedicándose a su negocio de agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales menores y venta de verduras.
La socia lucha por su familia y aporta gastos en el hogar con estas actividades. su negocio de venta de verduras es trabajoso pero le va muy bien. Por eso la socia solicito el préstamo para comprar lechuga, pimiento,pepino y cebolla. 
La socia está contenta y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por el crédito y asegura que pagaras sus cuotas en los plazos acordados.
texts.en:
Rosa continues devoting herself to her business of farming, livestock, raising small animals, and selling vegetables. She struggles for her family and contributes to the household activities with these business activities. Her business of selling vegetables is arduous, but it is going very well for her.

She is requesting the loan to buy lettuce, peppers, cucumbers, and onions. She is happy and grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loans. She pledges to make her payments according to the agreed upon time frame.

loans.use: to buy lettuce, peppers, cucumbers, and onions.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en: Iram is a married woman who wants to support her husband financially. They have been running a shoe-making business for many years and have a good client list. Iram needs to increase sales to fulfill the basic needs of the family. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR  to buy raw materials, such as leather, plastic leather, polishes, etc., to increase production. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and earn more income. She intends to use part of the profits for her family's betterment and well-being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as leather, plastic leather, polishes, etc., to increase production in her shoe-making business.

loans.name: Shaneela

texts.en:
Shaneela is a 29-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 50,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices, and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently, in order to get a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices, and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently.

loans.name: Alba Nidia

texts.es:
La joven  Alba Nidia de 29  años de edad es casada y  vive con su esposo y su  hijo en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 04  años al negocio de venta de Tortillas, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y personas que transitan por la zona,  Ella vive en el municipio de San José  Choluteca  al sur de Honduras, ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.  
Alba esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como, maíz  y leña,  con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende comprar los productos por mayor y conseguir mejores precios, al mismo tiempo  mejorara sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Alba su sueño es crecer su negocio tener más clientela para poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – OCTUBRE  2015.
texts.en:
Young Alba Nidia is 29 years old and married. She lives with her husband and son in a house that she owns. She has been selling tortillas for the past four years. Her customers are all her neighbors, friends and people who are passing through the neighborhood. She lives in the town of San José Choluteca, south of Honduras. She's an enterprising woman with the drive to get ahead, and she strives on a daily basis to improve her living conditions.

Alba requests this loan in order to purchase supplies such as corn and firewood. With the help of this loan she intends to buy wholesale supplies and get better prices. At the same time, she'll improve her profits and also her living conditions. She's a recurring client who wishes to work with Prisma.

Alba's dream is to make her business grow and get more customers so that she can improve her profits and her living conditions;

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
La señora Alma Delia de 37  años de edad, es casada y vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio ella vende, arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, huevos, harina, salsas, espaguetis, pan, churros, frescos, jugos y otros más, también 2 veces por semana ella elabora Pan para vender y lo vende en su comunidad y aveses manda a vender al pueblo con sus hijas,  Ella vive en la aldea El Coyolar de San José Choluteca al sur de Honduras, ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Alma esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería  con pollo, arroz, frijoles, maseca, manteca, jabón, frescos, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma y KIVA.
Doña Alma su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido, y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - OCTUBRE  2015.
texts.en:
Alma Delia is 37 years old, married and lives with her huband and children in their own home. For 5 years now she has dedicated her time to selling groceries. In her business she sells rice, sugar, lard, beans, eggs, flour, sauces, spaghetti, bread, donuts, soft drinks, juices and other items. In addition, twice a week she makes bread to sell. She sells it in her community and sometimes sends her daughters to sell in town. She lives in the village of El Coyolar near San José, Choluteca in southern Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead and she strives every day to improve her quality of life.

Alma is requesting a loan to buy products to supply the grocery store with chicken, rice, beans, Maseca brand corn flour, lard, soap, soft drinks, etc. With the support of this loan, she intends to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a new client who wants to work with Prisma and KIVA.

Alma's dream is to have a good business that is well stocked, and at the same time to improve her future and that of her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - OCTOBER 2015.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, beans, corn flour, lard, soap, soft drinks, etc. for her business

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself as God-fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothing.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 49 years old, and a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their 5 children.

Currently, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater for maximum customers and generate a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater for maximum customers and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at home, as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Musarat is known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing some difficulties in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material, such as thread in different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth, to stitch up more dresses on time. She hopes increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as thread in different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth, to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila has been doing a business of shoe-making for many years. She is an energetic person and eager to support her family. She is responsible for taking care of the basic necessities of her children, including food, health and clothing. She is also accountable for improving their standard of living. By the support of Kashf Foundation she is fulfilling her dreams and is able to manage her children’s education.

Now she has requested 50,000 PKR to buy additional materials for making shoes including leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles, etc. In this way, she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence, better support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for making shoes including leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles, etc.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 49 years old and a hardworking entrepreneur.

Dolores, though single, has two adopted children whom she raised, supported and treated as her own. She used to buy broken jewelry and get the gold and silver to sell but decided to be a scrapper when her eyesight got blurry. Dolores operates her scrap/junk shop from her parents. She buys scrap from individual scrappers, collects it in her storage house and sells it in bulk in a large recycling company.

Dolores has four helpers helping her in cleaning, lifting and delivering the scrap/junk. Dolores is also fair in her employee wages and emergency money for their health.

Dolores' buyers are requesting bulk of scrap from her but due to lack of capital she cannot supply it to them.

Dolores is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to buy bulk of metals, plastics and wood scraps to sell in the recycling company.

The loan will enable her to open her other storage area to store collected scrap materials before selling it to her buyers. Dolores hopes to expand her business to provide comfortably for her family and help her community by employment.

loans.use: to buy bulk of metals, plastics and wood scraps to sell in a recycling company.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru:
Хосият 47 летняя жительница района Носири Хусрав. Носири Хусрав находится на юго-западной части Таджикистана. Носири Хусрав самая теплая точка Республики. Хосият проживает здесь давно. Она мать одного ребенка. У нее 24 летный сын.
    Хосият в  родном районе занимается земледелием. Этой деятельностью она занята уже 4 лет. В этой работе ей нравится, то что она может заработать своим честно нажитым трудом.
   На данный момент все сельские жители уже закончили посев урожая, и Хосият не стала исключением. Она закончила посев и сейчас ей необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай. Но для купли достаточного количества минеральных удобрений ей не хватает не большой суммы денег, и по той причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Khosiyat is a 47-year-old resident of the Nosiri Khusrav region, which is located in the south-west of Tajikistan and is the warmest part of the country. She has been living here a long time and is the mother of one child, a 24-year-old son.

Khosiyat works in agriculture in her region, a business she has had for four years. She likes this work because she can earn a living with her own honest effort.

At the moment all the rural residents have already finished planting, and Khosiyat is no exception. She has finished planting and now needs to fertilize the soil so she will receive a rich and high-quality harvest. However, she doesn't have enough money to buy the necessary quantity of fertilizer, and for this reason she is looking for a loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mchicha Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a widow in her late 50s who has five children, two of whom are still in school. The other three children are grown up. She has been selling clothes, especially madila, for thirteen years. She works from 9:00 am to 5:30 pm daily and is able to make a small profit each month.

This will be Mariam's 19th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to improve her business by increasing her stock of clothing. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees for her two kids, reinvest in her business, renovate her house, repay the loan, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date clothing, commonly known as madila, to meet her customers' needs. Mariam dreams of opening up a clothing shop in a different area.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group Mchicha, which consists of four members who will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date clothing, commonly known as madila, to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a 44-year-old married woman who has 4 children. Some years ago, Shahida was hardly managing her household activities with the small income of her husband. Then through loans from Kashf Foundation, she started her own hand embroidery business. Shahida is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns by hand. Her skill is known throughout the town where she lives. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, thread, and embroidery frames to fulfill her customers' orders on time and earn a good profit. This monetary help can take Shahida closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, thread, and embroidery frames to fulfill her customers' orders on time and earn a good profit.

loans.name: Ddc Group

texts.en:
Mwamvua, who is in her mid 60s, is a widow with four children who are grown up but taking care of four grandchildren who are still in school. She has been running two projects, a grocery store and selling fried fish, for seven years now.

This will be Mwamvua's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the fish stock and to start a grocery store, and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group, whose members can now take care of themselves and their families. All are taking their children to good schools, and all Mwamvua's kids have managed to finish their studies without having school fee problems.

She used the profit to repay loans; to pay her grandchildren's school fees; to buy a plot of land; to buy a TV set, sofa set, a radio, beds, and mattresses; and to build her house and cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy the bestselling drinks in her grocery store and to increase on fish stock, as well as buying cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

She dreams of selling big tons of fish outside the country.

Mwanvua will share this loan with her loan group Ddc, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the bestselling drinks in her grocery store and to increase on fish stock, as well as buying cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Эту прекрасную женщину зовут Шарофат. Ей 54 лет. Она семейная женщина и проживает в районе Шахритус с сыновьями, невесткой и тремя внуками. Сыновья занимается земледелием и животноводством. Шарофат хорошая бабушка, у нее 3 маленьких внука в возрасте 5, 2 и 1 годика. Она очень любит свою семью. 
Шарофат занимается земледелием уже более 20 лет. Она серьезная и ответственная женщина. Шарофат занимается посевом бахчевых культур и в этой деятельности ей помогают сыновья. Они является главными помощниками Шарофат. Ей надо подготовить землю  для нового посева урожая, но у Шарофат нет достаточных денег, чтобы достичь своих целей,  по этой причине Шарофат обратилась за кредитом для купли минеральных удобрений, семян пшеницу и всего, что необходимо для посева урожая. Этот кредит поможет ей во время провести новый посев и получить качественный урожай. Шарофат ждет Вашу поддержку и доброту.
texts.en:
This wonderful woman is called Sharofat. She is 54 and a family woman who lives in the Shahrituz region with her sons, her daughter-in-law and her three grandchildren. Her sons work in agriculture and animal husbandry. Sharofat is a good grandmother and has three little grandchildren aged five, two and one. She loves her family very much.

Sharofat has been working in agriculture for more than 20 years. She is a serious and responsible woman. She plants various kinds of melon with the help of her sons, who are her primary helpers. She needs to get the land ready for new crops, but she doesn't have enough money to achieve her goals, and for this reason is looking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer, wheat seeds and everything else she needs for planting. This loan will help her to plant new crops and receive a quality harvest. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and wheat seeds

loans.name: Tujuane Kibaha Group

texts.en: Pili is a single woman in her late 40s who has three children – two daughters and one son who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for one and a half years. She works from 6:00 am to 12:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Pili's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to increase her food stock and has repaid the loan successfully. She used the profit to reinvest in her business, repay the loan, and cover her household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her food store. She dreams of expanding her business one day. Pili will share this loan with her loan group Tujuane Kibaha, which consists of three members who will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her food store.

loans.name: Jakelin De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Jakelin de Jesus de 30  años de edad es casada y vive con su esposo e  hijos  en su  casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 6  años al negocio de venta de Mercadería como ser  pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, bresieres, biquinis, sandalias de mujer, tenis, lociones, cremas, y también un poco de achinería,  y otros más,  sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y empleados de la alcaldía de la escuela, del colegio, los policías y también tiene clientes en las aldeas vecinas, Ella radica en el municipio de San José Choluteca,  al sur de Honduras, ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Jackelin esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de más productos como pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, bresieres, biquinis, sandalias, Etc.  y así poder surtir su negocio para la temporada buena que se acerca, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma y KIVA.
Jackelin su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - OCTUBRE  2015.
texts.en:
Jakelin de Jesus is 30 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in her own house. She has been working for six years selling merchandise like pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, spandex, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, bras, bikinis, women's sandals, sneakers, lotions, creams, and also some low-cost consumer goods, among other things. Her clients are all neighbors, friends, and workers from the town hall, elementary school, high school, police, as well as customers from the neighboring towns. She settled down in the San José Choluteca Municipality in southern Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead, and she fights daily to better her quality of life.

Jackelin is asking for a loan to buy more products like pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, spandex, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, bras, bikinis, sandals, etc., and in this way to stock her business for the good season that is approaching. With the help of this loan, she hopes to better her income and her quality of life. She is a repeat customer with a desire to work with Prisma and KIVA.

Jackelin dreams of having a good business, increasing her clientele, and at the same time bettering her future with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, spandex, t-shirts, dresses, skirts, bras, bikinis, sandals, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 40 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. Her business is a retail store. She has been in the business for two years. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 PHP.

This is her ninth loan term with GDMPC. She will use the loan to buy stocks of milk, sugar, coffee, detergents, etc. for her store.

She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her child and will reinvest the rest in the business to boost it. Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially-stable business and grow it into a wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy stocks of milk, sugar, coffee, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is 33 years old, married and has two children. To gain income, he offers transport services to the people in his village. He wants to continue offering safe travel to all of his passengers. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy tires, oils, and pay for maintenance of the motorcycle.

Bonifacio hopes to continue offering safe travel to all of his passengers and acquire good profits for education and emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy tires, oil, and pay for maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yesenia, de 18 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, el cual con mucho esfuerzo está sacando adelante con los ingresos que obtiene al laborar como empleada doméstica y en su casa vive con sus dos hermanos, sus padres y su hijo.

Yesenia, trabaja como domestica desde que era una niña, inicio trabajando en una pupusería en la capital cuando tenía 12 años de edad, pero perdió su trabajo cuando quedó embarazada; después de tener a su bebé y cumplir el período de dieta por el parto, comenzó a trabajar en una tortillería en la ciudad más cercana y en ese lugar ha laborando durante los últimos dos años y su horario de trabajo inicia a las 5:30 a.m. y termina a las 2:00 p.m.

Yesenia, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz y una plancha para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de tortillas, este negocio lo colocará en su comunidad, porque en ese lugar nadie vende tortillas y está segura que será rentable.

Yesenia, sueña con que su hijo estudie y tenga las oportunidades que ella no pudo tener; pero también sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa y de esta manera poder independizarse de sus padres e iniciar una nueva vida con su hijo.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 18 years old and went to school up until third grade.She is a single mother and has a 3 year old child. With a lot of effort she supports her child with the income she earns working as a maid. She lives with her two siblings, her parents and her son.

Yesenia has worked as a maid since she was a child. When she was 12 years old, she started working in a pupusería, a stand that sells pupusas (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans), in the capital, but she lost that job when she got pregnant. After the baby was born and the postpartum quarantine had passed, she started working in a tortilla stand in a closer city. She has worked there for the last two years. Her workday is from 5:30 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.

Yesenia needs the loan to buy corn and a griddle to start her own business selling tortillas. She will open her business in her community because no one sells tortillas there and she is confident that it will be profitable.

Yesenia dreams to see her son study and have the opportunities she never had. She also dreams of buying some land to build her own house in order to become independent from her parents and start a new life with her son.

loans.use: buy corn and a griddle to start her own business selling tortillas.

loans.name: Selpha

texts.en: Selpha is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the 24,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is a married man. He has eight children. He describes himself as responsible. He operates a retail business where he sells livestock. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are butcheries. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more livestock. His business goal is to own a big ranch within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for 19 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of pastures. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a single woman. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to increase the capital base of the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Yolanda Judith

texts.es:
La joven Yolanda de 25  años de edad es casada y  vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 04  años al negocio de venta de Tortillas, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y personas que transitan por la zona, vive en una aldea  al sur de Honduras.
Yolanda es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Yolanda está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz y leña para fortalecer su negocio con materia prima,  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un clienta nueva  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Octubre del  2015.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 25 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her son in a house they own. For the last 4 years she has worked selling tortillas. Her clients are all her neighbors, friends and people who travel through the zone. She lives in a small village in the south of Honduras.

Yolanda is an enterprising woman who wishes to get ahead in life and strives every day to improve her quality of life.

Yolanda is requesting a loan to buy raw material such as corn and firewood to strengthen her business. With the support she will get from this loan, she pretends to increase her income and also improve her quality of life. She is a new client and wants to work with Prisma.

She dreams to keep improving her quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – October, 2015.

loans.use: buy corn and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brígida es una socia muy trabajadora y empeñosa ella continua dedicándose a sus negocios de crianza de animales y venta de jora.
La socia quiere seguir ampliando su negocio de venta de animales, y seguir yendo por sus sueños que es abrir una tienda de abarrotes.
Brigida solicito el préstamo para comprar alfalfa y maíz ,ya que necesita estos materiales para sus negocios tanto para sus gallinas y cuyes y para producir jora. Ella se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Brigida is a very hard-working and persevering [communal bank] member. She continues working in her businesses of raising animals and selling jora [a corn-based beverage].

She wants to continue expanding her business of animal sales and continue going for her dream, which is to open a grocery store.

Brigida is applying for this loan to purchase alfalfa and corn, since she needs these materials for her businesses, for her hens and guinea pigs as well as for producing jora. She promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy corn and alfalfa

loans.name: Sangak

texts.ru: Сангак из района Шахритус. Он сильный и трудолюбивый человек. Сангак не боится трудиться. Он всегда движется, ему не нравится сидеть без дел. Сангак много лет выращивает крупнорогатого скота. У него имеется коровник и земельный участок. Сангак еще на земле выращивает овощи. Он свободное время помогает соседям на работе. Сангак женат и имеет детей. У него есть прекрасная семя и ради семьи он живет и трудится. Сангак просит кредит для купли скота. Он хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить животноводческую деятельность. Сангак больше не кому обратиться.
texts.en:
Sangak is from the Shahrituz region. He is a strong and hardworking person who is not afraid to work hard. He is always moving - he doesn't like sitting around with nothing to do. He has been raising cattle for many years; he has a cowshed and a piece of land where he also grows vegetables. In his free time he helps his neighbours with their work. He is married with children. He has a wonderful family for whom he lives and works.

Sangak is requesting a loan to purchase livestock. He wants to increase his head count and expand his animal husbandry business. He has no one else to turn to.

loans.use: to buy livestock and expand his animal husbandry business

loans.name: Neheru Group

texts.en:
This group is formed in the year 2015 at J.K.Pur village district in Rayagada, Odisha, India. There are six active self-dependent women, with the objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood.

Rashmita is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and the group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing third from right with raised hand in the photo. She is about 27 years old and living with her husband and only son.

She has engaged in tailoring jobs for the last six years with the support of her husband. Through the concerned business, they earn a monthly income of 8,000 INR. Rashmita planned to improve her business in the course of the loan. She will purchase another sewing machine and a Pico machine. She will appoint new staff and expand her business.

The other five members of her group are also smart at their professions and also actively engaged with different businesses like a newspaper business, tailoring, a cement business, and an electrical equipment shop.

It will be the second cycle loan for the group. A previous loan helped the group to strengthen their financial condition with increased income and the repayment behavior was also very good. From this loan, all the group members hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine and a Pico machine.

loans.name: Anita's Group

texts.en:
Anita, standing to the right hand side in the photograph, lives in a small Village in Manmad, Maharashtra, India with her husband and 1-year-old daughter. She is a differently abled lady. Anita and her husband run a poultry business from their small home. Over the last eight years, this young entrepreneur has acquired the skills of animal husbandry and developed a loyal clientele.

But, as with most small-scale businesses, gathering the financial resources to expand her venture remains a major challenge for the 26-year-old. She, along with her group member, has applied for a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. Her portion of the loan amount will allow her to invest in more than five dozen chickens and also provide for their fodder, transportation, and necessary medication.

Anita hopes that this loan will increase her profits and will ultimately take her business to the next level.

loans.use: to invest in more than five dozen chickens and also provide for their fodder, transportation, and necessary medication.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a Kiva borrower. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a food stall where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Safarmoh

texts.ru: Сафармох 38 лет. Она замужем и мать 3 детей. У Сафармох прекрасная семья.  У нее 1 дочка и 2 маленьких сыночек. Сафармох честная и трудолюбивая женщина.   Она занимается земледелием в родном районе. Сафармох занята этой деятельностью  уже более 10 лет, и она, не смотря на холодную и жаркую погоду, работает на земле. Она с молодостью занимается земледелием.  Сафармох на работе помогает   дочь. Ей сейчас надо готовить почву земли, для посева урожая. Она обратилась за кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и качественные семена  урожая.
texts.en:
Safarmoh is 38 and married with three children. She has a wonderful family, one daughter and two little sons. She is an honest and hardworking woman who works in agriculture in her native region, an occupation she has had for more than 10 years. She works the land despite the hot summer and cold winters, and has been doing so since she was young. Her daughter helps her with her work.

Safarmoh needs to prepare the soil to plant new crops. She is looking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and quality seeds to plant.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and quality seeds for planting

loans.name: Idimoh

texts.ru: Идимох жительница района Яван. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Сыновьям  9, 7 и 4 лет.  Ее муж занимается разнорабочим. Идимох домохозяйка, и она занимается пошивом,  шьет национальную женскую одежду и школьную детскую форму у себя дома. Идимох 2 года своей жизни занята с этой деятельностью. Она хочет купить швейную машинку модели «YAMATA», чтоб улучшить процесс своей работы. Ей не хватает денег, чтобы купить желаемую швейную машинку, и она обратилась за кредитом. Идимох верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Idimoh is a resident of the Yavan region. She is 45 and married with three children, all sons, aged nine, seven and four. Her husband works as a handyman, while Idimoh is a homemaker who also earns money sewing from home. She makes women's clothing in the traditional style and children's school uniforms. She has worked in this business for two years.

Idimoh wants to buy a new Yamata sewing machine in order to improve her workflow. She doesn't have enough money to buy the sewing machine she wants, so she is looking for a loan. She trusts in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy a Yamata sewing machine

loans.name: Yanira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yanira, de 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de 16 y 6 años de edad, ella no pudo estudiar porque depende de una familia muy humilde y su padre falleció cuando ella era una niña y su madre trabajaba en una finca de café para llevar el alimento a ella y a su hermano, actualmente en su casa vive con sus dos hijos, su hermano y su madre que ya es bastante anciana.

Yanira, se ha dedicado a trabajar como empleada doméstica y a trabajar en la agricultura junto a sus hijos y su hermano, actualmente ella ha decidido colocar una pequeña tienda en su casa, porque vive a un costado de la cancha de fútbol de la comunidad y las ventas son muy buenas los días de partido, durante los otros días las ventas bajan pero siempre tiene su ingreso de dinero.

Yanira, necesita el préstamo para comprar golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, jugos, maíz, frijol, arroz, entre otros productos para vender y terminar de surtir su negocio, al comprar estos productos asegurara  una mayor cantidad de clientes ya que encontraran todo lo que necesitan.

Yanira, sueña con mejorar su vivienda porque es una casa de adobe y con las lluvias se ha deteriorado mucho, además desea que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y se gradúen de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Yanira, 37, is a single mother of two children, ages 16 and 6. She could not go to school because she comes from a family of very modest means, and her father died when she was a child. Her mother worked on a coffee plantation to feed her and her brother. She currently lives in her house with her two children, her brother and her mother who is very old.

Yanira has made a living working as a housekeeper and also from farming with her children and brother. She has now decided to put a small store in her house because she lives alongside the community soccer field and sales are very good on game days. On other days, sales drop but she always has an income.

Yanira needs a loan to buy candies, cookies, sodas, juices, corn, beans, rice, among other products to sell, and finish stocking her business. Buying these items will ensure a greater number of clients since they will be able to find everything they need.

Yanira dreams of improving her home because her house is made of adobe and has deteriorated a lot from the rain. She also wishes for her children to be able to keep going to school and graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: buy candies, cookies, sodas, juices, corn, beans, rice, among other products to sell, and finish stocking her business.

loans.name: Ubertina

texts.es:
Ubertina continúa trabajando en su negocio de crianza de animales y la venta de chicha.
Estos dos negocios sustenta a su familia y ella sigue adelante todos los días trabajando desde horas de la madrugada.
la socia solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz y pasto. Para poder alimentar mejor a sus animalitos y poderlo vender a mejor precio.
la socia está contenta y agradece a los inversionistas a de KIVA por el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Ubertina keeps working in her businesses of breeding livestock and selling chicha (sweet drink made from purple corn).

These two businesses help support her family and she keeps going, working every day from dawn. .

She requested the loan to buy corn and grass in order to better feed her animals to be able to sell them for a better price.

She is happy and thanks the KIVA investors for the loan granted.

loans.use: buy corn and grass.

loans.name: Cyprus

texts.en:
Cyprus is married with children. He operates a butcher shop and grazes cows as well. He has been in that business for three years now and is doing well.

He has a responsibility of paying school fees for his children. His greatest desire is to build a residential house, and he is at his peak to achieving it.

He is requesting money to buy more cattle for slaughtering and selling. He will be indebted to you for your help. He intends to use the loan to buy cows for slaughtering and selling.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering and selling.

loans.name: Umut

texts.ru: Умут, 50 лет, в разводе, есть взрослая дочь, уже растут внуки. У Умут неоконченное высшее образование, занимается животноводством и полеводством. У Умут болят ноги, поэтому по хозяйству ей во всем помогает ее внук. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 6 овец, 4 коровы. На 2,50 Га собственной земли выращивает люцерну для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Умут обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Умут планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и образование ее внука.
texts.en:
Umut is 50 and divorced with an adult daughter who has her own children. She has a partial university education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture. She has sore legs, and so her grandson helps her with everything around the farm. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has six sheep and four cows on her farm as well as 2.5 hectares of her own land where she grows alfalfa for sale and for her own use. Her monthly income is 14,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her farm, Umut has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan info further developing her business and educating her grandson.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth es una socia muy trabajadora y continua trabajando en su tienda de abarrotes, con esta actividad aporta a su familia para salir adelante.
La socia solicito el préstamo para ampliar su negocio y comprar aceite, fideos y gaseosas. Para poder dar más ofertas a sus clientes y más opciones de compra en esta temporada de fin de año.
Yaneth está contenta y satisfecha por el préstamo otorgado por los inversionistas de KIVA, se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a hardworking member and continues working in her grocery store. With this work, she supports her family to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to expand her business and buy oil, noodles, and soda in order to give more offerings to her customers, and more options for purchase in this season at the end of the year. She is content and happy for the loan from the Kiva lenders, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy oil, noodles, and soda to stock her store.

loans.name: Namely

texts.en:
Namely lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 26 years old and married with two children, both of whom attend school. He ventured into operating a drug shop. He also practices farming, predominantly growing cassava and beans, in order to raise income to support his family.

He has always wanted to diversify his business as well as to develop and grow his business. However, inadequate capital hinders his desires. He is seeking credit to stock up his drug shop by buying drugs to sell.

loans.use: to stock up his drug shop by buying drugs to sell.

loans.name: Roweida

texts.en:
Roweida is a 33-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children. She is a housewife and her husband is responsible for satisfying the family's needs and for enabling them to have a good lifestyle.
