Today, in order to pay her children’s end-of-school-year fees, she is applying for a new loan. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to pay the school fees and ensure appropriate education for them.

loans.use: to pay her children’s end-of-school-year fees.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
La señora Gumercinda de 61  años de edad es casada y  vive con su esposo e hijas  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 15  años al negocio de venta de rosquillas, quesadillas y tamales de cerdo y de pollo, junto a su hija elaboran estos productos tres veces por semana, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y personas que transitan por la zona.
Doña Gumercinda vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras,  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Gumercinda está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, carne de cerdo, leña, cuajada, condimentos, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida es una clienta nuevo  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Octubre del  2015.
texts.en:
Señora Gumercinda, who is 61 years old, is married and lives with her husband and daughters in her own house. For 15 years she has worked in the business of selling rosquillas [a cookie-like snack], quesadillas, and pork and chicken tamales. She makes these products with her daughter three times a week. Her customers are all neighbors, friends, and people who pass through the zone.

Doña Gumercinda lives in a small town in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She is an entrepreneurial woman with the desire to get ahead, and she strives day after day to improve her quality of life.

Doña Gumercinda is applying for the loan to buy corn, pork, firewood, fresh cheese, condiments, etc. With the help of this loan, she plans to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a new client with the desire to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to continue improving her quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn, pork, firewood, fresh cheese, condiments, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira con 43 años de edad,de estado civil separada, vive junto a sus dos hijas, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y tubérculos en el mercado de Cayaltí y Oyotún los días martes y domingos respectivamente, con una experiencia en el rubro hace varios años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: papas,zanahorias,tomates,etc. De esta manera le facilitará seguir trabajando y obtener mayores ingresos.

Rosa Elvira cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio recurrente para Edpýme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira is 43 years old, is separated, and lives with her two daughters. They live in the Cayaltí district, in the Chiclayo province, in the department of Lambayeque, in Perú. She has very good personal and professional references from the citizens in the area. The people in this area work mostly in agriculture, business, and livestock farming.

Rosa works in the sale of vegetables and tubers in the markets in Cayaltí and Oyotún on Tuesdays and Sundays, respectively. She has some years of experience in this field. Additionally, she works raising and selling small animals.

She is requesting a loan to buy goods such as potatoes, carrots, and tomatoes. In this way it will make it easier for her to continue working and obtain greater income.

She has experience as a borrower and is a returning borrower with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy goods such as potatoes, carrots, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda is a 39-year-old married mother living with her husband and four children. Her husband is the main income earner for the family. He owns a book shop in his town, and she works as a private teacher for extra money.

With the aim of helping her children with their education, Hoda is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. in order to be able to pay the school fees for her children's education. Her only dream is to ensure them a good life, always being able to satisfy their needs, and help them to achieve high educational levels.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her children's education.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 46 años es un hombre trabajador y responsable, él reside en compañía de su cónyuge en un barrio de Soledad, localidad en el Atlántico con el mayor crecimiento demográfico de todo el país. Durante 10 años estuvo empleado en una fábrica de cojines donde logró adquirir el conocimiento y la experiencia en su elaboración, en el año 2009,  le apostó al emprendimientos y  decidió retirarse de aquella empresa para colocar su propio negocio.  Hoy en día lleva 6 años en su microempresa de cojines con muy buenos resultados, ofreciendo diseños exclusivos a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son almacenes, misceláneas y particulares. Daniel desea aprovechar la temporada decembrina para elaborar cojines navideños y encontró en un credikiva, la oportunidad de vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para financiar este proyecto, así logrará comprar telas con decoraciones navideñas, hilos, esponjas de diferentes tipos y demás accesorios.  Esta inversión le permitirá responder a los pedidos de sus clientes y obtener excelentes utilidades.
texts.en:
Daniel is a 46 year old, hardworking, responsible man. He lives with his spouse in a neighborhood of Soledad, a place on the Atlantic, with the greatest demographic growth in all the country. For 10 years he was employed in a pillow factory, where he was able to acquire knowledge and experience regarding how pillows are made. In 2009 he ventured out as an entrepreneur, and decided to leave that business and start his own. Today he's been in his micro enterprise making pillows for 6 years, with very good results. He offers exclusive designs to his customers, who for the most part are stores, corner stores, and individuals.

Daniel wants to take advantage of the December season to make Christmas pillows. In Kiva, he found an opportunity to link himself to the world of financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, in order to finance this project. In this way he will be able to buy fabrics with Christmas designs, threads,different types of foam, and other accessories. This investment will allow him to fill the orders of his customers, and bring in excellent profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric with Christmas designs, threads, different types of foam, and other accessories.

loans.name: Ndemi Maendeleo Ya Wanaume Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand is John. He is 48 years old, married, and blessed with three children.

Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa intervention, John has been able to improve his farming business by keeping good records. The group has completed all the training modules of Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. They do vegetable farming to earn a living.

John is borrowing from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer to improve his farming business. He looks forward to more income that will enable him meet family needs with ease. He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly as his enterprise is doing well.

loans.use: to buy  farm inputs such as fertilizer to improve his farming business.

loans.name: Gs Maquengale Group

texts.es:
El Señor Jose tiene 50 años de edad, es padre de 4  hijos, convive con su compañera de hogar. Su actividad principal  es el comercio donde cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de esta actividad y tambien se dedica a compra de cerdos, compra de granos basicos y tambien se dedica a la caficultura que para este año espera muy buena produccion de café.
Don José su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, con el credito  que esta solicitando podra obtener la planta solar,  sueño que ha tenido desde hace tiempo el cual se le hara realidad con el apoyo de la Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras y KIVA.
Los demas integrantes se dedican a la elaborcion de queso y a la produccion de Platano lo integran: Raul y Juana, ellos tamien sueñan tener energia en sus hogares para cambiarle la vida a sus familias.


                                                                                                     Trojes, Honduras - Octubre 2015
texts.en:
Señor José is 50 years old. He is the father of four children and lives with his home companion. His principal business is commerce, where he has a lot of experience in managing this activity, and he also buys pigs and basic grains and works in coffee farming, where this year he expects a very good production of coffee.

Don José's dream is to improve the living conditions of his family. With the loan that he is applying for, he will be able to obtain a solar power system, a dream which he has had for quite some time and which he will make it a reality with the support of Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras and Kiva.

The other members work making cheese and in the production of bananas. They are Raul and Juana. They also dream of having power in their homes to change the lives of their families.

Trojes, Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to buy an 80-watt solar power system to light his home.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a Lebanese, married woman. She’s 31 years old and mother for four school-aged children. She is a housewife, focusing on her family and kids and as per her husband. He is a farmer and also works in parallel in the construction field.

Sanaa at this period is in real need of a little help from Kiva. For that reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay for her children’s educational fees for the coming year. She said that she is happy that she will be able to ensure them a suitable education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees for the coming year.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y actualmente tiene dos hijos.

Sandra, cuando era una adolescente trabaja para una señora que diseñaba trajes, vestidos y camisas, pero después que se casó, junto a su esposo coloco un pequeño taller de costuras en donde actualmente  trabaja como modista, en un taller que tiene en el centro de su municipio.

El  crédito que está solicitando es para comprar dos máquinas industriales de costura, porque las que tiene están fallando y actualmente ha hecho un contrato con el gobierno para elaborar los uniformes escolares del próximo año y necesita tener más máquinas para dar abasto a la demanda.

Su sueño es tener una buena maquinaria de trabajo, porque se le presentado una buena oportunidad de trabajo y quiere dejar una buena imagen ante la institución que la contrato.
texts.en:
Sandra is 26 years old. She attended school through high school. She is married and has two children. When Sandra was a teenager, she worked for a woman who designed suits, dresses and shirts. After she got married, she and her husband set up a small sewing shop, in the center of town, where she currently works as a seamstress.

The loan she is seeking is to buy two industrial sewing machines, because the ones she has are breaking down. She currently has a contract with the government to make school uniforms for next year, and needs the machines to meet the demand. Her dream is to have good machinery for work, because she's been given a good work opportunity and wants to make a good impression with the institution that contracted with her.

loans.use: to buy two industrial sewing machines.

loans.name: Rohini's Group

texts.en:
Rohini, a differently able lady standing on the right, and her husband are strongly connected to their family roots and passionately follow the ancestral business of sculpting. Rohini hails from the small village of Manmad, Maharashtra, India. They make potteries and sculptures from their home in Maharashtra.

Even though there is competition from other sellers, Rohini wants to make sure there is continuous improvement in her work. She and her group member have applied for a loan of 30,000 Indian rupees from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She hopes to see a positive outcome in her business. Rohini is very keen to do more; hence, she has taken the plunge for this loan. With her portion of the loan, she plans to purchase raw materials, frames and various types of support equipment that will facilitate her work.

Rohini is eagerly awaiting for your kind hearts to help her.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, frames and various types of support equipment that will facilitate her work making pottery and sculptures.

loans.name: Dallal

texts.en:
Dallal is a 45-year-old, married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children, who are still studying. Her husband is the main income provider; he works as a van driver.

Currently, with the aim to pay her children’s study fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She is a permanent customer and she insists that she will always ask for Kiva’s support to ensure a good educational path for her children, and this is their only target.

loans.use: to pay her children study fees.

loans.name: Ferial

texts.en:
Ferial is a 56-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband, and she is the mother of six children. She has been working in tailoring at her house since 1990 to help her husband and family financially, to meet the needs of life.

She is a very talented person, and she is well-known in her region by her good reputation and good work. Currently, to better develop her work, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be using the loan to buy new textiles for her business. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products, and thus will improve her income and percentage.

loans.use: to buy new textiles for her business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es una mujer trabajadora, madre de dos hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Tiene 38 años y vive actualmente en la Ciudad de México, en donde tiene su negocio.
Estudió la carrera técnica como programador analista y hace siete años decidió iniciar un negocio propio. Aprovechando la oportunidad de adquirir equipo y consciente de la necesidad de la gente, Edith abrió un café internet. Luego de algunos años, tuvo la oportunidad de hacerlo crecer e implemento la renta de videojuegos para brindar más servicios a sus clientes.
Con esta idea y la de mejorar su negocio, Edith ha solicitado un crédito para comprar nuevo equipo y hacer modificaciones y servicio de mantenimiento a los sistemas de cómputo, con el objetivo de tener mejores ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edith is a hard-working woman, the mother of two children who are economically dependent on her. She is 38 years old and currently lives in Mexico City, where she has her business.
She studied the technical track as an Analyst Programmer and seven years ago decided to start her own business. Seizing the opportunity to purchase equipment and conscious of the needs of the people, Edith opened up an internet cafe. After several years, she had the opportunity to grow her business and added a video game rental to offer more services to her clients. 
With this idea and to improve her business, Edith has requested a loan to buy new equipment and make modifications and maintenance services to the computer systems, with the goal of having a better income to help her children get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and make modifications and maintenance services to the computer systems

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Mutabar was born in 1970. She is married and has a son. Her son is a student of the second course of Medical University of Tajikistan. He studies well. Mutabar is also a medical worker. She has worked in a local hospital as nurse more than 20 years. She has a great experience in this field and she knows all aspects of her job well.

Mutabar is asking for a loan of 7,000 TJS to pay for the university tuition for her son. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition for her son.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa es una socia trabajadora emprendedora, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de chicha de jora, una actividad tradicional de la región del Cusco.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz amarillo y leña. Para poder seguir produciendo mas y elaborara mas chicha que le permita ampliar su negocio.
Jesusa esta agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella y otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Jesusa is a hardworking and enterprising member. She continues to work selling chicha de jora, a corn-based drink, which is a traditional trade in the Cusco region.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy yellow corn and firewood, so that she is able to continue producing more and make more chicha, which will permit her to expand her business.

She is grateful for the Kiva lenders for continuing to trust in her and granting the loan.

loans.use: to buy yellow corn and firewood.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman who has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Jesus Andalecio

texts.es:
Jesús Andalecio con 40 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y sus 3 menores hijos de edades 16,9,2 años, en el distrito de San Felipe,provincia Jaén,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo y venta de lima,con una experiencia en el rubro hace 12 años. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de abonos para su parcela el cuál le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.

Jesús Andalecio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Jesus Andalecio, 40, is married and lives in a rustic home with his partner and their 3 children, ages 16, 9 and 2. They live in the district of San Felipe in Jaen province in the department of Lambayeque in Peru. He has very good personal and professional references in the area. The people in this region primarily work in agriculture, commerce and cattle.

Jesus Andalecio is a farmer who grows and sells limes. He has been doing this work for 12 years. The loan will be used to buy compost for his fields so that he can increase his profits and improve his quality of life. There isn't much competition in the area and so he gets good prices.

Jesus Andalecio is a returning partner with Edpyme Alternativa; his wife will sign for the loan.

loans.use: to buy compost for his land.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, tiene la edad  de 58  años, casado,  vive con su esposa, la cual es su prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y con alta germinación y fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en su bienestar y cumplir con algunas metas personales y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Francisco is 58 years old and lives with his wife, who is his priority.

With the loan he intends to buy good quality bean seed with high germination, as well as fertilizers, and other products to apply to the seeds during planting. Additionally, he will pay for labor to apply these products and assist with the planting once he gets it going in order to ensure that he does a good job.

He'd like to take advantage of the good climate and ground in this area for his crop and put to use his many years of experience in managing basic grains. As well, he'd like to be able to buy the best products of the best quality so his crops develop well, are healthy and provide an adequate harvest and an important production in the short term.

With the income of the crop he hopes to get, he'd like to use it for his well-being and realize some personal goals and continue investing more in his crops.

This is the first loan he's requesting from FUDECOSUR. He's not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR can provide a loan with easier facility and at lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy bean seed, farming supplies, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Sri Mahalaxmi Group

texts.en:
This group is formed in the year 2015 at Rayagada, district of Rayagada, Odisha, India. There are six active, self-dependent women, with the objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods.

Alekha is one of them who taken a great role in her development and their group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing third from left with raised hand in the photo. She is about 25 years old and living with her husband.

She has engaged in tailoring work for the last five years with the support of her husband, but through the concerned business they earn a monthly income of 7,500 INR. Alekha plans to improve her business in the course of a loan. She will purchase another sewing machine and a Pico machine. She will appoint new staff and expand her business.

The other five members of her group are also smart at their professions and also actively engaged with different businesses like vegetable vending, a grocery shop, tailoring, fast food, and the ready-made snacks business. It will be the first cycle loan for the group and they all hope to heighten their livelihoods with proper utilization of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine and a Pico machine.

loans.name: Gaikwad's Group

texts.en:
45-year-old Gaikwad, standing to the extreme left, is a resident of Manmad in Mharashtra, India. She is blessed with a son who is now engaged in small carpentry work. Her husband works in the gold jewellery making business. Being a homemaker, Gaikwad has to do all the household work throughout the day.

Unfortunately the family is in great discomfort because of their toilet. Over the years, Gaikwad had no water connection in her toilet. Fetching water from nearby sources, she would store it and use for daily use. However, with growing age, this task is becoming difficult.

Therefore, she decided to get a water connection in her toilet and thus has applied for a loan of 45,000 INR, along with her other group members, from Kiva's partner, People's Forum.

She will purchase a water pump and a commode with her portion of the loan amount and install it to get the water connection in her toilet, so that she can easily get water in her toilet. She is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and a commode

loans.name: Lad's Group

texts.en:
Lad is a 31-year-old lady standing in a pink saree in the middle of the photograph. She lives with her husband, her two daughters and son. Lad's husband is a mason by profession. The income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenses. They have hardly any savings.

Therefore, Lad was never able to build a toilet in her house. Because of this, she is suffering a lot. She has to go long distances to isolated places in order to relieve herself. She does not find this practice to be safe so she understands the importance of having a toilet at home.

Therefore, she along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Lad will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet and connect it to water pipes.The loan amount will subsequently result in enhancing cleanliness, health and hygiene.

Lad is in dire need of your kind help and is eagerly awaiting for the same.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet and connect it to water pipes

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is aged 32 years, and a married mother of three children who attend school. She lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a very hardworking woman who dreams of getting a stable income generating business, and as a result she ventured into the operation of mostly selling school uniforms of supplemented by incomes earned from offering tailoring services. She is seeking credit to buy more materials to use in tailoring.

loans.use: to buy more materials to use in tailoring.

loans.name: Tariedi

texts.en:
This is Tariedi and his 16-year-old son, who have been photographed in the branch office of VisionFund Albania.

Tariedi, a 45-year-old married father of two (ages 16 and 17) needs your help to pay for his son's (seen in the picture) second surgery. Some months back, his son had the first major surgery; and he is required to go through another major one very soon. His surgical date has already been scheduled.

Their family lives in a city. Tariedi's wife works as a janitor with the city for a minimum-wage income of $160/monthly, whereas Tariedi works in a prison, doing inspection, for a monthly income of $241.

In addition, the son who is ready for the surgery has started working as a busboy in a nearby restaurant, in an attempt to save money for the surgery, and he only makes $80/month. "I have to do something to contribute financially to my surgery because the money that my parents make is not enough to cover for it," said Tariedi's son.

loans.use: to pay for his son's second major surgery that is been scheduled already.

loans.name: Lubat

texts.en:
Lubat is a kind woman. She is married and has three children. Lubat is very careful for her children. Her husband is a welder. Lubat lives in a village and she has a good opportunity to feed cattle. She has been busy more than 24 years with animal husbandry. She buys cows, feeds them some months, and sells them in a local market.

Lubat’s son is a student of the first course. Lubat dreams to see him as a higher educated person. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 TJS to pay for the university tuition for her son. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition for her son.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
ANA MARIA DE 53 AÑOS DE EDAD, ORIGINARIA DE MANAGUA CASADA CON TRES HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS  DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, DESDE MUY JOVEN TRABAJA PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR, EN LA ACTUALIDAD HA PODIDO CUMPLIR SUS OBJETIVOS PERSONALES COMO ES  FORMAR A SUS HIJOS EN PROFESIONALES,  Y HACERLE MEJORAS A SUS CASA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE  TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA  LA VENTA DE MERCADERIA EN GENERAL, EL CUAL DESEMPEÑA DE FORMA AMBULANTE Y POR ENCARGO, DESDE HACE CINCO AÑOS QUE SE DESEMPEÑA EN EL NEGOCIO. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR  EN MERCADERIA COMO:  PANTALONES, SHORES, FALDAS, VESTIDOS, ROPA DE NIÑO, ROPA DE CAMA, TOALLAS, BODY, PERFUMES, LABIALES ETC. ELLA DEDICA UNAS  DIEZ HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS Y ASI EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. ANA MARIA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Ana Maria, 53, originates from Managua. She's married and has three independent children. She is hard-working, responsible and has the initiative to better herself. She's been working since very young to help pay the household expenses. She's been able to realize her personal objectives, like help form her children into professionals and make improvements to her house.

Thanks to her initiative to move forward in life, she runs an ambulant and by order retail business in which she sells general merchandise. She's been running this business for five years.

The objective of this loan is to invest it in merchandise, like pants, shorts, skirts, dresses, children's clothing, bed clothing, towels, perfume, lipstick, etc.

She dedicates 10 hours a day to offering her products and that way, in the near future, she will be able to obtain higher earnings.

Ana Maria is thankful for the help the Kiva investors provide to people of modest means, and in poor countries like Nicaragua, so they can have decent work.

loans.use: buy merchandise, like pants, skirts, dresses, blouses, children's clothing, bed clothing, underwear, towels, etc.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman with seven children. She describes herself as patient. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loans and will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María, de 57 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pero aun así se las ingenió para salir adelante, actualmente está acompañada y tiene dos hijos, ambos son personas adultas y son independientes, pero aun así contribuyen a la actividades que ella realiza.

María, cuando tenía 17 años de edad trabajaba en el mercado como cocinera, pero después que se acompañó, junto a su pareja trabajaron la agricultura.- Su pareja no está con ella porque decidió viajar desde hace cuatro años al extranjero y ahora ella es quien realiza las actividades agrícolas con el apoyo de sus hijos.

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas para aplicarlos a sus cultivos y asegurar una buena cosecha, porque le hace falta realizar dos abonadas más.

Su sueño es obtener una excelente cosecha, para tener buenos ingresos al momento de venderla.
texts.en:
Maria, 57, wasn't able to attend school but nevertheless has been successful. She is married and has two adult children who assist her.

When Maria was 17 years old she worked as a cook in the market, but after she got married she started farming with her husband. Her husband has been working outside the country for four years, and she is taking care of the farm with help from her children.

Maria needs a loan to buy agricultural inputs for her crops so that she can ensure a good harvest. She still needs to apply two layers of manure. Her dream is to have a good harvest so that she can sell it for a good profit.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her crops to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Rebeka

texts.en:
Rebeka is a married woman with five children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, cooking fat and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, cooking fat and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, bread, cooking fat and other items to sell.

loans.name: Sara Lorena

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer trabajadora, madre de tres hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Tiene 35 años y vive actualmente en el Distrito Federal, en donde tiene su negocio.
Hace cuatro años, después de trabajar en una fábrica, Sara aprovechó la oportunidad de independizarse e inició su negocio de fabricación de troqueles y moldes para usar en reparaciones de maquinarias, con el fin de salir adelante y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Sara se dedica únicamente a su negocio y su sueño es verlo crecer con una solidez económica más estable y una cartera de clientes más amplia. Con este fin y la motivación de saber que su negocio puede dar más, Sara solicitó un crédito que le ha permitido comprar materia prima y así fabricar más piezas y herramientas para poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sara is a hard-working woman, a mother of 3 children who economically depend on her. She is 35 years old, and currently lives in Distrito Federal, where she has her business.

Four years ago, after working in a factory, Sara took advantage of the opportunity to become independent and started her business making dies and casts for using in machine repair. Her objective was to get ahead and give her children a better quality of life.

Sara earns a living solely from her business. Her dream is to see it grow with more stable financial strength and a wider customer base. With this objective, and the motivation of knowing that her business can give more, Sara requested a loan that has allowed her to buy raw materials and thus make more parts and tools to be able to boost her sales.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and thus make more parts and tools to be able to increase her sales.

loans.name: Surekha's Group

texts.en:
Surekha is a 30-year-old humble, charming and simple lady standing in the middle of the photograph. She hails from a small village of Manmad, Maharashtra, India. Surekha is a married lady and a blessed mother of two sons who are currently studying in school. Her household income is very low and the income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenses.

For this reason, she was never able to afford to build a toilet at her home. The absence of a toilet at her home compels her to walk a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds it feasible as she can sense the danger of crime and molestation.

Therefore, she along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode in it.

Your loan will help her family to enjoy good health and promote cleanliness in the community. Surekha is awaiting your kind hearts to help her and her family.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode in it.

loans.name: Omary

texts.en:
Omary, who is in his mid 40s, is married with three children — one son and two daughters — who are still at school. He has been running a retail shop for three years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep on increasing his shop's inventory and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loans buy a radio and TV sets, and cover household expenses. He is happy with the loan.

He will use this loan to increase his retail shop's inventory. He dreams of building a second house. Omary will make sure he pays back his loan according the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase his retail shop's inventory.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una socia trabajadora y empeñosa que continua dedicándose al negocio de hotel, con esta actividad ella sale adelante y aporta gastos familiares.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar jabones y fundas de almohadas. Su objetivo es brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes que le darán más ganancias.
Virginia está contenta y agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA , por seguir confiando en ella.
texts.en: Virginia is a hardworking and persevering woman who continues working in her hotel. This business is what supports her family's expenses. She asks for a loan to buy soaps and pillow cases. Her goal is to provide better service for her customers, which will increase her earnings. Virginia is happy and thankful to the KIVA lenders for trusting in her.

loans.use: to buy soaps and pillow cases.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a married woman who has one child. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells fish and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish and vegetables. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes and beauty products. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to open another shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 32 and a married father of children, 10 and 8 years old. Daniel wants to invest on an agricultural tractor and a machine for corn stripping. He has been doing agriculture livestock for the past 10 years. His family owns about 10 dynym of agricultural land, and they rent another 5 from others. Almost every year they plant 2 dynym with red onions, 3 with wheat, 7 with corn and 3 with beans. The annual earnings from the onions add up to $435, from wheat about $261, corn about $500 and from beans $200.

In addition to this, momentarily he has two dairy cows with a calf, a pig and a sheep. Daniel sells approximately 40-50 liters of raw milk a day most of the year, at a price of $.4 per liter, and also he sells two calves a year at a price of $360 per calf.

loans.use: to invest on an agricultural tractor and a machine for stripping corn.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto con 52 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos de 16 y 11 años ,de los cuáles el primero cursa secundaria y el otro primaria en colegio nacional, en el distrito de San Felipe,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad,con una experiencia en el rubro hace varios años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores.El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de mercadería para surtir mas su negocio como arroz,azúcar,leche,aceite,etc. De esta manera le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.

Modesto es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa. Firmará con aval.
texts.en:
Modesto, 52, is married and lives in a home made of rustic material with his partner and their two youngest children, ages 16 and 11. The oldest is in high school and the other in his first year of middle school. They live in the district of San Felipe in Jaen province, in the department of Cajamarca in Peru. It is a rural zone and the inhabitants primarily work in agriculture, commerce and cattle.

Modesto has been selling basic goods for a number of years. He also raises small animals. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for his store like rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc. This way he will make more money and be able to improve his quality of life. There isn't much competition in his field so he gets good prices.

Modesto is a new partner with Edpyme Alternativa. He will sign for his loan with a reference.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his business like rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Vidya's Group

texts.en:
Vidya, 35, standing in the middle of the photograph, is a charismatic and hardworking lady from Manmad, Maharashtra, India. She has a family of four and is a blessed mother of two sons who are currently in school.

Vidya hails from a low-income household and has access to very limited resources. For this reason, she was never able to build a suitable toilet for her family. Without access to a toilet, she faces a lot of problems as she has to travel a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds it feasible to depend on an open field for defecation.

Therefore, Vidya, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet and install a toilet pan in it. Access to basic sanitation will consequently result in safety, improved health, medical savings, and enhanced productivity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet and install a toilet pan in it

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina, 19, is a single freshman who is from the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree, majoring in Finance and Banking at a university in the city. Her parents are farmers. Dina is requesting a loan because she needs finances to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year. With the loan, she will be able to earn a Bachelor’s degree successfully. For her future dreams, Dina hopes to have a good job with a reasonable salary and be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Evelyn Esmeralda

texts.es: Evelyn es una mujer trabajadora de 23 años de edad que habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos a los que cuida con mucho cariño. Ella se dedica a la elaboración calzado y carteras en una empresa cercana, y es con los ingresos de este trabajo que logra salir adelante con su familia. Evelyn desea mejorar su vivienda, ya que por encontrarse dañada la misma se encuentra habitando en la de un familiar, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, cemento y arena para reparar su vivienda lo antes posible y de esta manera regresar a la misma.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a hard-working 23-year-old, who lives in her own home with her life partner and her two children, whom she cares for deeply.

She makes shoes and purses in a company nearby and with that income, she is able to move forward with her family.

Evelyn wants to make improvements to her house, as it is damaged and her family is currently living with a relative. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal, cement and gravel to repair her home as soon as possible, in order to return to it.

loans.use: buy galvanized metal, cement and gravel to repair her home.

loans.name: Habibu

texts.en:
Habibu is a maize farmer from Fulani village. As a Babban Gona member, Habibu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Habibu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Habibu can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Habibu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Habibu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mustafa is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Mustafa would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Mustafa will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Mustafa now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Good Wishes Young Mothers Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Tabitha. She is 45 years old and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014. She enrolled in trainings that helped her gain skills in enterprise and financial management. She runs a shop to earn a living.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more stock of foodstuffs that will help boost sales.This will lead to an increase in income which will improve her living standards through easy provision of food and clothes for her family. She will also pay school fees for her three children in school.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support, and promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of foodstuffs that will help boost sales.

loans.name: Olesta

texts.en:
Olesta, who is in her mid 30’s, is single with one child in school. She has been selling cosmetics for two years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the cosmetics stock and has managed to pay back this loan successfully. She was happy with the loan. She used the profits to pay school fees, to repay the loan and to cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy the fast moving cosmetics to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of expanding her business buy opening a big shop for cosmetics. Olesta will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving cosmetics to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
MARIA DE  57 AÑOS DE EDAD VIUDA, CON TRES HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD, ES ORIGINARIA DE MANAGUA, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPAÑÍA DE SU FAMILIA.  EN LA VIDA SE HA PROPUESTO METAS Y OBJETIVOS COMO ES SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS, HACERLE MEJORAS A SU VIVIENDA ETC.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE  TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA  LA VENTA DE MERCADERIA EN GENERAL LA CUAL CONSISTEN EN VENDER PRODUCTOS COMO. PANTALONES, FALDAS VESTIDOS, SHORES, BODY, PERFUMES ETC.  EL ELLA DEDICA UNAS  DIEZ HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO  Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS DE MERCADERIA PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. MARIA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Maria, 57, is widowed and has 3 independent children. She originates from Managua. She is hard-working, responsible and has the initiative for personal growth. In her spare time she likes to be with her family. She has set goals and objectives in her life, like move her family forward, make improvements to her house, etc.

Thanks to her initiative to move forward in life, she has a business selling general merchandise, like pants, skirts, dresses, shorts, perfume, etc. She dedicates about 10 hours to offering her products. The objective of this loan is to invest it in work capital and buy merchandise to stock up her business, so in the not-so-distant future, she can obtain higher earnings.

Maria is thankful for the help the Kiva investors offer to people with modest means, and in poor countries like Nicaragua, so they can have decent work.

loans.use: buy merchandise, like pants, shorts, skirts, dresses, blouses, children's clothing, bed clothing, perfume, blush, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is a 20-year-old single student who is from the Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. His parents earn their main income from farming. Pov is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in engineering in his first year. He has decided to take out a loan because he is short of the money to cover his university fees from the first to the fifth year. This loan will help him in earning a bachelor’s degree successfully and to achieve his future goal. After graduation, Pov dreams of having a proper job with a reasonable salary and he also wants to save money to build his own house. If he has children, he wants his children to study to pursue a bachelor's or master's degrees if he can support it.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the first to the fifth year.

loans.name: Nora Luz

texts.es:
Nora Luz con 55 años de edad, de estado civil separada, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de bisutería, son una experiencia en el rubro hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería. De esta manera le facilitará seguir trabajando y obtener sus propios ingresos.

Nora Luz cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Nora Luz is 55 years old, is separated from her husband, and lives in the district of Cayaltí in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque department of Perú. She has many good references, both personal and for work. The residents of this town mostly make a living in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

She makes a living selling costume jewelry, and has several years of experience in this field. Her business is located in her home. She is asking for the loan in order to buy merchandise. In this way, she will be able to continue working and getting her own income.

Nora Luz has loan experience; she is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lilia Sarahi

texts.es:
La joven Lilia de 28  años de edad, es madre soltera y  vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 08  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y personas que transitan por su colonia.
Lilia vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Lilia está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería como refrescos, arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijoles, huevos, café, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras  -  Octubre del  2015.
texts.en:
Lilia, 28, is a young single mother and lives with her children in her own home. She's been running a grocery store for eight years. In her business, she sells everything related to basic need items.
Her clients are neighbors, friends and those who are passing through her area.

Lilia lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with desires to get ahead in life and fights day to day to improve her quality of life.

Lilia is requesting a loan to buy products to stock up her grocery store, like refreshments, rice, sugar, corn, beans, eggs, coffee, etc. With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her earnings and her quality of life. She wants to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a well-stocked, good business and at the same time improve her future alongside her family.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: buy refreshments, rice, sugar, corn, beans, eggs, coffee, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Doris Marlen

texts.es:
La señora Doris Marlen de 52  años de edad es casada y  vive con su esposo e hijas  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 08  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta básica. 
Doña Doris Marlen también elabora y vende rosquillas de cuajada tres veces por semana, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y personas que transitan por la zona, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería,  con pollo, arroz, frijoles, maseca, manteca, jabón, frescos, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Octubre del  2015.
texts.en:
Doris Marlen, 52, is married. She lives with her husband and daughters in her own home. She has earned a living for eight years in her grocery store business, where she sells everything related to the basic food basket.

Doris Marlen also makes and sells cheese rosquillas [pastry] three times a week. Her customers are all her neighbors, friends, and people who pass through the area. She's an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead, and she strives every day to improve her quality of life.

She's requesting the loan to buy products to stock her grocery store, including chicken, rice, beans, Maseca brand corn flour, shortening, soap, and beverages. She's a new client who wants to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good and well-stocked business as well as to improve her future along with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, October 2015

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, beans, corn flour, shortening, soap, beverages, and other items for her business

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El socio Edwin es una persona emprendedora y continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de pasteles. Con esta actividad el socio busca salir adelante junto con su familia.
Edwin solicita el crédito para comprar queques, pasteles y tortas. Para poder ampliar sus ofertas y dar más opciones  a sus clientes.
el socio está contento con el crédito y se compromete a seguir adelante con su negocio y pagar puntual sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
The member, Edwin, is an enterprising person who's still working in his business selling pastry. He hopes to get ahead with his family with this job.

Edwin's requesting the loan to buy cakes, pastry, and pies to expand his offerings and give his customers more choices.

He's happy about the loan and promises to move forward with his business and make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy cakes, pastries, and pies

loans.name: Gezim

texts.en:
Gezim or 'Joy' is 40 years old and a married father of two children aged 19 and 11. They all live in the rural northern part of the country. Gezim's disabled sister lives with them as well, and Gezim is her caretaker.

Gezim has been doing agriculture/livestock for the past 20 years. With your loan he wants to build a decent stable since the one seen in the background is not good at all, as Gezim stated. His family owns only 2 dynym land and they've rented from other villagers some 30 more, planting mostly wheat and corn and leaving the rest of it as natural pasture for the animals. Currently, he's got 4 dairy cows, 2 female young cows, 6 sows and 30 piglets. From all of these the earnings are as follows: 20 liters of raw milk a month for a total price of $145, $1,080/year from selling three calves, $2600/year from selling roughly 80-100 piglets.

loans.use: to build a decent stable, as the one seen in the background is not in good shape.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “SOL NACIENTE” está conformada por 08 socios responsables. Este es el caso de Fernando de 33 años de edad, casado con 3 hijos dependientes. Fernando es un padre trabajador que con mucho esfuerzo saco adelante a su familia. Él se dedica al servicio de mototaxi el deseo de Fernando es comprar otra moto. Solicito el crédito para reparación de su mototaxi. El grupo “sol naciente” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Fernando es el único hombre de la foto.se encuentra de pie al lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Sol Naciente Communal Bank is made up of eight responsible members. This is the case of Fernando, 33, who's married and has three dependent children. He's a hardworking father who gets his family ahead with a lot of effort.

Fernando earns a living providing motorcycle taxi services and he wants to buy another motorcycle. He requested the loan to repair his motorcycle taxi.

Sol Naciente Group is grateful to Kiva for the help. Fernando's the only man in the photo; he's standing on the left.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es:
El señor Amadeo de 69 años de edad, tiene 01 hijo que dependen de él vive con su esposa en casa  propia en una comunidad San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 16 años  a la actividad de pesca artesanal.
Don Amadeo sale todo los días al mar con su lancha pesquera a realizar su trabajo con la ayuda de su familia, pesca de dos a tres quintales un día de por medio, es un hombre humilde con deseos de sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Don Amadeo está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una cimbra de pesca y un trasmallo siempre para la pesca, con el apoyo del préstamo  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, es su segundo crédito que solicita a Prisma.   Su sueño es mejorar su lancha.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Señor Amadeo is 69 years old, has one son who depends on him, and lives with his wife in his own home in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in south Honduras. He has made a living for 16 years through artisanal fishing.

Don Amadeo goes out every day to the ocean with his fishing boat to carry out his work with the help of his family. He fishes for two or three quintals (a unit of measure equal to about 100 pounds) a day on average. He is a humble man with a desire to get his children ahead in life.

Don Amadeo is asking for a loan in order to buy a fishing net and a drag-net for fishing. With the help of the loan he intends to improve his income and therefore his quality of life. This is the second loan he has solicited from Prisma. His dream is to improve his boat.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and a drag-net for his business.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla is a single woman. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco con 68 años de edad ,de estado civil conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, junto a su cónyuge,en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú,en una zona rural. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería por esta zona de Oyotún,con una experiencia en el rubro hace 25 años,su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo, en la compra de cemento para su vereda y para el mantenimiento de sus herramientas de trabajo, esto le servirá para tener una mejor calidad de trabajo.

Francisco es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Francisco is 68 years old. He has a live-in partner and no children in his care. He lives in his own home, together with his spouse, in a rural area of Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, in the country of Peru. He has many good personal and professional references from the area's residents. The majority of this town's inhabitants earn a living in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

He earns a living providing day labor services in this area of Oyotún, with 25 years of experience in this category. His business is located in his home. He requests a loan in order to invest in fixed assets, in purchasing cement for his sidewalk, and for the maintenance of his work tools. This will help him to have a better quality of work.

Francisco is a recurring member for Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in fixed assets, in buying cement for his sidewalk, and his work tools' maintenance.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: This woman lives with her beloved husband in Stepanavan city of Lori region. Her name is Alvard and she is 58 years old. She graduated from the faculty of Geography at Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute. She has worked at the school for 33 years as a geography teacher. She mentions that she does her work with great pleasure and her pupils attend the lessons with great interest. She also gives paid private courses of geography to the pupils who will have entrance exams. She gives these courses at her house in a separate room. Alvard asks for this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams as she greatly wants to furnish the room where she works. With this loan she will buy a round table and also chairs to work with her pupils cutely and with comfort.

loans.use: to furnish the room where she works. She will buy a round table and also chairs to work with her pupils cutely and with comfort.

loans.name: Madhusudan Group

texts.en:
This group is formed in the year 2013 at Basuguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. There are six active self-dependent women, with the objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of concerned group have their own professions and businesses.

Mini is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and their group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing third from right with raised hand in the photo. She is about 35 years old and living with her small family consisting of her husband only.

Both wife and husband have been engaged in the dairy business for the last 10 years. Through the concerned business they earn a monthly income of 7,000 INR.

Mini plans to improve her business in the course of a loan. It will be the second cycle loan for the group. The previous loan helped the group to strengthen their financial condition with increased income and the repayment behavior was very good.

From this loan Mini will purchase another two cows. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for her future need. The other five members of the group are also doing dairy business and with this loan hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase another two cows.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yahaya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Yahaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 37 years old and she lives in the Tsovagyugh village of the Gegharkunik region. She has a higher pedagogical education. Liana now works at the school as a secretary of the director. Liana is married and she lives with her husband, son and also father-in-law.

Besides Liana's work at the school, house, and family care, she is also engaged in farming and agriculture. On the farm she takes care of cows, calves, heifers, a bull, pigs, sheep, lambs and chickens. With the help of her husband, Liana also cultivates potatoes, peppers, greens and tomatoes. She sells her farm products such as milk, butter, cheese, meat and eggs with the help of her father-in-law at the city’s wholesale market.

Liana asks for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as she wants to make her farm richer with cattle. She will also buy two more pigs and fodder for her all of her farm cattle.

loans.use: to make her farm richer with cattle. She will also buy two more pigs and fodder for her all of her farm cattle.

loans.name: Gopabandhu Group

texts.en:
This group is formed in the year 2013 at Basuguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. There are five active self-dependent women, with the objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihoods. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses.

Bangari is one of them who has taken a great role in her development and the group members' source of revenue improvement. She is standing third from right with raised hand in the photo. She is about 28 years old and living with her small family, consisting of her husband and two sons.

Her family has engaged in the dairy business for the last five years. The complete family together promotes their business. But through the concerned business they earn a monthly income of 7,000 INR.

Bangari plans to improve her business in the course of a loan. It will be the second cycle loan for the group. The previous loan helped the group to strengthen their financial condition with increased income and the repayment behavior was very good.

From this loan, Bangari will purchase another two cows. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for her future need. Other four members of the group are also doing the dairy business and with this loan hope to heighten their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase another two cows.

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en:
Leatu is a Babban Gona maize farmer.  Leatu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing her dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Leatu would have had to sell her maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Leatu can store her maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Leatu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. 

Leatu is thankful that she no longer has to worry about having the money to provide healthcare for her family and children. She looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Hmaw Bi Village Group 1

texts.en:
The previous loan from Kiva's community helped 23 group members increase investment in their duck business. Affordable credit allowed these members to boost incomes, which covered each family's living cost and allowed for savings, some of which will be used for their children’s educations.

With a new loan, featured borrower Tin aims to expand her poultry business by raising more ducks. With the increased income from ducks, Tin plans to also purchase additional monsoon rice paddies. All the group members are so grateful for all of the help from Kiva lenders, and they are excited to continue to grow their business with Kiva’s support.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high-quality feed

loans.name: Kaburugi Mugecha Self Help Group

texts.en: The person raising his hand in the photo is Morrison. He is forty four years old and a father to three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to undergo training on enterprise and financial management in order to run his business profitably. He sells shoes as his main business. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy more stock for his business. He hopes the Kiva loan will improve his living standards so that he will be able to provide school fees for his children. He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his business in order to boost sales and thus increase profits.

loans.name: G.s Ebenezer Group

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es una persona que se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 15 años, en la actualidad cuenta con 7 Manzanas de café, este producto es vendido en muchos lugares de la Ciudad de Danlí.
Doña Elsa solicita el préstamo para la compra de un sistema de planta solar de 80 watts, ya que desea cambiar su vida teniendo luz en la casa, estar actualizada de lo que pasa en el país y en el mundo entero, utilizando los medios de comunicación comunes como ser radio y televisión  y evitarse de pagar y caminar para  que le carguen el celular, está solicitando el crédito de forma grupal con las siguientes personas:
Doña Imelda  se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 25 años.
Don Santos se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 25 años.
Don David se dedica a la cafiltura desde hace 12 años.


Danli, Honduras – Octubre del  2015
texts.en:
Señora Elsa is a person who has made a living by growing coffee for 15 years. She now has seven manzanas [a unit of land equal to about 1.75 acres] of coffee. She sells this product in many places in the city of Danlí.

Doña Elsa is asking for a loan in order to buy an 80-watt solar power system because she wishes to change her life by having lights in her home, and to keep updated to what is happening in the country and around the world by using common means of communication like the radio and television, and to avoid having to pay and to walk in order to charge her cell phone. She is asking for the loan as part of a group loan with the following people:

Doña Imelda, who has made a living by growing coffee for 25 years.

Don Santos, who has made a living by growing coffee for 25 years.

Don David, who has made a living by growing coffee for 12 years.


Danli, Honduras – October 2015

loans.use: to buy a solar power system for her house.

loans.name: Fausto Samuel

texts.es:
El señor  Fausto es un hombre trabajador y dedicado al negocio propio, el cual es la venta de pollo embolsados y menudos de pollo, esta actividad la realiza desde hace un año y medio, su negocio lo atiende todos los días de la semana y las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante.
Don Fausto sale a las aldeas cercanas de donde vive y se traslada en su vehículo para vender su producto, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de un frízer y pollo para su negocio y poder llevarlo en el vehículo para mantener el pollo en un estado más fresco y que no tenga el riesgo de descomposición, en la actualidad el pollo lo anda en canastas y corre el riesgo de que el producto se dañe.
Don Fausto sueña  con poder  ampliar el negocio para poder generar más empleo a más personas.

Danli, Honduras – Octubre del  2015
texts.en:
Fausto is a hardworking man, dedicated to his business selling whole chickens and chicken parts. He has been doing this for a year and a half, working every day going door to door. Fausto goes by car to the villages near his home where he sells his products.

Fausto is asking for a loan to buy a cooler and chicken for his business. He wants a cooler that he can take in his car to keep the chicken more fresh and avoid it going bad. Right now he carries the chickens in baskets, which runs the risk of damaging the chickens.

Fausto dreams of growing his business so that he can generate jobs for other people.

Danli, Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to buy a cooler and chicken for his business.

loans.name: Universal Group

texts.en:
The wo members of the Universal Group have a heart full of gratitude to Kiva and ID Ghana; the previous loan granted was a sustenance to their business. This group started their business through the help of ID Ghana in order to raise their capital.

Christiana is a representative of the Universal Group. She is married with two children who are in school. In order to support her husband who has a low income in his carpentry profession, Christiana trades in the sale of soft drinks at her residence where she has regular customers. She gains advantage because of the population growth in her area and the increase in demand for drinks by her buyers. She seeks a loan to purchase crate of drinks to earn income to help establish the family.

Christiana will be very grateful if her loan is given to her since this will also guarantee the security of her children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase a crate of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 49 years old and married with four children. She is a hardworking entrepreneur.

Yolanda and her husband operate their junk/scrap shop business. They work hard and with patience to find plastic bottles and plastic scraps in a large dump site in their area, cleaning and taking off labels and caps to further increase their value. She does all of this for her children to finish their schooling and to provide for their needs.

Yolanda also buys plastic and other scrap from other individual scrappers, stocks it in their home to accumulate quantity, and sells it to a larger scrap/junk shop in a much higher price. She has difficulty buying scrap because their income is only enough to support their needs.

Yolanda is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to buy plastic bottles and other plastic scrap to sell to a larger scrap/junk shop. Yolanda hopes to expand her junk/scrap shop and buy a truck to generate more income for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy plastic bottles and other plastic scrap to sell to a larger scrap/junk shop.

loans.name: Sabran

texts.en: Sabran is a married woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is age 50 and the mother of five children. About a year ago, she tired to start her own business. It was successful and people from the surroundings really started admiring her collection and started buying from her and spreading good word of mouth throughout the community. Her business started flourishing day by day. Now she decided to invest more in her business so she applied for the loan and is making her dreams come true about her business. Within no time, she'll be able to pay back the loan amount. Further, she is obliged to the Kiva team and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her clothing business.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana a working woman living in the small area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is married, 33 years old and has two children. She is an expert in stitching. It has been her passion from the beginning so she decided to start her business three years ago to start earning while sitting at home. It also enables her to polish her passion. Her business is doing well so she decided that she should invest more by taking several orders but her inventory is falling short of what she needs. That is why she applied for the Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful as the loan amount will bring about a boost in her business.

loans.use: to invest in her bedsheets business.

loans.name: Zhaneta

texts.en:
Zhaneta is a widowed mother of a 24-year-old son and some time back she had a surgical procedure that doctors thought went well. However, she's been having almost the same concerns lately.

Zhaneta works in a clothing factory in the nearby city for a pay of $145/month and her son works with a construction company for a monthly pay of $145. Zhaneta lives in a rural area, however, she doesn't own any piece of land where she could plant something.

Zhaneta is very poor and what is seen in the background is her so-called 'house'. "When my husband passed away, my son was very little. We were poor before, and after his passing, we became poorer. We have no land and no space to keep animals or even chickens. It has been very difficult for me all these years, and for my son," said Zhaneta to the loan officer.

loans.use: to pay for her medical expenses

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik lives in Zovaber village of the Gegharkunik region. He used to work as a driver but now his only occupations are farming and agriculture. Gagik has four children. His elder son is in the Russian Federation where he lives and works, his two daughters are already married and the smallest daughter is still school-aged. Gagik’s wife doesn’t work and she takes care of their family.
