Gagik's farming is more profitable for his family since with its income he also provides his family with fresh and healthy products. On his farm he has cows, a calf, sheep, lambs and chickens. Potato cultivation is also rather profitable for this family. Re-sellers buy the potatoes from Gagik’s farm a lot and wholesale. Gagik is so hopeful to receive this loan as he has lack of money but he must provide enough fodder for his farm cattle for the coming winter period. Gagik will use the loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to purchase a lot of animal fodder for all of his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of animal fodder for all of his farm cattle.

loans.name: Sreymech

texts.en: Sreymech is a 19-year-old single freshman who is from the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting at a university in the city. Her parents are rice farmers. Currently, Sreymech would like to request a loan because she needs finances to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year. With the loan, she will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. As for her future dreams, Sreymech hopes to have a good job in a financial institution with a reasonable salary, so she will be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay her university fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Sirajo

texts.en:
Sirajo is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sirajo has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sirajo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sirajo can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Sirajo will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Sirajo is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 52 years old with 4 children. She is a hardworking entrepreneur.

Luzviminda operates her sari sari store (small grocery store) from 8 am to 10 pm to help her husband, a driver, to generate income for their family.

Luzviminda is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 12, 000 to buy two sacks of rice, five dozen coffee, two cases of soft drinks, and other items to sell in her store. Luzviminda is hoping to improve her store and add more items to generate higher income and help support her family needs.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, five dozen coffee, two cases of soft drinks, and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Wasya Wa Mwene Nthi S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Julianah. She is 32 years old and married with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 in order to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development. Before joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she was only doing casual jobs. She was able to start a business (a small kiosk) after the training.

To expand her small kiosk, she is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more household items and hence add stock for increased income.

Julianah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more household items and hence add stock to her kiosk for increased income.

loans.name: Hmaw Bi Village Group 2

texts.en:
The previous loan to the Hmaw Bi village group freed them from unaffordable local loans featuring exorbitant interest rates. With the increased income, village members can reinvest in their family business, as well as use extra savings to fund their children’s higher education.


Client residents form Hmaw Bi Group 2 are so excited for their new loan to expand their duck businesses. They also aim to use increased yields to expand into new livestock endeavors by purchasing and raising piglets.

loans.use: to purchase ducks as well as high-quality feeds.

loans.name: Kun Pa Laing

texts.en:
The entire Kun Pa Laing village group plans to use Proximity’s next loan to buy new ducklings and purchase more high-quality duck feed. Customers used their increased income to cover all living costs, including their children's education fees.

Additionally, village members commented on how their recent loan helped them smooth their daily cash flows. One or two village members were even able to invest in a new boat that helps them take care of their ducks at nighttime.

As indications of repayment look very strong for the group, we plan to expand the village group to 10 new members for the next loan.

loans.use: Village Group to purchase ducks as well as high-quality feed.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en: Humaira is a very understanding lady regarding the matters of her husband. She is residing in a small area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 42 years old and a mother of five children. She has been managing her home along with her husband with peace, but for sometime they have been facing hard times. Her husband is not able to earn enough due to his taxi failure, which needs to get repaired. For that very reason Humaira applied for the loan from Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan, her family's issues could be resolved and they could again live the life they used to live.

loans.use: to invest in repairing her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Saratu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Saratu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Saratu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to move to the city with her family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is maize farmer from Sarki Gimba village. As a member of Babban Gona, Shehu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Shehu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. In the end, he hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Taruna Tani Group

texts.en:
Yusmina (wearing a blue T-shirt), 35 years old, is the representative of the Taruna Tani group. The group is formed of one man and four women, including Yusmina. She lives with two sons and Daniel, a 47-year-old farmer and motorcycle taxi driver. To provide a daily living and education for the children, Daniel grows paddy on a plot of land. It is located about 1 km from their residence.

Yusmina is a diligent and hardworking woman. She uses part of her land to grow different kinds of vegetables such as water spinach, mustard greens, etc. The business has been running for the last 12 years. She usually harvests every two weeks and sells her harvest at the market. She usually uses a plastic strap to bind the vegetables and harvests about 400 binds of vegetables. The only challenge she faces as a farmer is the dry season. She has to fetch water from the canal where the water comes from the dam. However, she really enjoys this business as it helps her to support her husband financially.

She decided to join the Taruna Tani group as she has plans to grow more vegetables on the farm. She wants to buy more seeds and fertilizers. Along with her four neighbors, they formed the Taruna Tani group and requested a loan totaling IDR 8,750,000 from TLM. The other members also would like to invest their portion of the loan to sell more fish, vegetables and cakes. She believes the loan provided by Kiva, via TLM, will improve their businesses in the future

loans.use: to buy more seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is married. He has operated a hotel for a year, and it is his main source of income. He is doing well, but still lacking in some areas. He desires to expand his business but is limited by capital to get his restaurant to a desired level to attract more customers. He is requesting money to buy more foods like posho, beans, cooking oil and Irish potatoes, so that he can have a variety of foods to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy food like posho, beans, cooking oil and Irish potatoes, so that he can have a variety of foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy manure and seedlings for his banana plantation. He has been a farmer for the past 10 years and mainly grows bananas and coffee. He also gets an extra income from his goat-rearing business and has advanced himself by buying and selling coffee. He cherishes agriculture given that he got his start-up capital from farming. He has the zeal of educating his children and also to expand his coffee buying and selling but he faces challenges of bad weather, price fluctuations and scarcity of resources to buy more goats and coffee to sell. He has hopes of becoming a rich man and owning a big banana plantation.

He wants to use the loan to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 28-year-old hardworking and focused single entrepreneur living in Kamwenge, Uganda.He is a banker and has been in this profession for five years, and he has been able to support himself financially. He loves his profession and being active at work, so he plans to start up a business in the near future and then grow the business so that he becomes a prominent businessman. However, he faces challenges of inadequate capital and the high cost of living.

As Martin looks forward to developing himself, he requests a loan to buy assets like a refrigerator and other items for his retail business.

loans.use: to buy assets like a refrigerator and other items for his retail business.

loans.name: Nery Arely

texts.es: Nery tiene 38 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 19 y 14 años de edad a los que les brinda todo su apoyo para que estudien. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos básicos en su vivienda, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes que solicitan sus productos. Nery desea mejorar el corredor de su vivienda, que es el lugar donde atiende a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lámina y pines para mejorar el corredor y de esta forma brindar mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nery is 38 years old and lives together with her husband and two children, ages 14 and 19, to whom she provides all her support so that they may study. She earns a living selling basic items in her home. She has been carrying out this business for 2 years, through which she has many clients who request her products.

Nery wishes to improve her home's corridor, which is the place where she looks after her clients. Because of this, she requests a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal, and pins in order to improve the hallway and in this way provide better service to her clients.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, metal sheets, and pins to improve her hallway and her service.

loans.name: Triplets Group

texts.en:
Jacquilyn is the featured borrower of Triplets group. She joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been close friends since they came to work as housekeepers in Lebanon seeking a better income to develop their family's living.

Jacquilyn is a 36-year-old single lady who decided to improve and develop her family's living, especially her sister's. She is working as a housekeeper with a limited monthly income. She is working hard to support her family back in her hometown in the Philippines. That's why she decided to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her sister's university tuition fees, to provide her with the best education.

Jacquilyn is the lady at the far left side of the picture. Flordeliza is the lady at the center with the black top, while Vivian is the lady at the far right side of the picture.

loans.use: to pay for her sister's university tuition fees to provide her with the best education.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a hardworking widow living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She has three children who all attend school. Jane runs a grocery as her main source of income though she supplements it with growing and selling of matooke (bananas). This has helped her earn a living and support her family. Jane has a dream of building a very good commercial house on her land and educating her children up to University level but she is challenged by high prices of products and poor transport means, especially during wet seasons. This limits her sales.

She is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her daughter ahead of the promotion term.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter ahead of the promotion term.

loans.name: Dorokasi

texts.en: Dorcus is a married woman with children. She sells goats and it's her only source of income. She has been able to build a residential house though it's not yet finished due to financial constraints. She has hopes of finishing her residential house and educating her children as well. She is requesting money to buy more goats for selling during this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy goats for selling during this Christmas season.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.en: Sayohat is a young and hardworking woman. She is married and does not have children. Sayohat’s husband is a master of repairing houses. Sayohat always wanted to organize her own business and in this way to get ahead. Sayohat took part in a course, “To Get Ahead,” from a women's organization. She got a certificate. Sayohat is going to start a business sewing women's clothes. She will service her clients from her house. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Grupo Pualhaj Las Granadas Group

texts.es:
Una joven  trabajadora y con mucho entusiasmo por superarse,  Juana tiene  21 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de la aldea guinelaes.
Juna  (la primera del lado derecho de blusa  azul) es una de las muchas jóvenes que buscan superarse con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, tiene un negocio de compra y venta de ropa típica de donde proviene sus ingresos para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa.
Juana gracias a su liderazgo es la  representante del grupo denominada Grupo Pualhaj Las Granadas,  ella solicita un préstamo para realizar una inversión en su negocio de ropa típica pues la época de navideña se está acercando y la demanda de ropa incrementa e, ella comprara fajas, cortes y güipiles.
Su esperanza de vida es contar muy pronto con su propio local y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
A hardworking young woman who is very enthusiastic to succeed, Juana is 21 years old and single. She lives with her parents and siblings in a community in the town of Guinelaes.

Juana (pictured first on the right in a blue blouse) is one of many young women who are looking to succeed through much effort and dedication. She has a business buying and selling traditional woven clothing which provides her with income to help her parents with the household expenses.

Thanks to her leadership, Juana is the representative of the group known as Grupo Pualhaj Las Granadas. She requests a loan in order to invest in her traditional clothing business, since the Christmas season is approaching and the demand for clothing will be increasing. She will buy sashes, skirts, and blouses (huipiles).

Her hope in life is to have her own shop soon and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy traditional woven clothing such as sashes, skirts, and blouses (huipiles).

loans.name: Rumsanah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Rumsanah, who is a 44-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter. Rumsanah is a housemaid and her husband is a driver. She has asked for a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Rumsanah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres Patzulin 1 Group

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera con una familia de una hija con la que vive, ellos viven en la comunidad de la aldea Xejuyup.
Manuela  (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía) es una madre de familia con grandes aspiraciones de vida, ella para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa típica de su región, esta actividad lo realiza desde la comunidad de su hogar y esto le permite cuidar mejor de su familia. Manuela hace algún tiempo se ha dado cuenta la necesidad de mejorar y modernizar sus tejidos típicos, a pesar de que ha hecho todo el esfuerzo esto no le ha sido posible por esa razón a organizado a un grupo de personas para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y estilos.
Con esta inversión Manuela espera poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes, seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, y contar muy pronto con su propio local para vender mejor.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 20-year-old woman, single with a family of one daughter with whom she lives. They live in the community of the small town Xejuyup.

Manuela (the first on the left side in the photograph) is the mother of a family with big life aspirations. To obtain her income, she works in the production and sale of traditional clothing of her region. She carries out this activity from the community of her home, and it allows her to better care for her family.

Some time ago, Manuela became aware of the need to improve and modernize her traditional fabrics. Despite the fact that she has made every effort to do so, it has not been possible. For this reason, she has put together a group of people to request a loan that she will use for the purchase of threads of different colors and styles. 

With this investment, Manuela hopes to be able to better satisfy the needs of her customers, continue strengthening her business, and very soon have her own store to better sell.

loans.use: to buy threads of different colors and styles for the production of traditional clothing.

loans.name: Reyna Maribel

texts.es:
Reyna, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, debido a la situación económica de sus padres no pudo continuar estudiando; actualmente está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor en pequeño, junto a él tiene dos hijos que estudian noveno grado y kínder, viven en casa de sus padres y también con su hermana. 

Reyna, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también le ayuda a su madre a vender en la tienda y en ocasiones le ayuda a su hermana a vender en el cafetín de la escuela de la comunidad, ya que su hermana tiene problemas físicos. 

Reyna, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas, porque su padre sembrará maíz; anteriormente se le otorgó un crédito para agricultura, pero debido a la sequía perdió la cosecha. 

Los sueños Reyna, es sacar a sus hijos adelante y también desea obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Reyna, 40 years old, studied until sixth grade. Due to the economic situation of her parents, she could not continue studying. Presently, she is in a common-law relationship, and her partner is a small-scale farmer. Along with him, she has two children that are in ninth grade and kindergarten. They live in her parents' house, along with her sister.

Reyna works in domestic services, but she also helps her mother sell in the store. On occasion, she helps her sister sell in the cafeteria in the community's school, now that her sister has physical problems. 

Reyna needs the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides, because her father sows corn. Previously, she was awarded a loan for agriculture, but due to the drought, she lost the harvest.  

The dreams of Reyna are for her children to get ahead and to obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is an intelligent and creative woman. She has been stitching her and her family's clothes since she was 16. Just after getting married, she quit the profession but now she started it again, after eight years. She is 23 years of age and a mother of three children. She is very carefully handling her household and kids and along with that, she has a lot of customers to cater to daily and she is doing the job well. Her husband is also very supportive of her doing the business. She applied for the loan to invest in her business to increase her profits and fulfill the growing needs of the family and herself. She is thankful to the Kiva platform for helping her and she admires the efforts put in by the Kiva team and BRAC Pakistan together.

loans.use: to invest in her stitching services business.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene 5 hijos, pero solo 4 viven con ellos. 

Carlos, tiene varios años de trabajar como albañil, pero aparte de eso también hace trabajos agrícolas para otras personas y también siembra maíz para el consumo de su familia; este tipo de trabajo agrícola lo aprendió desde pequeño con su padre; actualmente siembra en un terreno cerca de su casa.   

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos pequeños para engordarlos y posteriormente venderlos y poder construir instalaciones para mantenerlos. 

Carlos, sueña con tener una porqueriza bien instalada y por otra parte seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Carlos, who is 44 years old, studied through first grade. He is married and his wife works in the home. They have 5 children, but only 4 live with them.

Carlos has been working as a bricklayer for several years, but he also does agricultural work for other people and also plants corn for his family’s use. He learned this kind of agricultural work from the time he was young, from his father. He now farms a piece of land near his house.

Carlos needs the loan to buy young pigs so he can fatten them up and then sell them. He will also build an area to keep them.

Carlos dreams of having a well-appointed pig operation and also of helping his children so they can continue studying.

loans.use: to buy young pigs so he can fatten them up and then sell them. He will also build an area to keep them.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres Xetulul 2 Group

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 24 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de un hijo de  1 año de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del caserío Xetulul.
Catarina trabaja de sol a sol elaborando ropa típica de su región, esto para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, con esta actividad lleva 6 años de realizarlo.
Catarina con el acercamiento del fin de año ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y estilos para tejer en este fin de año los mejores güipiles de su región pues con esta época la demanda de ropa incrementa y lo que ella busca es aprovechar esta demanda.
Su esperanza de vida es fortalecer su negocio, tener su propio local para vender mejor y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Catarina is a single 24 year-old woman with a beautiful family and a one year-old son. This humble family lives in a community in the village of Xetulul. Catarina works from dawn to dusk making traditional clothing from her region in order to obtain income and get her family ahead. She has been doing this work for six years.

With the end of the year approaching, Catarina decided to apply for a loan to purchase yarn of different colors and styles in order to weave the best traditional blouses in her region for the end of the year. In this time of year demand for clothing increases and she wants to take advantage of this demand.

Her hope in life is to strengthen her business and have her own shop to make more sales and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase yarn of different colors and styles in order to make traditional blouses.

loans.name: Mahtam

texts.ru: Махтам серьезный и ответственный человек. Ей 56 лет. Она носит статус жены и матери. У Махтам сын и две дочки. Дети взрослые и семейные. У нее есть невестки прекрасные внуки. Муж занимается земледелием. Махтам 7 лет назад решила освоить деятельность мужа и идти по его стопам. Махтам сейчас тоже занимается растениеводством. У нее имеется не большой участок земли во дворе. В течение 7 лет Махтам постоянно сажает урожай. В этом году она хочет посадить урожай люцерны и репа. И активно готовится к посеву. Махкам на заемные деньги решила купить семена люцерны, репа и минеральные удобрения. У нее не получилось собрать достаточную сумму денег для приобретения средство для посева и у нее вся надежда остается на кредит.
texts.en:
Mahtam is a serious and responsible woman.  She is a 56-year-old wife and mother.  Her children (one son and two daughters) are adults now and they have their own families. Mahtam also has a daughter-in-law and some beautiful grandchildren.  Her husband works in agriculture.  Seven years ago, Mahtam decided to get involved in the same activity as her husband and to follow in his footsteps.  Today, she is also involved in crop farming.  She owns a small plot of land next to her house and, for the past seven years, she has been planting crops every year.  This year she wants to cultivate alfalfa and turnip, so she's getting ready to sow.

Mahtam will be using her loan to buy alfalfa and turnip seeds, as well as mineral fertilizers.  She was not able to gather enough money for this purchase, so she's placing all her hopes in this loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers as well as alfalfa and turnip seeds.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Oscar es un hombre emprendedor que a sus 28 años de edad cuenta con una pequeña huerta en la que cultiva productos como: plátanos, papaya, loroco, chile picante entre otros, además en su vivienda cuenta con una pequeña venta de productos de limpieza como: detergentes, jabón, cloro entre otros. Él vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos una niña de 2 años y un varón de 8 meses de edad. Oscar desea mejorar su huerta e invertir en más productos para su venta de productos de limpieza, por lo cual está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en abono para los cultivos y más productos para su venta de productos de limpieza y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Oscar is an enterprising man who at 28 years of age has a small garden in which he cultivates products like: plantains, papaya, loroco, and hot peppers, among others. Moreover, he has a small business selling cleaning products such as: detergents, soap, and bleach, etc.  He lives with his wife and their two children, a daughter who is two years old and a son who is eight months old.

Oscar wants to improve his garden and invest in more cleaning products to sell, which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in fertilizer for his crops and more cleaning products to sell, and in this way, improve his income.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizer for his crops and in more cleaning products to sell and in this way, improve his income.

loans.name: Ronald Enrique

texts.es: Ronald de 25 años es un joven que decidido a emprender una actividad adicional a su trabajo como empleado en un almacén ubicado en la ciudad de Barranquilla, aprovechando sus habilidades sociales y el gran grupo de personas que conoce, para aumentar sus ingresos consideró que el comercio era la oportunidad para hacer realidad su sueño. Inició con escasas mercancías entre ellas jeans, camisetas y zapatos que promocionó a sus compañeros de trabajo, amigos, familiares y referidos con gran acogida por su buen gusto y precios de oportunidad. En la actualidad cuenta con dos años en la labor con excelente resultado y está muy entusiasmado por que con sus nuevos ingresos ha logrado beneficiar a su familia.  Próximamente se acerca una temporada de gran demanda de prendas de vestir y calzado, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar ropa para damas y caballero encargos que le han solicitado sus clientes.  Ronald está soltero y a futuro desea conformar una familia.
texts.en:
Ronald is a 25 year old young man who who decided to undertake an activity outside his work as an employee in a store located in the city of Barranquilla. He is taking advantage of his social skills and the large group of people he knows to increase his revenues. He considers that commerce is his opportunity to make his dream a reality.

He started with very little merchandise including some jeans, t-shirts and shoes that he promoted to his fellow workers, friends, families and people referred to him. This was well accepted because of his good taste and opportunistic prices. He currently has two years with excellent results in this work and he is very enthusiastic as he has managed to benefit his family with the new income.

The season of high demand for clothing and footwear is approaching so he is applying for a loan from Kiva, an opportunity to access the financial world through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy women's and men's clothing for orders that his clients have requested. Ronald is single and in the future would like to form a family.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothing, orders which his clients have requested.

loans.name: Donatila De Jesus

texts.es:
Donatila, es una mujer viuda que vive con su hijo menor, el cual está estudiando en la Universidad y una nieta que tiene 12 años y estudia tercer ciclo en el colegio, además ella tiene otros dos hijos que ya son independiente, ella se dedica a la venta de pollo fresco; comenzó hacerlo hace 28 años, Donatila aprendió a este negocio gracias a su mamá y a una amiga que tenía experiencia en el mercado, cuando ella decidió dejar la casa de sus padres para poder casarse fue cuando ella opto por poner su propio negocio.
Donatila solicita un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de pollo, alitas en caja, chorizos y otra variedad de embutidos que le permitirán incrementar su inventario, para ofrecer una amplia variedad en esta temporada de fin de año y fiestas patronales de su localidad, con esto ella busca fortalecer su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos económicos que le ayudaran continuar dándole el estudio a su hijo y a su nieta.
Como todo ser humano ella tiene muchos sueños y uno de ellos es poder posicionarse como una gran micro-empresaria, para tener estabilidad económica y así tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Donatila is a widowed woman who lives with her younger son, who is studying in the university, and her granddaughter, who is 12 years old and is in the third stage of school. In addition, she has two other children who are now independent. 

She works in the sale of fresh chicken. She began to do this 28 years ago. Donatila learned this business thanks to her mother and a friend who had experience in the market. When she decided to leave her parents' house to be able to get married, she chose to open her own business.

Donatila is requesting a loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of chicken, packaged chicken wings, chorizos, and other variety of cold meats that will allow her to increase her inventory and to be able to offer a large variety in this season of the end of the year and patron saints' festivals of her town. With this loan, she is seeking to strengthen her business and receive better economic income that will help her continue to keep her son and granddaughter in school.

Like all human beings, she has many dreams. One of them is to be able to position herself as a big micro-business, to have economic stability, and thus have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken, packaged chicken wings, chorizos, and other variety of cold meats that will allow her to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Plaxeda

texts.en: Plaxeda is a 47-year-old mother to five children. She deals in textile clothes sales and tailoring. She supplements her income with a retail shop and rental houses that she recently finished constructing from savings from her previous loans. Her dream is to see her children through school and to grow her retail shop to a wholesale shop in future. Plaxeda requests a loan to buy textile cloth and school uniforms for selling.

loans.use: to buy textile cloth and school uniform material for selling.

loans.name: Darlin Aida

texts.es: Darlin cuenta con 43 años de edad de los cuales los últimos 7 los ha dedicado a su negocio de venta de ropa para bebé la cual realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo las principales calles del municipio. Ella siempre busca la manera de estar pendiente de sus dos hijos de 22 y 21 años de edad, ya que a pesar que son mayores, siempre está pendiente de sus necesidades. Darlin desea mejorar el corredor de su vivienda, ya que el piso de este es de tierra, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, grava, cemento, lámina y madera para mejorar el piso y techo del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Darlin is 43 years old, the last 7 of which she has dedicated to her business selling baby clothing. She does this business as a street vendor, traversing the main streets of the town. 

She has always sought a way to look after her 22- and 21-year-old children, because even though they are older, she is always looking after their needs.

Darlin wants to improve the hallway of her home, since it has a dirt floor. For this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: sand, gravel, cement, sheet metal, and wood to improve the floor and roof of the hallway of her home.

loans.use: to invest in sand, gravel, cement, sheet metal, and wood to improve the floor and roof of hallway of her home.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María es una emprendedora mujer de 51 años, habitante de un barrio en el municipio de Soledad y madre de cuatro hijos de 29, 27, 22 y 11 años, en compañía de su cónyuge emprendió su negocio de expendio de comidas y licores al palpar que su familia estaba pasando por muchas necesidades, pues el salario que su cónyuge ganaba como empleado de una empresa privada no les alcanzaba para solventar todos los gastos en el hogar y se veían siempre intrínsecos en miles de dificultades para conseguir los recursos. Desde que María administra su negocio, las cosas han cambiado y su familia goza de beneficios que anteriormente no podían tener. Todos los días de la semana ella está dispuesta a recibir a sus clientes interesados en degustar comidas rápidas o simplemente a tomar algún refresco o bebida alcohólica, acompañados de amigos y familiares. María  realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para surtir con licores nacionales y extranjeros, gaseosas, cervezas y víveres para la preparación de las comidas rápidas; pollo, carne, embutido, panes, salsas y aderezos. María sigue luchando porque su familia tenga un mejor bienestar y con su negocio y las nuevas financiaciones considera que llegará muy lejos.
texts.en:
María is a 51 year-old entrepreneur who lives in a neighborhood in the town of Soledad. She is a mother of four children who are 29, 27, 22, and 11 years old. Along with her husband, she started her fast food and liquor shop when she felt that her family had a lot of unmet needs. The salary her husband earns as an employee at a private business wasn’t enough to cover all the household expenses and they always found themselves with a thousand problems preventing them from having the funds they needed. 

Since María started her business, things have changed and the family enjoys benefits they previously couldn’t obtain. Every day of the week, she is ready to receive clients wanting to enjoy some fast food or have a soft drink or alcoholic drink with their friends and family. 

María applied for a loan, a Kiva loan, which was an opportunity her to become involved in the financial services of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to stock her business with national and international brands of liquors, soft drinks, beers, and ingredients for preparing fast foods, such as chicken, beef, cold cuts, breads, sauces, and dressings. María continues working hard so her family can have improved well being. With her business and the new financing, she believes she will go far.

loans.use: to buy national and international brands of liquors, soft drinks, beers, and ingredients for preparing fast foods, such as chicken, beef, cold cuts, breads, sauces, and dressings.

loans.name: Teódulo

texts.es:
Teódulo, de 79 años de edad, no fue a la escuela porque sus padres no tenían recursos económicos suficientes porque eran pobres, está soltero y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos viven con él, uno estudia y el otro trabaja con él en la agricultura.  

Teódulo, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la siembra de granos básicos y al manejo de ganado,  todo eso lo aprendió gracias a sus padres quienes siempre se dedicaron a lo mismo; actualmente siembra casi 28,000 metros cuadrados de maicillo y 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, porque ya tiene terreno propio.

Teódulo, necesita el préstamo para comprar pastaje para el ganado, porque debido a las perdidas de cultivo, no tiene suficiente alimento para darle a su ganado y tiene que comprarlo. 

El principal sueño de Teódulo, es ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Teódulo, 79, did not attend school because his parents did not have sufficient financial resources since they were poor. He is single and has five children, two of whom live with him; one is in school and the other works in agriculture.

For his entire life, Teódulo has made a living through planting basic grains and livestock management. He learned all of this thanks to his parents who always dedicated themselves to the same work. He now has nearly 28,000 square meters of millet and 7,000 square meters of corn because he has his own land.

Teódulo needs the loan in order to buy grass for the livestock because, due to the loss of his crops, he does not have enough food to give his livestock and he needs to buy it.

Teódulo's main goal is to help his children study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy grass for the livestock.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en:
Magaji is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Magaji has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Magaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Magaji can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Magaji will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Magaji is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gabriela Isabel

texts.es:
Gabriela, de 27 años de edad, vive con sus padres en su casa, no estudio y hoy en día le ayuda a sus padres a trabajar en casa, ella no tiene hijos.

Gabriela, se dedica a la ganadería junto a su padre, ella le ayuda a comprar y vender el ganado y administrar en general el negocio; además de ganado de repasto tienen vacas lecheras, de la cual elaboran productos lácteos para vender.

Gabriela, necesita el préstamo para comprar más ganado y para comprar ingredientes para hacer alimento para el ganado y así alimentar a sus vacas lecheras.  

Los sueños de Gabriela son, continuar su trabajo con su padre y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 27 years old and lives with her parents in their house. She didn't go to school and helps her parents work in their home. She has no children.

Gabriela works with livestock along with her father. She helps him buy and sell cattle and administer the business. In addition to beef cattle, they also have dairy cows from which they produce dairy products to sell.

Gabriela needs the loan to purchase more cattle and to purchase ingredients for livestock feed in order to feed her dairy cows.

Gabriela's dreams are to continue working with her father and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and to purchase ingredients to make livestock feed in order to feed her milk cows.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.fr: Nancy a 32 ans. Elle est dans la revente de boissons gazeuses et alcoolisées depuis cinq ans. Elle a quatre enfants et vit en union libre. Elle vend ses produits à domicile. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Nancy is 32.  She has been reselling carbonated drinks and spirits for the past five years.  She has four children and lives in a common-law marriage.  She sells her goods from home.  She is taking this loan to increase her stocks.

loans.use: to buy crates of carbonated drinks.

loans.name: Gulzhan

texts.en:
Gulzhan is 19 years old freshman in the International and Comparative Politics Program at AUCA. Gulzhan says that she was afraid of entering AUCA. Since childhood she was told by people that AUCA is an expensive university just for rich people and it is really hard to study here. At the contrary it had a lot of advantages: it was the prestigious university in the region with quality education, rich library, high-ranged professor staff and successful Alumni.
All these reasons made Gulzhan’s mind to dream about AUCA and do her best at school to enter it.

In 2014 Gulzhan finished school with excellent marks and was chosen as one of the 70 best students for the AUCA 1-year-study Preparatory Program. Following the requirements of this Program, Gulzhan moved to Bishkek from her village, lived in the dormitory and got stipend. She remembers last year like one of the best and memorable years of her life, where the university life was full of academic and extra-curricular events, acquaintance with international students and life in the capital.

1 year past so quickly that now Gulzhan is a freshman, and applying for a Kiva loan to pay for her undergraduate studies at AUCA. She confesses that her family has hard times with her payment, but they wish to see their daughter well-educated and qualified person in the future.

Gulzhan’s father is a seller of CDs in the bazaar\market. His salary is about 400 USD per month, and he is the only employed person in the family. Her mother is a house-wife; she looks after her little baby. Also Gulzhan has 2 younger siblings, who go to school. So her family’s hope and belief is just her father. Learning out about Kiva loan, Gulzhan was happy to help her father.

loans.use: to pay her tuition costs in International and Comparative Politics.  Her father sells CD's in the market.

loans.name: Sherline

texts.fr: Sherline, 32 ans, est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle est commerçante. Elle revend du riz et du sucre par sac. Elle demande du crédit pour faire progresser l’activité en augmentant à chaque fois ses stocks.
texts.en: Sherline, 32, is married and the mother of two children.  She works in retail and resells bags of rice and sugar.  She is taking this loan to gradually increase her stocks and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy locally-produced rice.

loans.name: Pinay Group

texts.en:
Pinay Group consists of three hard-working ladies, each with her own dreams to accomplish and life to live. They all decided to leave their hometown the Philippines, seeking a better opportunity to develop their families' living. Their common interest is developing their living and businesses at the same time; that's why they decided to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, which each one of them planned to invest in her own way.

Erna is the featured borrower of Pinay group, a 49-year-old mother of five, who works as a housekeeper. She decided to invest her acquired Al Majmoua loan to pay for her children's school fees back in the Philippines. She is the lady at the far left side of the picture.

At the center of the picture with a veil is Roselia. She is a 48-year-old married mother of four, who settled in Lebanon and started her own clothes selling business instead of continuing to provide housekeeping services. Her acquired loan will be invested in purchasing a winter clothes collection and developing her business.

Cecilia is the lady at the far right side of the picture. She is a 46-year-old divorced lady who will send the money to her parents back in the Philippines.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees back in the Philippines.

loans.name: Nerses

texts.en:
Nerses is 43 years old and he lives in Geghanush village of the Synik region. Nerses used to work as a locksmith, but for 15 years he has worked for the military troops as a contractual military serviceman. His wife also works with him in the same military troop. They have three children. Their elder son is in the army now, passing his military service. Their daughter is a student and she lives and studies in Yerevan city. Their smallest son lives with his grandmother.

Nerses with his wife is engaged in agricultural work, and in his garden he cultivates beans, potatoes and cucumbers. He also has persimmon and apple trees. He sells all these harvests and also separates them for his family's use. He mentions that he divides the income that he manages to have from his garden in many parts so that he will manage to cover all of his children’s needs in addition to his daughter’s tuition fees. This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams is very important for Nerses, as with its help he must organize and do the autumn grain sowing activities on his land.

loans.use: to organize and do the autumn grain sowing activities on his land, which is very important for him.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz, frijoles, pepinos y guisquil desde hace mas de 3 años comercializa sus cultivos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de u hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para comprar insumos agricolas como: abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Thirty-four year old Marta lives in her own home with her two daughters. She has been working growing corn, beans, cucumbers and squash for three years. She sells her harvests in different markets near her home and with the earnings that she makes she is able to cover some of the household expenses.

She is applying for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. so that she can continue her work in order to have better economic returns.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Manzarmoh

texts.en:
Manzarmoh was born in 1967 year. She is widowed and she has 2 children. Manzarmoh is very hardworking woman and she has been busy with animal husbandry and farming business more than 20 year. She grows variety vegetables as onion, cabbage, carrots etc.

Manzarmoh always wanted to get higher education but she had not opportunity. Manzarmoh now tries for education of her children. Her son is a student of the first course and she must pay for his university tuition. Manzarmoh is asking for a loan of 8500 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for the university tuition of her son.

loans.name: Quetline

texts.fr: Quetline est âgée de 36 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a deux enfants.  Elle revend des vêtements. Elle a déjà  15 ans dans cette activité. Elle s’y investit tous les jours. Elle veut améliorer sa condition de vie au travers du développement de son commerce. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Quetline is 36.  She is in a common-law marriage and she has two children.  She resells clothes and has been involved in this activity for the past 15 years.  She works every day.  Her goal is to grow her business and ultimately improve her living conditions.  She is taking this loan to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Uwani

texts.en:
Uwani is a maize farmer from Kargo village. As a Babban Gona member, Uwani is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Uwani would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Uwani can to store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Uwani no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Uwani hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Leonne

texts.fr: Léonne a 44 ans. Elle est mariée et a 3 enfants qui sont scolarisés. Depuis 16 ans, elle a mis sur pied une petite activité de revente de produits alimentaires. Elle demande un microcrédit afin d'éviter les ruptures de stock. Ce microcrédit lui permet d'acheter des sacs de Haricots. A l'avenir, Léonne espère que ses enfants feront de grandes études et auront de bonnes conditions de vie.
texts.en: Léonne is 44 years old, married, and the mother of three children who all attend school.  Sixteen years ago, she opened her own small grocery shop.  She is taking a micro loan in order to avoid being out of stock.  She will use her loan to buy some bags of beans.  In the future, she would like to see her children go far in their studies, so that they can have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy some bags of beans.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 36-year-old married mother of two, who decided a year ago to start her own business in Lebanon that has to do with selling traditional women's abaya.

She is displaying her own abaya in a friend's shoes and bags selling shop, planning to open her own shop in the future. Hanan was abroad with her family and she used to work in this domain, she has a good experience and works hard to increase her selling and customers. She is a good supporter of her family, since her husband works abroad seeking a better income business.

To improve her business, Hanan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise with new Abaya Winter collection.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new abaya winter collection.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sandra, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera y no tiene hijos y vive con su abuela nada más. 

Sandra, desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella aprendió todo acerca de este negocio gracias a una vecina que la impulso a iniciarlo, ella sale a vender 3 veces por semana a los cantones más cercanos y los otros días de la semana se dedica a cuidar a una niña y a su abuela.   

Sandra, necesita el préstamo para comprar camisas, faldas, ropa interior y ropa para niños, porque se acerca la época navideña en donde venden más.

Los sueños de Sandra, son seguir trabajando y hacer el negocio más grande para poder mantener a su abuela.
texts.en:
Sandra is 22 years old and studied through high school. She is single, has no children, and lives with her grandmother, no one else.

Sandra has earned a living selling clothes for a year. She learned everything around this business thanks to a neighbor who inspired her to start it. She goes out to sell 3 times per week to the closest cantons, and the other days of the week she dedicates herself to caring for a girl and her grandmother.

Sandra needs the loan to buy shirts, skirts, underwear, and clothing for children, because the Christmas season is approaching in which she sells more.

Sandra's dreams are to continue working and to make the business bigger in order to be able to support her grandmother.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, underwear, and clothing for children.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La prestataria asumió la responsabilidad del negocio de alquiler de disfraces de su hermana cuando ésta falleció por complicaciones de una grave enfermedad. La prestataria no sabía nada de esto negocio pero renunció a su trabajo para dedicarse al negocio emprendido por su hermana y, sobre todo, para encargarse de su sobrino que quedó huérfano.
Una de sus tías la apoya en la elaboración de los vestidos cosidos a mano. Sin embargo, la alta demanda por parte de colegios la ha llevado a solicitar dos máquinas industriales para incrementar su producción y cumplir con la demanda, además de incrementar sus ingresos. 
A diferencia de su hermana, la prestataria sí pudo curarse de la enfermedad. Su madre vive en los Estados Unidos hace cuatro años y envía parte de sus ganancias a su hija y nieto. Su padre trabaja en construcción ocasionalmente y la apoya con el negocio haciendo publicidad y comprando las telas para los disfraces.
texts.en:
The borrower assumed responsibility for her sister's costume rental business when the sister died of complications from a serious illness. She didn't know anything about this business but she quit her job to devote herself to her sister's business and especially to take care of her orphaned nephew.

One of her aunts helps her make the handmade outfits. High demand from schools, however, has caused her to request two industrial sewing machines to increase her production and meet the demand as well as increase her income.

Unlike her sister, the borrower was able to recover from her illness. Her mother has lived in the United States for four years and she sends part of her earnings to her daughter and her grandson. Her father works in construction sometimes and helps her with the business doing advertising and buying fabric for the costumes.

loans.use: to buy two industrial sewing machines

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a maize farmer from Kugawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Amos is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Amos would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Amos can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Amos no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Amos hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has been making and selling tortillas for ten years. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has a lot of customers. With the earnings she makes from her sales she is able to cover some of the household expenses.

She is applying for this loan to purchase 100-pound bags of corn and lime so she's able to continue making tortillas in order to have more income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase 100 pound bags of corn and lime.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize at harvest time when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s 43,425 NGN loan he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member Abdullahi will benefit from its marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2000 USD per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to store his maize at harvest time, then sell it at a future date for a better price.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario, es un hombre que está casado y actualmente vive con su esposa y una ahijada, con la esposa procreo 4 hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 28, 30, 32 y 36 años los cuales ya son independientes, Mario se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, además practica la fabricación de muebles, el oficio de la ganadería lo aprendió de un familiar compra y vende ganado de manera personal desde hace 10 años, tiene un horario de trabajo de seis de la mañana a seis de la tarde, la ventaja con la que él cuenta es que tiene bastante experiencia y conocimiento en este mercado, por lo que se le hace muy fácil poder realizar la actividad.
Mario solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de dos terneras grandes, esto le permitirá que su negocio crezca y que sus ganancias sean mejores, pues de esa manera podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Mario sueña con ver crecer su negocio, tener más ganado que le generen estabilidad económica  para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is a married man who lives with his wife and a goddaughter. With his wife, he has 4 children, aged 28, 30, 32 and 36. His children are now all independent. 

Mario works in agriculture and with cattle, as well as in furniture making. He learned about livestock from a family member. He has been buying and selling cattle personally for 10 years. He works from six in the morning until six at night. HIs advantage is that he has a lot of experience and knowledge in this market, which makes it very easy to do his work.

Mario is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of two large calves, which will allow his business to grow and his earnings to be better. This way, he can give his family a better quality of life.

Mario dreams of seeing his business grow, and having more cattle which will generate financial stability for Mario and his family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of two large calves, which will allow his business to grow and his earnings to be better.

loans.name: Bala

texts.en:
Bala is a maize farmer from Abacha Way village. As a member of Kiva's field partner Babban Gona he is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona Bala would have had to sell his maize at harvest time when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With a 43,829 NGN loan from Babban Gona, he can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Bala is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to store his maize and sell it in the future when the price for maize is higher.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, de 65 años de edad, es viudo y vive con sus dos hijos de 29 y 19 años de edad, el más joven estudia, mientras que el oto muchacho trabaja con él en los cultivos y la ganadería.

Lucio, se dedica a la ganadería desde hace más de 25 años, asegura que gracias a su trabajo tiene todo lo que posee y ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.- Lucio, se dedica a la compra, venta y crianza de ganado y actualmente posee más de 20 cabezas de ganado que esta pendiente de venderlos. 

Lucio, necesita el préstamo para comprar sacate, maíz, melaza y otros ingredientes más para hacer silo para alimentar su ganado, para engordarlos y venderlos a mejor precio.- Además, quiere utilizar otra parte del préstamo para pagar la mano de obra de los mozos que le ayudaran con el trabajo. 

Los sueños de Lucio, son poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener buenos ingresos para darles siempre lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Lucio is a 65 year old widower who lives with his two children aged 29 and 19 years old. The youngest studies while the other works with the crops and livestock.

Lucio has worked raising livestock for more than 25 years and he states that thanks to his work he has everything he possesses and has been able to raise his family. Lucio works buying, selling and raising cattle and currently has twenty head of cattle that he is waiting to sell.

Lucio needs the loan to buy hay, corn, molasses and other ingredients to make silage to feed his cattle to fatten them and sell them at a higher price. Also he wants to use the other part of the loan to pay for labor for the men who help him with the work.

Lucio's dream is to continue with his work and thus have good income to always provide the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy hay, corn, molasses and other ingredients to make silage to feed his cattle.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia, a tailor, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a smart woman who manages both her home and business very well.

Nadia has good business skills in managing her work by herself and is doing quite well. But lacking sufficient business capital to purchase inventory for the upcoming season, she has applied for a 30,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner Brac Pakistan to invest in materials necessary for her tailoring work.

Nadia wishes to give thanks to both Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan for this loan opportunity.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 46 años de edad, esta simple mente unida de hecho con su esposo con el que ha procreado una familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 8 y 30 años de edad, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Elena con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa típica, con esta labor ella lleva 10 años de realizarlo, le encanta esta actividad pues lo realiza desde la comodidad de su hogar permitiéndole a sí realizar otras actividades.
Elena con el paso de los años su familia ha estado creciendo y así también sus necesidades  y una de las más primordiales es la compra de un terreno para cultivo esto con el afán de tener un lugar donde poder cultivar y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su mayor anhelo es mejorar sus ingresos económicos, incrementar su cultivo,  y pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elena is a 46-year-old woman. She is, in fact, simply attached to her husband, with whom she has had a family of 6 children, between the ages 8-30 years old. They live in a community of Sololá.

Elena, with the ambition of obtaining income and getting her family ahead, earns a living making and selling traditional clothes. She has carried out this work for 10 years. She loves this business, because she carries it out from the comfort of her home, thus allowing her to fulfill other activities.

With the passing of the years, Elena's family has been growing and thus her necessities have as well. One of the most fundamental is purchasing a plot for cultivation. This is with the ambition of having a place where it is possible to farm and increase her income.

Her greatest wish is to improve her economic income, to increase her crops, and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy land for cultivation.

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es:
María, de 28 años de edad, está casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar, mientras que su esposo trabaja como empleado en una granja y también hace milpa para el consumo del hogar y vender. 

María, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero también se encarga de llevarle la comida a su esposo y a los mozos que trabajan con él y aveces le ayuda a ir a abonar o limpiar la milpa. 

María, necesita el préstamo para pagar la maquina para sacar el maíz y para pagar los mozos.

María, sueña con obtener una buena cosecha este año y vender una parte de lo cosechado.
texts.en:
María, age 28, is married. She lives with her husband and two children, ages four and two. She takes care of the household tasks, while her husband works as an employee on a farm and also grows corn to use at home and to sell.

María takes care of the household tasks, but she also is responsible for taking food to her husband and the young men who work with him. Sometimes, she helps him to go fertilize or clean the corn.

María needs the loan to pay for a machine to harvest the corn and to pay the workers.

María dreams of bringing in a good harvest this year and selling a part of the harvest.

loans.use: to pay for a machine to harvest the corn and to pay the workers.

loans.name: Kabuswa Moricho Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Susan. She is a member of Kabuswa Group. She is twenty six years old, married, and has two children that go to school. She joined Hand In Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and has been an active member in all group activities. She has used the training offered by Hand In Hand Eastern Africa to manage and operate her enterprise well.

Her economic activity is dairy farming where she keeps dairy cows and sells milk to the local dairy. Susan is borrowing a loan to buy feed for dairy cows. This will enhance production so that she will be able to pay her children’s school fee, expand her enterprise, and also meet daily basic needs such as food, clothing, and a better shelter for her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the support she has received and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy feed for dairy cows. This will enhance the production of milk.

loans.name: Laura Antonia

texts.es:
Laura, es una mujer que vive con sus 4 hijos, de los cuales dos trabajan y los otros dos estudian; ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, licuados, refrescos, aparte de ello desempeña las actividades del hogar. La venta de pupusas fue un oficio que lo aprendió de su mamá, luego ella se independizo y decidió poner su propio negocio; Laura ya tiene 18 años de dedicarse a la venta de estos productos.
Laura solicita un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de las pupusas como: lo es quesillo, chicharrón, loroco, frijoles, aceite, bebidas refrescantes y otros, para su comercialización, con esto Laura busca poder fortalecer su negocio, aumentar sus ventas, generar más ingresos.
El mayor sueño de Laura es poder crecer como micro- empresaria para darle una mejor estabilidad económica a su familia
texts.en:
Laura is a woman who lives with her four children, out of whom two work and the other two are in school. She works selling pupusas, smoothies, and soft drinks. Besides that, she carries out household tasks. The pupusa sales was a job that she learned from her mother. Later, she became independent and decided to start her own business. Laura has now been working in the sale of these products for 18 years.

Laura is requesting a loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies for making pupusas, such as soft cheese, pork rinds, loroco (a vine with edible flowers), beans, oil, refreshing beverages, and more, in order to sell them. With this, Laura seeks to be able to strengthen her business, increase her sales, and generate more income.

Laura’s greatest dream is to grow as a micro-businesswoman, in order to give greater economic stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make pupusas such as soft cheese, pork rinds, loroco, beans, oil, refreshing beverages, and more.

loans.name: María Transito

texts.es:
María, de 60 años de edad, vive con su esposo de 68 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura y con ellos viven dos de sus hijos que trabajan como empleados en una granja de cerdos y los otros dos muchachos están en el extranjero. 

María, es ama de casa y cumple con todas las obligaciones del hogar, pero también por las tardes vende frutas en el portón de su casa, ella lleva muchos años de vender frutas y a través de esa venta sencilla y modesta ha logrado salir adelante.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar grandes cantidades de frutas como guineos, plátanos, manzanas y uvas y poner un puesto de venta de frutas en el mercado.

María, sueña con estabilizar su negocio y surtir más para que su vida mejore.
texts.en:
60-year-old María lives with her 68-year-old husband, who earns a living in agriculture. Their 2 children, who work as employees on a pig farm, live with them. Their other 2 children are abroad.

María is a housewife and fulfills all the household chores. But in addition, in afternoons she sells fruits at her house's gate. She has sold fruit for many years and through those simple, modest sales, she has managed to get ahead.

María needs the loan in order to buy large quantities of fruit, such as: bananas, plantains, apples, and grapes and to put a fruit selling stall in the market.

María dreams of establishing her business and stocking more so that her life may improve.

loans.use: to buy large amounts of fruit like bananas, plantains, apples, and grapes to organize a fruit stand.

loans.name: Sabeti

texts.en:
Sabeti is a Kiva borrower. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. Her business is located in a busy area.

She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

She hopes that in the future that she will have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sunday has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sunday would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Sunday can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Sunday will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Sunday is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mamitiana Simonette

texts.fr:
Simonette est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont tous  scolarisés.
Elle exerce une activité de fabrication et vente (livraison chez des épiciers) des différents beignets comme: beignets de crevettes, beignets poissons, beignets de viandes, beignets de bananes, catless, etc... Comme nous pouvons voir sur sa photo, c'est elle même qui fait la préparation et la cuisson (frire les beignets). L'activité se développe petit à petit: les clients augmentent ainsi que la production et cela va de soi avec son revenu.  
L'objectif est d'épargner davantage afin de pouvoir acheter un terrain et construire une maison un jour.
texts.en:
Simonette is a hard-working and resourceful woman who is 36 years old. She is the married mother of three children, all in school.

She has a business making and selling (deliveries to grocery stores) different beignets, such as: shrimp beignets, fish beignets, meat beignets, banana beignets, catless [spiced chicken patties], etc... As can be seen in the photo, she herself is doing the cooking (frying the beignets). This business is developing bit by bit: her customer base is growing, as well as her production, thus her revenues too.

The goal is to save more money to be able to purchase a plot of land and build a house, one day.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oils, fish, shrimp, bananas,...

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is thirty years old and married with five children. She is a dairy farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 and received training on enterprise development and financial planning which has equipped her with the skills to effectively manage her enterprise.

She is taking a loan from Kiva to buy fodder for her cows. She hopes the loan will help boost her business and increase her income so she can afford quality education for her children.

Grace is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her cows.

loans.name: Yesenia Patricia

texts.es: Yesenia de 36 años es madre de tres hijos y vive con su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla.  Al ser su familia numerosa, tan solo se dedicaba a las labores en el hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos que por estar pequeños incurrían en cuidados especiales, sin embargo recibió el consejo de una amiga que le propuso vender mercancías por intermedio de catálogos y le explicó la dinámica; muy entusiasmada acepto el reto al considerar que no obstaculizaría su diario vivir.  Fue así como se incorporó a una empresa multinivel como consultora y en la actualidad cuenta con quince años de experiencia comercializando calzado, ropa, relojes, fragancias, electrodomésticos, y demás productos que le solicitan sus clientes.  Yesenia realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar los encargos de sus clientes: ropa, calzado, cosméticos, fragancias, electrodomésticos y demás.  Yesenia sueña con tener su casa y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
36-year-old Yesenia is the mother of three children and lives with her partner in a neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla. As her family is large, she dedicated herself only to household chores and looking after her children--being small they required special care. However, she received advice from a friend who suggested selling merchandise through catalogues and explained the dynamic to her. She very enthusiastically accepted the challenge, considering that it would not obstruct her daily living.

Thus, she was incorporated into a multilevel business as a consultant. She now has 15 years of experience selling shoes, clothes, watches, fragrances, electric appliances, and the rest of the products that her clients order.

Yesenia made a Kiva loan application. This is an opportunity to be linked to financial life through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and to buy her clients' requests: clothes, shoes, cosmetics, fragrances, electric appliances, and more. Yesenia dreams of having a home and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy her clients' requests: clothes, shoes, cosmetics, fragrances, appliances, and more.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 36 years old and lives in the village Tsav of the Syunik region with his wife, two sons and his mother.
