Artur is employed and works at a private workshop but since a very young age he has been engaged in farming. He used to do all of the work with his father but since his father died last year he manages nearly all it alone. On the farm he has cows, pigs and chickens. He also has a nice vegetable and fruit garden where he cultivates beans, potatos, garlic, tomatos, cucumber and he also has apples, nuts, figs and pear trees. 

Artur’s mother sells all of these fruits and vegetables alongside the farm’s milk, meat and eggs to their regular customers. This farmer does his best to earn more from farming and continue developing his farm first established by his father. With this loan of 400,000 Armenian drams Artur wants to buy as much fodder as possible for all his farm cattle in order to keep them fed during winter time.

loans.use: to buy as much fodder as possible for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Alousius

texts.en:
Alousius is an active married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming and has been a farmer for over ten years. He was inspired to start farming so as to increase his house hold income that would enable him to educate all his children.

He has hopes of building a very good permanent residential house and expanding his gardens into a modern farm but faces challenges of lack of committed workers and inadequate capital.

He needs money to buy manure, mulch and fertilizers for farm.

loans.use: to buy manure, mulch and fertilizers for farm.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is a hard-working, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his farm. He still deals in farming where he grows coffee and sugarcane alongside cattle fattening, where he earns an extra income. He started these businesses to earn a living and meet his family's needs like paying school fees for his children.

Milton has hopes of expanding his farm and improving his household income, which he believes will help him educate all of his children. His main challenges are the high rate of taxation, inadequate capital and price fluctuations, though he hopes to increase his profits and be able to educate his children. 
 
Milton is requesting a loan to buy manure, mulch and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure, mulch and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Uruwet Asis Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Lucy, a member of Uruwet Asis Self Help Group. She is 27 years old, married and blessed with 5 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

Her economic activity is a shop. She is borrowing a loan to buy more stock of foodstuff for her shop. This will increase her level of income. Thus, she will provide better education and medical services to her children.

Lucy is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She has promised to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of foodstuff for her shop. This will increase her level of income.

loans.name: Lahanam Group

texts.en: Tay’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Tay and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits. Tay and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within these two years filter users, like Tay’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.fr:
Yvonne est une femme courageuse et travailleuse de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Ces enfants sont âgés de 8 à 17 ans et ils sont tous scolarisés. Sa belle mère aussi est à sa charge à cause de sa maladie.
Auparavant, elle exerçait une activité d'élevage de volailles et de porcs. A cause d'un cambriolage subi par la famille en 2012, l'activité s'est volatilisée, les cheptels  sont disparus, c'était la perte totale. De ce fait, elle est venu chez Cefor pour demander un crédit afin de pouvoir démarrer une autre activité: il s'agit d'un gargote. Elle dirige le gargote il y a maintenant trois ans, son problème est le matériel et insuffisance de fonds de roulement et en même temps elle essaie de redémarrer l'élevage.
texts.en:
Yvonne is a courageous 42-year-old woman. She is married and has three children between the ages of 8 and 17. They all go to school. She supports her mother-in-law as she has an illness.

She formerly raised poultry and pigs. Due to a burglary in 2012, her business fell apart. Her livestock disappeared and it was a total loss. As a result, she went to CEFOR for a loan to start a new business: a restaurant. She has been running the restaurant for three years. Her problem is buying equipment and a lack of working capital. At the same time, she is trying to restart her livestock business.

loans.use: buy a display case (used), 3 cooking pots, rice, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Kaseve Millenium W.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Esther. She is 37 years old, married and a mother of three children. She has greatly benefited from the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa Enterprise training.

She operates a general retail store where she sells commodities such as sugar, flour, soap and detergents. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more household goods to add to her stock for increased income. This will enable her to pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy household goods to add to her stock for increased income to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sanjay Kumar

texts.en:
The journey of Sanjay Kumar, 21, who comes from a family with modest means, started from a village in Bhadrak, Odisha and has reached a critical stage. Having graduated with a Bachelor’s degree, he is looking for employment suitable for his expertise. But in this competitive job market, it can be extremely hard to land a job without a specialized set of skills.

Sanjay Kumar hasn’t allowed his frustrations to crush his spirit and has enrolled in a PGDBO Banking course to make his profile suitable for his prospective employers. Sanjay Kumar’s participation in this course will not only enhance his financial skills, but it will also help him pick up valuable soft skills. Thus, he is seeking a loan of 60,000 INR that he intends to use to pay his banking course fees.

Sanjay Kumar is eagerly awaiting for your kind help.

loans.use: to pay his banking course fees

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 34 years old and married with three children who are in school, Rona works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, shampoo, soap, etc. to sell.

Rona has been in this business for five years.

In the future Rona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, shampoo, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary June

texts.en:
Mary June is 28 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Mary June works very hard to provide for them.

Mary June runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Mary June has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Mary June would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 54 years old and married and she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kantilal

texts.en:
Kantilal is a 21-year-old studious boy from Cuttack district, Odisha, India. His father is a service holder, and his mother is a homemaker. His parents' most cherished dream has been for Kantilal to get a good education and build a successful career.

Kantilal is a very hardworking boy who devotes eight hours a day to his studies. This ambitious boy wants to pursue his Btech (Bachelor of Technology) course, but due to his financial constraints, he is facing numerous difficulties to undertake the course. He wants a loan of 55,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum to pay the course fees to get a degree to be an engineer. He is interested in pursuing this course, as this is a growing field with a huge range of job opportunities.

Your loan amount can help Kantilal complete his course successfully with flying colors and get a job with a handsome package, which will make his family proud to have a son like him. Kantilal is eagerly awaiting your kind hearts to help him achieve his dream.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for getting a degree to be an engineer

loans.name: Araqsi

texts.en:
Araqsi is a student at the Pedagogical University of Armenia.

She lives in Bazmaberd village in the Aragatsotn region with her parents. Araqsi asks for this loan to cover her university tuition fee for the first year in her Master's degree program to continue her education.

She hopes to receive the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fee.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ofelia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

Ofelia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Namarkkeua Group

texts.en:
Seena understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Seena knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Seena purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Seena is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nalaong Group

texts.en: Hom is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Hom and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Hom and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Hom and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne disease. After totaling up the costs, Hom and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a talented baker. She is passionate for sweets. Thus, she worked hard from her house to refine her talents and start her own homemade cakes and sweets business in 2013.

Currently, Rania has 10 years of experience in this business after working in sweets-selling shops and acquiring the requested successful secrets.

Rania has a few agreements with the nearby school, where she provides them with special occasion needs, upon request. She is developing her small business in a well managed way and making sure she can maintain sustainability.

Today, Rania is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to support her beloved husband in paying for their children's school tuition fees.

She will work hard to open a cake production and sales shop in the future. She will enjoy recruiting others and providing them with the best working habits and talents.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Byabasiita Tweyombeke Group

texts.en:
Edith is a grown-up, hardworking widow living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is a member of Byabasiita Tweyombeke Group where members guarantee each other to acquire microloans to support themselves. She grows crops, mainly beans, maize and ground nuts. Apart from farming, Edith also runs some retail shops, which help her earn an additional income and cater to her family. She desires to have a better standard of living but bad weather has challenged her.
She requests a loan to pay laborers to weed her crop gardens.

loans.use: to pay laborers for weeding her crop gardens.

loans.name: Rowegen

texts.en:
Rowegen is a woman who is 22 years old now. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rowegen has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, meat, fish, etc.

Rowegen has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, meat, fish, etc.

loans.name: Grisha

texts.en:
This young and handsome man is 24 years old and he lives with his parents and sister in Chkalovka village in the Gegharkunik region. Grisha has a higher education and he graduated from the Police Academy. Now he works in his profession at the city’s police station.

Grisha’s father is a farmer and he helps his son financially through the income from the sale of farm products. His mother is a housewife and his sister is a student. Grisha works much and does his best to provide his family with good living conditions. Grisha is asking for this loan of 550,000 Armenian drams as he wants to do a slight repairing of their house to make it brighter and cleaner before the New Year’s holidays.

loans.use: to do a slight repair of their house to make it brighter and cleaner before the New Year’s holidays

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be courageous. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, sugar, flour and other items. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Soloarilala Willy

texts.fr:
Willy est une femme travailleuse de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont scolarisés et le dernier pas encore.
Elle exerce avec son mari une activité d'appel téléphonique appelé "taxi-phone" depuis 2000. L'activité se développe petit à petit. Au début, elle commençait avec un point d'appel, et maintenant, le couple gère chacun un taxi-phone. En plus, elle vend aussi des téléphones portables de marque, tablettes. L'objectif et de toujours améliorer, étendre et développer l'activité: renforcer le fonds, proposer le plus d'articles (téléphones, accessoires, etc).
texts.en:
Willy is a hardworking 31-year-old woman.  She is married and the mother of four children, three of whom (except the youngest) go to school.  Since 2000, she and her husband have been involved in a call center activity called "taxi phone".  Their business is gradually developing.  While they started with one call center, Willy and her husband now both have their own "taxi phone".  

In addition to this activity, Willy also sells various brands of cellular phones, digital pads... Her goal is to always improve, expand and grow her activity by boosting her business and diversifying her merchandise (telephones, accessories etc.)

loans.use: to buy chargers, telephones...

loans.name: Orunkul

texts.ru: Орункул, 43 года, вдова. У нее - среднее образование. С 1990 года занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая свою семью доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Орункул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 6 овец. На 3,0 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу, пшеницу и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнес деятельности составляет около 11,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому Орункул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 140,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков, 5 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Орункул развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Orunkul is a 43-year-old widow with a secondary education. She has been involved in agriculture since 1990.  Her earnings allow her to provide for her family.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has two cows and six sheep on her farm.  She also grows corn, wheat, and clover for resale on three hectares of land.  Her activity brings her a monthly income of about 11,000 som (KGS), which is not enough for a decent standard of living.  For this reason, Orunkul has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 140,000 som (KGS) to buy three steers and five sheep, which will increase her livestock headcount.  The earnings from her loan will allow her to develop her business and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy three steers and five sheep, which will lead to an increase in her income.

loans.name: Nambinintsoa Faniry

texts.fr:
Nambinintsoa est couturière, elle confectionne des vêtements dont la plupart sont des sur commandes (pantalons jean, shorts, vestes, robes, jupes), il y a environ 9 ans. C'est son mari qui lui a donné une formation en couture. Celui-ci est couturier salarié dans une entreprise de confection de jean, c'est une entreprise individuelle. Il y a 10 ans d'expérience. Le prêt va lui permettre d'améliorer le matériel, elle va acheter une machine piqueuse industrielle dans le but d'améliorer les produits et d'augmenter la capacité de production.
En plus, le couple envisage de compléter le plutôt possible les matériels nécessaires pour que les deux époux puissent travailler et diriger ensemble l'activité et que monsieur n'aura plus besoin de travailler ailleurs, Qu'ils ont leur propre atelier.
Nambinintsoa a 27 ans et le couple a deux enfants âgés de 3 et 5 ans. L'ainé seulement va à l'école pour le moment.
texts.en:
Nambinintsoa has been a seamstress for about 9 years. Most of the clothes she makes are for customer orders (pants, jeans, shorts, jackets, dresses, skirts). Her husband taught her how to sew. He is a salaried designer in a jeans company. The company is a sole proprietorship. He has 10 years of experience. The loan will allow him to improve his equipment. It will allow her to buy an industrial-grade sewing machine, so that she can improve her products and increase her production capacity.

The couple also plans on getting the equipment they need so that they can work together and run their own company together as soon as possible. Then her husband would no longer need to work elsewhere and they could have their own sewing shop.

Nambinintsoa is 27 and the couple has 2 children between the ages of 3 and 5. The eldest goes to school for the time being.

loans.use: buy an industrial-grade sewing machine (used).

loans.name: Haticha

texts.ru: Хатича, 43 года, замужем, есть 3 сыновей и дочь. У Хатичи среднее образование, она много лет занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. На 0,50 Га она выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу для реализации, также в саду выращивает яблоки и хурму. Совокупный ежемесячный доход Хатичи около 10,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на сбор урожая экологически чистой пшеницы и обработку почвы за счет покупки семян, удобрений. Доходы от кредита Хатича планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Haticha is 43 years old, married and has three sons and one daughter. She has a secondary education. For many years she has worked with agriculture. She has two cows on her farm, and she grows sweet corn and wheat for selling on 0.50 hectares of land. She also grows apples and persimmon in her garden. Haticha's combined monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS).

To further develop her farm, Haticha turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds and fertilizers in order to prepare the soil and grow organic wheat. She plans to use the income from the loan to develop her farm.

loans.use: to harvest organic wheat and to cultivate the soil by purchaising seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son frescos y a precios accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando nuevamente otro crédito para poder comprar mas pescado por mayor ya que le va bien en sus ventas y asi podra tener mas ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan is 39 years old. He lives in his own house with his family. He has sold fish for a long time. His business is located  in his residence and he has a lot of customers, because his products are fresh and have accessible prices. With the profits from his sales he is able to pay for the household expenses. He is asking for a loan again to buy more fish wholesale since his sales are going well and this way he can make more profits for a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy more fish wholesale.

loans.name: Eliazar Bladimir

texts.es:
Eliazar, es un hombre soltero, no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres y una hermana; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y pipianes, este oficio lo aprendió hace ya varios años gracias a un familiar, ahora lo hace de una manera independiente, ya que trabajaba como jornalero, la ventaja es que cuenta con un buen mercado para poder distribuirlo.
Solicita crédito para poderlo invertir en la preparación de la tierra comprara: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, funguicidas y semilla de maíz y pipían, todo esto le permitirá tener los insumos necesarios para el crecimiento de las plantas y de esa manera tener buenos ingresos económicos para él y su familia.
Los sueños de Eliazar es poder tener un vehículo propio para trabajar, crecer con su negocio y culminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Eliazar is a single man, he doesn't have children and lives with his parents and a sister. He works growing corn and cushaw pumpkins. He learned this trade some years ago, thanks to a relative. Now he does it independently, and he works as a day laborer. The advantage is that it has a good market to be able to distribute it.

He asks for the loan to be able to invest it in the preparation of the land, he will purchase: fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, fungicides, and corn and pumpkin seeds. All of this will allow him to have the necessary supplies to grow his plants and in this way to have good income for himself and his family.

Eliazar's dreams are to be able to have his own vehicle to work, to grow with his business and finish his university education.

loans.use: to invest in preparing the land, he will purchase: fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, fungicides and corn and cushaw pumpkin seeds.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es una mujer de 45 años de edad, es madre de familia con un hijo de 20 años, esta bonita familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Natalia trabaja para generar sus ingresos y desde hace 10 años tomo la decisión de elegir una actividad que le permitiera generar ingresos desde la comodidad de su hogar, y la actividad que dignamente eligió fue la compra y venta de pollo, pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y compraventa de ropa típica.
Natalia con el afán de mejorar su negocio de pollos ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más pollos y así poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes. Pues el fin de año se está acercando y con ello la demanda incrementa. Su gran sueño es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y mejorar sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Natalia is a 45-year-old woman, a mother with a 20-year-old son. This lovely family lives in a community in Sololá.

Natalia works to generate her income and 10 years ago, she decided to choose a job that would allow her to generate income from the comfort of her home. The activity she chose with dignity was to buy and sell chickens, but to increase her income she works raising pigs and buying and selling traditional clothing.

Natalia, with the desire of improving her chicken business, has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more chickens and, so, to be able to satisfy her customers' needs better since the end of the year is approaching and, with it, the demand increases. Her great dream is to continue strengthening her business and improving her economic condition.

loans.use: to purchase and sell chickens.

loans.name: Rudy Vladimir

texts.es: Rudy de 33 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 6 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rudy is 33 years old and he lives in his own home with his wife. He has had a small store located in his residence for 6 years. He has a lot of customers because of his good prices and his friendliness when he is selling. With the profits from his sales, he is able to pay for some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc. This way, he can have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, beverages, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Muhammadu

texts.en:
Muhammadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. 

As a Babban Gona member, Muhammadu has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Muhammadu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest time to meet his immediate cash needs, such as buying food and clothing. But with Babban Gona’s support, he can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Muhammadu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and his family members. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Habila would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as buying food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Habila can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest time.

As a Babban Gona member, Habila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Habila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is maize farmer from Shukau village. As a member of Babban Gona, Sunday is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.
 
Before joining Babban Gona, Sunday would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as buying food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Sunday can now store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest time.

Sunday is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Zhulieta

texts.en:
Zhulieta lives with her daughter in Sevan city, Gegharkunik region. She has a specialty of being a senior trader and accountant and she works at a private company as a commodity saleswoman. Zhulieta is in the second group of disabled, but she never stopped working hard in order to provide her single, lovely daughter with all she needed. 

Now Zhulieta has had some health problems, which she is impatient to solve since it limits her activeness and ability to work as much and as properly as she used to. This loan of 700,000 AMD will help Zhulieta to solve her health problem as quickly as possible. 

Zhulieta has now ended her first Kiva loan, which greatly helped her to pay her daughter’s tuition. Now she again needs a Kiva loan and hopes to be supported one more time.

loans.use: to solve her health problems as quickly as possible.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman and has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. 

Salome's business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use this 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vegetables. 

This is Salome's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Grupo Las Hermanas Chuachinup Group

texts.es:
Candelaria es una mujer de 21 años de edad, es casada con una hija de 3 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Candelaria (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, con este negocio lleva ella 5 años de realizarlo, este negocio se ubica en la comodidad de su hogar.
Candelaria para poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes, ha  tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más productos de ropa típica, pues con los años que lleva en el mercado ha logrado ganarse la confianza de los clientes por lo que ahora busca aumentar la clientela con esta inversión. Ella comprara mercadería como: fajas, cortes y güipiles.
Sus aspiraciones en la vida es fortalecer su negocio, y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a 21 year old woman. She is married and has a 3 year old daughter. This humble family lives in the community of Sololá.

In order to obtain income and get her family ahead, Candelaria (the first from the left in the photograph) buys and sells traditional clothing. She has had this business for 5 years, and it it's located in the comfort of her home. In order to meet the needs of her customers, Candelaria has decided to ask for a loan to buy more traditional clothing. Over the years she has been in the market, she has been able to earn the trust of the customers and she seeks to increase her clientele with this investment. She will buy merchandise such as sashes, cortes and güipiles. Her goals in life are to fortify her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing products such as sashes, cortes and güipiles.

loans.name: Buenerge

texts.es:
Buenerge, vive con su compañera de vida y una de sus hijas que tiene 20 años de edad, ellas dependen económicamente de él, su actividad económica es siembra de granos básico (maíz y frijol); oficio que lo aprendió gracias a su familia y el cual ahora ya tiene 45 años de realizarlo.
El crédito lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de abono para fortalecer más el cultivo del maíz, esto le ayudara obtener una mejor cosecha que le permitirán tener una incremento en sus ganancias, pudiendo de esa manera darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus familia.
El mayor sueño de Buanerge es poder obtener buenos ingresos económicos y darle una vida digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Buenerge lives with his life companion and one of his daughters who is 20 years old. They depend on him financially. His business is growing staple grains (corn and beans), a job he learned thanks to his family and which he has been doing for 45 years now.

He needs the loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer to strengthen his corn crop more, which will help him have a better harvest and allow him to increase his profits. That way, he can give his family a better quality of life.

Buenerge's greatest dream is to be able to get good economic income and give his family a life with dignity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to strengthen his corn crop more, which will help him have a better harvest and allow him to increase his profits.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Mahmuda

texts.en:
Mahmuda is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Mahmuda is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Mahmuda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Mahmuda can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Mahmuda has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Mahmuda is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jamilu

texts.en:
Jamilu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Jamilu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Jamilu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Jamilu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Jamilu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Jamilu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 51-year-old married woman. She is a mother of nine children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and health.

She has been successfully running a business, selling with her husband. She is known in her community for selling good-quality milk. Her husband also assists her by selling milk door-to-door.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 37-year-old hardworking woman who has three children.

She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching.

Nazia’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Nazia has requested a loan amount 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has completed repaying her previous loan. She is borrowing another Kiva loan to buy fodder for her cows. This will boost dairy farming.

The profits will enable her to afford quality education and better medical services for her children.

Beatrice appreciates Kiva and its lenders for the support and help and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her cows. This will boost dairy farming.

loans.name: Oscar Cayetano

texts.es:
Oscar, comenta que con el crédito que anteriormente se le dio; su calidad de vida junto a su familia ha mejorado en gran manera, ya que pudo invertir en el cultivo de yuca y gracias a eso obtuvo muy buenas ganancias, y así pudo cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Ahora Oscar opta nuevamente por un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de una vaca y abono para el cultivo de yuca; con ello pretende cultivar dos manzanas de yuca y aumentar su inventario de ganado para generar mayores ingresos, y así darles un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar mentions that with the loan he was given previously, his quality of life, together with his family's, has greatly improved, because he could invest in his cassava crop and thanks to that, he obtained very good profits and was able to meet his obligations.

Now Oscar is opting for a loan again to be able to invest in the purchase of a cow and fertilizer for his cassava crop. With that he intends to plant two manzanas of cassava and increase his livestock inventory to generate more income and increase the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fertilizer for his cassava crop; with that he intends to plant two manzanas of cassava and increase his livestock inventory.

loans.name: Siyemah

texts.en:
Siyemah is a hardworking married entrepreneur with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Apart from her biological children, she also looks after three extra children who live with her because they are her relatives.

She operates a beauty salon as her main source of income alongside crop farming to supplement her income. She started her business with an intention of increasing her assets. She hopes to expand her business to a modern and prominent salon offering manicure and pedicure services, which her customers yearn for, but her capital is not enough to do so.

She request a loan to buy more braids, hair relaxers and conditioners for her salon.

loans.use: to buy more braids, hair relaxers and conditioners for her salon.

loans.name: Patricia Milena

texts.es: Patricia de 36 años es una microempresaria que nació en cuna de comerciantes y participó en estas actividades cuando apenas era una niña, experiencia que le permitió emprender su propio negocio años más tarde cuando se comprometió y formalizó su hogar. Hoy en día cuenta con 16 años de experiencia en la venta de artículos para el hogar, electrodomésticos, prendas de vestir, calzado, perfumería, accesorios, maquillaje e incluso postres que aprendió a elaborar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el tiempo que pasa en compañía de sus tres hijos; sus gemelos  de 6 años y su último hijo de apenas 3 años de edad, velando que cuenten con una educación basada en valores y buenas costumbres.  Como se avecina diciembre, realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar los encargos de sus clientes: ropa, calzado, cosméticos, fragancias, cremas e invertir en materia prima para elaborar sus postres. A futuro proyecta un incremento en sus ventas y que sus hijos accedan a la universidad.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 36-year-old micro-entrepreneur who was born into the home of merchants and participated in this work since she was a small child. This experience allowed her to launch her own business several years later when she became engaged and set up her own home. Today she has 16 years of experience in the sale of home products, small appliances, clothing, footwear, perfumes, accessories, make up, and also desserts that she has learned to prepare.

What Patricia enjoys more than her work is the time she spends with her three children: her 6-year-old twins and her youngest son who is just three. She watches over them closely to make sure they have an upbringing based on values and good habits.

With December approaching, Patricia applied for a Kiva loan, which gives her the opportunity to gain access to financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and to buy the merchandise to fill her customers' orders, such as clothing, footwear, cosmetics, fragrances, and lotions, and also to invest in the ingredients to make her desserts. Her plans for the future are to increase her sales and to see her children accepted at the university.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to fill her customers' orders, such as clothing, footwear, fragrances, lotions, and also to buy the ingredients to make her desserts.

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en:
Zubida is a 47-year-old married woman with seven children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a business selling blankets and bed sheets.

She purchases a good collection from the wholesale market and then sells them in her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of blankets, bed sheets and covers. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Zubida expects a boost in her earnings with the loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of blankets, bed sheets and covers.

loans.name: God's Time Group

texts.en:
God's Time group is found at Aboma in Teshie province. Edmond is a member of this group, and he sells switches, plugs, lamp holders, sockets, pedicure and mini-care.

Edmond is a motivated trader. He is married and has two children. He is the bread winner of the family, and through his income, he is able to supply his family's needs.

His loyalty and hardworking attitude has brought him to his eighth loan cycle. Edmond seeks a loan to buy more electrical goods to supply his customers and also to boost income for his family.

loans.use: to buy more electrical goods to supply his customers.

loans.name: Wadad

texts.en:
Wadad is a 44-year-old married mother of four. She is a Palestinian refugee, who lives and works in a refugee camp seeking a better income business to develop her family's living.

Wadad used to work in selling clothes, but six years ago she decide to switch to a daily living need business, so she decided to work in mouneh production and selling, which she can run from her house and improve her family's living. (Mouneh is a traditional way of preserving foods.)

Wadad has a good idea about mouneh production since her mother was skilled in this production and she taught her and she developed her skills.
She is improving her production skills since she is getting good experience in her domain.

To increase her production and decrease the time needed to finish her work, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy thyme and special pepper chopping machines to develop her business production.

She hopes to stay capable of developing her family's living and increasing their income.

loans.use: to buy thyme and special pepper chopping machines to develop her business production.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 29 years old. She is separated and a mother of two children.

She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc. to sew more dresses on time.

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc. to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en:
Mouna is a 27-year-old single lady who has been working as a tailor from her parents' house since 2013. Her mother gave her the first tips of being a tailor, and she managed to refine her skills.

Mouna is planning to develop her living, and tailoring isn't her only ambition. She started recently selling cleaning detergents.

She is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open a separate selling shop to move her newly established business outside her parents' house and attract new customers.

She is working hard to achieve financial stability and plans to expand and diversify her products.

loans.use: to open a cleaning detergents selling shop to move her newly established business outside her parent's house and attract new customers.

loans.name: Rimal

texts.en:
This is Rimal, a 37-year-old married mother of six, who has been working as a tutor from her house for twelve years to support her beloved husband in covering their family's increasing living needs.
Rimal is well known in her region and trusted by her neighbors and students' parents.

Her acquired income combined with her husband's limited monthly salary are barely enough to cover their family's increasing living needs. Thus an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, will be invested in paying for her children's school tuition fees. She insists on providing her children the best education so that they can benefit from a brighter future.

Since Rimal has a university degree, she is looking forward to opening her special tutoring center in the future, which she will work hard to accomplish.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Maritimo Group

texts.es:
Maria continúa con su negocio de venta de comida(LA SEÑORA DE LA HISTORIA ES LA SEGUNDA DE LA IZQUIERDA CHOMPA NEGRA Y PANTALON ROJO). El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para la compra de muebles y sombrillas para cubrirse del sol. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio funcionó correctamente. Actualmente su negocio funciona todos los días y tiene la necesidad constante de reponer los insumos de cocina como aceite, arroz, fideo, yuca, papa y otros, “necesito comprar insumos de cocina para cocinar a diario…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de insumos de cocina. Su sueño es estabilizar su negocio, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina por mayor para cocinar a diario. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina por mayor para cocinar a diario.
texts.en:
Maria continues to run her business selling food. On the photo she is the second one standing from the left with the red pants. The loan she received she used to buy furniture and parasols to protect herself from the sun. She paid her quotas on time because her business was working well. 

Currently, her business is open every day and she constantly has to restock her kitchen with staples such as oil, rice, noodles, cassava, potatoes and other things. "I have to buy food supplies to cook on a daily basis.." she says. The advantage of her business is that she has sales every day. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy foodstuffs. Her dream is to stabilize her business. She wishes to buy staple foods in bulk to be able to cook on a daily basis. This is the second loan with this organization in the one year that she has been running the business. It is for these reasons that Maria is requesting a loan to buy food staples in bulk in order to cook on a daily basis.

loans.use: to buy food staples in bulk in order to cook on a daily basis.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine and her family started a beekeeping business three years ago. They currently have 40 colonies and get high-quality honey, which Armine and her husband sell locally.

Understanding that now is high time for developing business, Armine decided to ask this loan so she can purchase 30 colonies of bees and develop their beekeeping business further.

She thanks lenders for their support and works hard to see her business developed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for 30 colonies of bees to develop the beekeeping business of her family.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Adamu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Adamu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Adamu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Adamu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nijmeh

texts.en:
Nijmeh is a 47-year-old married mother of four. She opened her saj bread and manakish bakery in 2012 to provide them with a better income.

Nijmeh has 20 years of experience in her domain. She acquired her talents from her mother, who used to work in the same sector.

Since Nijmeh decided to develop her business three years ago through opening the current working place, she has been moving forward in her development plans.

To achieve her goals, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to develop her business by buying a new refrigerator and increasing her business capital for raw materials.

This is Nijmeh's second loan cycle as Al Majmoua borrower. Through her previous loan, she was able to buy necessary items for business development, and she proved to be a good-standing borrower.

loans.use: to develop her business through buying a new refrigerator and increasing her capital for raw materials.

loans.name: Chafika

texts.en:
Chafika is a 61-year-old widowed mother of two who has struggled since 1980, when her husband passed away, to raise and teach her children to make sure that they can have a better living. Chafika is a well known tailor in her region. She is a hard worker who is putting so much effort to expand her working sector and develop her family's living.

Her business income is barely enough to cover her family's daily living needs, thus an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, will help her a lot in paying for her children's university education expenses. Chafika will also use part of the loan to buy a new tailoring machine and necessary threads.

She hopes to stay in good health and continue supporting her children. Chafika admits that being the hardworking father and the caring mother is hard to do but she managed to overcome the hardest issues that anyone might face.

loans.use: to pay for her children's university education expenses, in addition to buying a new tailoring machine and necessary threads.

loans.name: Freedom Group

texts.en:
This group named Freedom is made up of four (4) women, who pursue business with diligence and who have always paid back their loans, according to the terms and conditions applied, on time.

Elizabeth, who is with the blue scarf on her head in the photo, is the representative of the group. She is single and the source of motivation to the group. She has been selling silver sets for 2 years now. She is very engaged and resourceful.

The profits will serve her to help the other unemployed young girls in her area. She seeks the loan to buy more silver sets on a wholesale basis to boost capital for employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more silver sets on a wholesale basis to boost capital for employment opportunities.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Lawal is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Lawal would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Lawal can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Lawal has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Lawal is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo continúa con su negocio de venta de material de construcción. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de llantas y mantenimiento de su vehículo, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque trabajó continuamente. Actualmente su camión funciona correctamente, los arreglos que le hiso sirven para trabajar de manera continua, su negocio le exige la reparación del motor de su griva, que es la máquina con la que lava y separa las piedras de la arena, “trabajamos duro y desde muy temprano y nuestra máquinas no descansan…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio  es que tiene clientes que le hacen pedidos semanales, la desventaja es la falta de un motor para su máquina de lavar piedras. Su sueño es renovar su camión porque ya está muy desgastado, El desea renovar el motor de su máquina lava piedras. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adolfo solicita un préstamo para comprar un motor para la máquina lava piedras.
texts.en:
Adolfo continues to work at his business selling building materials.

He used his last loan to buy tyres and to maintain his vehicle. He paid his loans on time because he continued to work. Now, Adolfo's truck is in good order. The repairs allow Adolfo to continue working.

Adolfo needs to repair the engine in a machine that he uses to separate stones from sand and to wash the stones.

He says, "We work hard and from early in the morning. Our machines never rest".

One strong point of Adolfo's business is that he has customers who have weekly orders. A disadvantage is that he needs an engine for the machine to wash stones.

Adolfo's dream is to make improvements to his truck as it is very well-used.

Adolfo wants to repair the engine of the machine he uses to wash stones. This is Adolfo's third loan with Emprender in the 20 years that he has been doing this work.

For the above reasons, Adolfo is applying for a loan in order to buy an engine for the machine that he uses to wash stones.

loans.use: to buy an engine for the machine he uses to wash stones.

loans.name: Nasiru

texts.en:
Nasiru is a maize farmer from Baure A village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land. This is five and half times higher than that of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Nasiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Nasiru will be able to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price for it at a premium of up to 37% higher than market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Nasiru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare, he hopes to realize better yields. Nasiru plans to use his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Abbubakar

texts.en:
Abbubakar is a maize farmer from Baure A village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land. This is five and half times higher than that of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Abbubakar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Abbubakar will be able to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price for it at a premium of up to 37% higher than market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Abbubakar no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare, he hopes to realize better yields. Abbubakar plans to use his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 52 years old and married with seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2015 to benefit from its trainings, especially in enterprise development. After her Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, Esther was able to start a small grocery store that has enabled her to have a sustainable source of income as compared to the casual jobs that she had been doing to earn a living.

Esther is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to add stock and expand her grocery store. Her loan will help to increase her income and meet customer demand. Esther is grateful to Kiva lenders for their financial support. She promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her store

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Nara lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and two sons, who both attend the village school. They live in Hatsavan village of the Syuniq region. For the past 10 years, Nara and her husband have been farmers. They work hard and have developed a sustainable farm where they raise hens and cultivate emmer wheat, potatoes, and cabbage. Nara and her husband began farming because they needed a permanent source of income.

Nara is requesting a loan to purchase nine colonies of bees, forage for feeding her livestock, and fuel to sustain the farm during the winter. Her loan will help her develop the farm and earn extra income to help provide proper nutrition for her family.

loans.use: to buy bees, forage for feeding livestock, and fuel for the winter

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon Group

texts.es:
Jimena es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 3, 7, 12 y 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de pan y empanadas.
Ella es buena madre, constante y muy independiente. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa 1 de mayo’ caracterizada por ser una de las zonas más pobladas de la ciudad.
Jimena es morena, de cabello negro y físico robusto (sentada la primera de la izquierda, viste polera negra sin mangas). Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por el comercio, su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su deseo por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocio de los socios son; cerrajería, llantería, venta de productos naturales para la salud, confección de sábanas, venta de comida, venta de lácteos y frutería. Su negocio es la venta de pan y empanadas, las empanadas son horneadas hechas con una masa de harina y rellenas con carne de res o pollo además de papa y verduras también se rellenan con queso, llevan ají y son muy populares a media mañana, “todos los días se acaba el pan y las empanadas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias y termina toda su producción, la desventaja es la falta de harina. Su sueño es abrir un snack, ella desea comprar harina por quintal para contar con materia prima de trabajo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza este negocio.
Es por esos motivos que Jimena solicita un préstamo para comprar harina por quintal para hornear pan y empanadas.
texts.en:
Jimena, age 36, lives with her life partner. She has four children, ages 3, 7, 12, and 16. Her business is selling bread and empenadas. She is a good mother, tenacious, and very independent. She conducts her business in the Villa 1 de Mayo area. It is known for being one of the most populated areas in the city.

Jimena has a dark complexion, black hair, and a robust physique. (She is seated and is the first on the left. She is wearing a black, sleeveless top.) Her native tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish for business. She shares her life with her life partner, who works as a builder, and with her children, who go to school. They live in rented quarters made of brick. They have running water, electricity, and indoor plumbing.

Her wish to improve her business took her to lead a communal bank. The businesses of the members are a locksmith, a tire business, selling natural products for good health, making sheets, selling food, selling dairy products, and a fruit business. Her business is selling bread and empanadas. The empanadas are baked, made from a flour dough, and filled with beef or chicken in addition to potatoes and vegetables. They are also filled with cheese. They have chili peppers and are very popular in mid-morning. "Every day all of the bread and empanadas are sold out," she says.

The advantage of her business is that sales are daily, and she sells all of her production. The disadvantage is the lack of flour. Her dream is to open a snack bar.

She wishes to buy flour by the 'quintal' [approximately 100 pounds] in order to have raw material for her work. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the one year she has been engaged in this business. It is for these reasons that Jimena is requesting a loan to buy flour by the quintal to make bread and empadas.

loans.use: to buy flour by the 'quintal' [approximately 100 pounds] to be able to bake bread and empanadas.

loans.name: Bumaria

texts.ru: Бумария успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Бумарии на сегодня есть 5 коров, 15 овец, лошадь. На 1,10 Га земли растет подсолнечник для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бумария вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бумария планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Bumaria successfully paid off her previous loan, having used it as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who supported her financially. She currently has five cows, 15 sheep and a horse on her farm as well as 1.1 hectares of land where she grows sunflowers for sale. Her monthly income is about 19,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her farm, Bumaria has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase cows to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan toward further building up her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows in order to grow her business

loans.name: Gulaiym

texts.ru: Гулайым, 58 лет, замужем, 3 детей, они взрослые и самостоятельные. Образование у Гулайым высшее, уже много лет она занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день в своем хозяйстве она имеет 5 коров, 10 овец, 4 лошади. Она знает технологию ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности и умеет вкладывать средства по назначению. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулайым обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Гулайым намерена свои доходы вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulaiym is 58 and married with three adult and independent children. She has a higher education and has been working in animal husbandry for many years. She currently has five cows, 10 sheep and four horses on her farm. She is knowledgeable about how to run a farming business and how to operate a budget. 

With the goal of further developing her farm, Gulaiym has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase calves. She intends to put her profits back into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy some calves in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una persona mayor de edad y ama de casa, padece problemas dentales propios de su edad y necesita  que se le realice una placa dental para poder recuperar su dentadura. Lamentablemente no cuenta con los recursos suficientes ya que trabaja como intendente en una empresas y su sueldo no le alcanza para solventar los gastos de su casa y el tratamiento.
texts.en:
She is an elderly person and a housewife. She suffers from dental problems that are typical for people her age. She needs to have dentures made in order to be able to restore her teeth.

Unfortunately, she does not have enough resources. She works as an inspector for a company, and her salary is not enough to cover her household expenses and the treatment.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid is 52 years old and is a very diligent and passionate person. Zahid is IDP from Bilasuvar refugee settlement. He is married and lives with his large family and also takes cares of his old parents. He has 2 sons and 2 daughters. At this age he knows that he has great responsibilities in both earning income and raising his children in society. He is a farmer and people in his neighborhood call him as an honest farmer.

Zahid likes to provide more natural products to people. Being a refugee and from the region where people are more familiar with farming, gives him more advantage in the local market.

He grows wheat. In Azerbaijan people consume a lot of wheat such as rural area people bake their own bread and make pastries, cakes at home.

Currently he is planning to buy more fertilizers and for this he needs 1200 AZN. Hopefully Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia y con las ventas que realiza es como puede solventar los gatso de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su padre y su esposo, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando puertas y ventanas, pero no posee suficiente capital por esa razon solicita a INTEGRAL un credito para la compra de las puertas, ventanas y pago de mano de obra para poder tener una casa segura para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is blurred out is 29 and lives in a high-risk zone. She owns a store located in her house and with her sales she is able to pay her home expenses.

She lives in her own house with her father and her husband. She would like to improve her home by changing the doors and windows, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan through Integral to buy doors, windows, and pay for labor so that she can have a secure house for herself and her family.

loans.use: buy doors, windows and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
The town of Badian in Cebu offers different livelihood to its residents. Like Anastacio, a 49-year-old farmer who cultivates the land by growing cassava, corn and vegetables. He is a persevering man, toiling the land and making the most of it. 
Anastacio is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for his farm. With available fertilizer, he can anticipate a better harvest of his crops. His income will be used to buy food for him and his wife.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sakhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sakhorn, a farmer living in an old-wooden house located in Banteay Meanchey province. She is 28-year-old and has two children who are in school. She has been growing rice to support her family’s living for 8 years. To get supplement income, she has been working for others for a fee. Recently, her crop did not grow well while the price of rice crop is going down in market, which caused her to earn a lower income. Sakhorn is able to save only 5USD each day after offsetting expenses. Anyways, she is trying very hard to earn income for keep supporting her children’s studying.

In order to fulfill her family needs, Sakhorn decides to apply for a new loan to buy zinc to renovate her old house. This will be her sixth loan cycle with VisionFund while the other one in her group is the first loan cycle. The previous loans were completely paid back and it helped her to be better support her family’s living and enable her to send her beloved children to school. She hopes that this new loan portion will help her all family members to live in safety place and hygienic environment so that it will reduce the cost of health treatment service.

loans.use: to buy zinc to renovate her old house in order to provide her family's member a safe place and hygienic environment.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 48 years old and a widow with five children. She joined the group in the year 2014 so as to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development training. Before joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she used to be a housewife and used to depend on her husband. Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's training, she was able to start poultry farming as a business.

She is now borrowing a Kiva loan to enable her to buy more chicks, and hence, add stock to her poultry farm. This will increase her income to enable her to pay school fees for her daughter.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more chicks, and hence, add stock to the poultry farm and earn more income to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Yau

texts.en:
Yau is a maize farmer from Rikochi village. As a Babban Gona member, Yau is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Yau can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yau no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Yau hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jenniffer

texts.en: Jennifer is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Nafiu

texts.en:
Nafiu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Nafiu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Nafiu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Nafiu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Nafiu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members, and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mamuda

texts.en:
Mamuda is a maize farmer from Rikochi village. As a Babban Gona member, Mamuda is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mamuda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Mamuda can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Mamuda no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Mamuda hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maryamu Lami

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Maryamu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Maryamu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Maryamu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family, and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a maize farmer from Liman village. As a Babban Gona member, Abdullahi is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.
