loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hussaini has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hussaini would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hussaini can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Hussaini will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Hussaini is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and his family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Peter is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Peter would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Peter can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Peter has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Peter is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Joshua has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Joshua would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Joshua can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Joshua will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Joshua is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Garune

texts.en:
Greetings from Zangakatun village of Vayots Dzor region. This is Garune, nice farmer with 25 years of experience. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two sons who serve in the army.

Garune's farm includes a livestock of cows, calves, hens and 6 colonies of bees. She also takes care of her beautiful and fruitful orchard, where different fruits are grown.

She asks for this loan to handle costs related to her farm and be able to sustain the farm during the winter season. Garune plans to cover cultivation costs, fuel for land cultivation and harvesting and will be very grateful for lenders' trust and support.

loans.use: to pay for cultivation costs, fuel for land cultivation and harvesting

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a maize farmer from Rukku village. As a Babban Gona member, Jonathan is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Jonathan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Jonathan can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Jonathan no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Jonathan hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: M. Nura

texts.en:
M. Nura is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, M. Nura has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, M. Nura would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, M. Nura will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. M. Nura is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Theresa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Theresa would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Theresa can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Theresa will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Theresa is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as being determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use this Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open two other boutiques within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her child. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank and previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a Kiva borrower. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her business is located in a good place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stocks of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cereals.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, sugar, flour, washing soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of rice, sugar ,flour and other items. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar,flour and other items

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is nurse by profession living in Dastakert village of the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and daughter, and besides working as a nurse, she runs a farm. Their farm currently includes four cows, calves, bees and sheep, and they also cultivate wheat, emmer wheat and potatoes.

Anush has requested this loan to be able to pay for the renovation of their agro-machine and to purchase forage for feeding their livestock. This will help her farming business a lot, and Anush hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the agro-machine and to purchase forage for feeding their livestock.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a married woman with 2 children who describes herself as ambitious. She operates a pharmacy to sell medicine. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local people.

She will use 90,000 KES to buy medicine . Her goal is to have a wholesale medicine business within 5 years. She hopes to educate her children to university level. She will use the anticipated profits to take care of her family needs.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery es una mujer de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 6 años y 2 hijas de 1 y 4 años, y su negocio es el tejido de buzos para bebé.
Ella es autosuficiente, delicada y muy luchadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Adela’ caracterizado por conectar a diferentes lugares del área mediante cruces y desvíos de camino.
Mery es morena de cabello negro largo trenzado y vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por el negocio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como maestro constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de adobe que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el tejido de buzos para bebé, estas son prendas que se utilizan como pantalón, son populares porque son fáciles de poner y sacar, se confeccionan de lana y de diferentes colores, “confecciono para vender por mayor en la feria de las mañaneras…” comenta. La feria de las mañaneras es el comercio informal que inicia a tempranas horas de la madrugada al aire libre sobre la calle y termina a las 8 de la mañana para dar paso al comercio formal. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de lana para trabajar continuamente. Su sueño es tener una casa propia, ella desea comprar lana por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Mery solicita un préstamo para comprar lana por mayor para tejer ropa de bebe y vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Mery is 28 years old. She lives with her partner. She has a son, six years old, and two daughters, ages four and one. Mery has a business knitting clothes for babies.

Mery is self-sufficient. She is sensitive but very plucky. Her business is in the "Villa Adela" area, known for linking various areas together through crossroads and roadways.

Mery is dark-skinned and has long, plaited hair. She wears traditional clothing (a hat, blanket and skirt). Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks at home, but she also speaks Spanish at work.

Mery shares her life with her partner, a driver, and her children, who attend school. The family lives in a rented room built with adobe bricks. Their home has running water, electricity and is connected to the sewer system.

Mery has a business knitting clothes for babies; these clothes are usually trousers and an popular because they are easy for dressing babies. The items are made with wool, and in different colours.

Mery says, "I make the clothes to sell in bulk at morning markets." Taking place out in the fresh air, the morning markets is the informal trading that begins in the early hours of the morning and finishes at 8am when formal trade begins.

One strong point of Mery's business is that she sells in bulk. The disadvantage is that she does not have the wool to work continually.

Mery's dream is to own her own house. She also wants to buy wool in bulk. This is Mery's first loan with Emprender in the two years that she has had her business.

For the above reasons, Mery is applying for a loan in order to buy wool in bulk to produce baby clothes to sell in bulk.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk in order to knit baby clothes to sell in bulk.

loans.name: Ummaru

texts.en:
Ummaru is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ummaru is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Ummaru would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ummaru will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Ummaru now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is a hard working farmer living in Zartonq village with his wife and their two little sons. He has chosen agriculture as a main source of his family's income and works day and night as the only breadwinner in the family to sustain their living. He keeps pigs and five piglets, but is mainly specialized in crop cultivation. Last year he built his second greenhouse where he cultivates different types of fruits and vegetables to sell.

The loan he asks for is important for him to purchase polyethylene covers for two greenhouses, and seeds for land cultivation. This will help him to prepare his farm for the coming cold season and develop his business further. Gevorg greatly hopes for lenders' support and faith.

loans.use: to pay for polyethylene covers for two greenhouses, and seeds for land cultivation

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with 3 children. She operates a retail business to sell omena (type of fish). She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local people.

She will use 80,000 KES to buy more fish. Her goal is to have a big business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living conditions.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Yau

texts.en:
Yau is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Yau is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Yau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to pay for his immediate needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Yau can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% greater than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Yau has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Yau is thankful that he no longer has to worry about not having money to pay for his children's school fees, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

Saleh would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Saleh is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.name: Lanto

texts.en:

As a Babban Gona member, Lanto is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

As a Babban Gona member Lanto can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Lanto no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Lanto hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a married man with 5 children. He describes himself as ambitious and operates a retail business to sell sugar, rice, bread, flour, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local people.

He will use 98,000 KES to buy rice, sugar, bread, flour, and other items. His goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes to educate his children to university level. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy  rice, sugar, bread, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Appolonea

texts.en:
Appolonea is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as honest and operates a retail business to sell doors and windows. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a good area and she has regular customers.

She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use 90,000 KES to buy metallic doors and windows. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She will reinvest the anticipated profits in the business.

loans.use: to buy  metallic doors and windows.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as honest and operates a farm to grow maize and beans. She also raises cows. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local people.

She describes her biggest challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use 50,000 KES to buy farm inputs. She hopes to be successful.

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Janeth Amparo

texts.es:
Janeth ha tenido un efecto positivo en la venta de tortillas al haber invertido el crédito anterior materia prima, las circunstancias familiares se mantienen y con la estabilidad económica que actualmente tiene puede cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Para mantener su negocio con actividad solicita un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en maíz, leña, cal y bolsas, de esta manera abastecerá su inventario con los materiales necesarios para la producción de tortillas, espera seguir teniendo clientes satisfechos para que sus ingresos sigan mejorando.
texts.en:
Janeth has seen a positive effect on tortilla sales, having invested the previous loan in basic ingredients. Her family circumstances remain the same and with the economic stability that she currently has, she is able to meet her obligations.

To maintain her business activity, she is requesting a new loan to invest in corn, firewood, lime, and bags; in this manner she will stock her inventory with the materials needed for the production of tortillas. She hopes to continue having satisfied customers so that her revenues continue to improve.

loans.use: invest in corn, firewood, lime, and bags; in this manner she will stock her inventory with the materials needed for the production of tortillas.

loans.name: Gerson Tomás

texts.es:
Gerson es un hombre de 28 años de edad, es soltero con una linda familia de una hija de 2 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Gerson para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como cocinero en una institución privada muy reconocida, el lleva 3 años de trabajar para esta empresa. Gerson es un padre de familia responsable y con grandes aspiraciones en la vida para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, se ha puesto a ver las necesidades prioritarias de su familia y se ha dado cuenta que una de ellas es la construcción  de una cocina para que su familia tenga un lugar adecuado para la preparación de sus alimentos y a raíz de esta necesidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales tales como: cemento, cal y arena.
Con esta inversión espera mejorar sus condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Gerson is a 28-year-old man. He is single, with a beautiful family of a 2-year-old daughter. This humble family lives in a community of Sololá.

In order to obtain income and get his family ahead, Gerson works as a cook in a very well-known private institution. He has been working for this business for 3 years. Gerson is a responsible father of a family, with great life aspirations to give his family a better quality of life. He has made seeing to his family's necessities a priority and has realized that one of those is the construction of a kitchen so that his family may have an adequate space for preparing food. At the root of this necessity, he requests a loan for purchasing materials such as: cement, calcium, and sand.

With this investment, he hopes to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as: cement, lime, and sand.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:

loans.name: Rahieb

texts.en:
Rahieb thanks all the Kiva Lenders for doing such a great job. He has repaid his loan on time and with the profits of last season, he could save for his daughter's education.

Rahieb wants to save more for his and his family's future, and he requested another loan of SRD 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to continue with rice cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Mahinder

texts.en:
Mahinder once again thanks all his Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice production. He has successfully repaid his previous loan and paid for the education of his children.

He couldn't save much because of the low prices of the rice paddy and he lacks finances for the inputs of his rice cultivation. He requires a loan of 7.500 SRDc.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Sunil

texts.en:
Sunil once again thanks all his Kiva lenders for financing his rice farm. He fully repaid his loan, renovated his house, and saved for his family's future.

Sunil needs another loan of 3,000 SRD to buy diesel fuel and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and diesel fuel.

loans.name: Serena Group

texts.en:
Sophia is a married woman in her mid 20s with one young child. She has been a food vendor for three years and works from 6am to 6pm daily. She is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sophia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to purchase food to meet customer requirements. She dreams of expanding her business.

Sophia will share this loan with her 2-member loan group "Serena" who will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase food.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer from Jalawa village. As a Babban Gona member, Iliya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields (up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer).

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 55-year-old, divorced woman. She had two sons, but she lost one in an accident.

Realizing that the Christmas season will be very productive, she needs another loan to buy peanuts, which will be used in many Bolivian dishes that are served during the Christmas season.

She hopes you can help her because she is now living with one of her sons and she has to do all the work alone.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is from the village of Sevqar in the Tavush region. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and two children.

Evelina's raises livestock and grows a variety of fruits and vegetables in the arable land nearby their house.

Evelina asks this loan to purchase an agro machine for harvesting, fuel, and forage. She says that the loan will be very helpful for her business and will enable her to provide extra income for the family's living.

loans.use: to purchase an agro machine for harvesting, fuel, and forage.

loans.name: Dioura Group

texts.fr: Rasmata est une femme âgée de 32 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants. elle exerce son activité depuis de 8 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est qu'elle est ambulante et surtout va là ou on plus besoin de ses produits ; ses produits sont de bon marché et de qualité. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter du savon à 25 000  FCA et revendre. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a reçu le prêt une fois et et à rembourser à la bonne date prévue.
texts.en: Rasmata is a 32-year-old, married woman with three children. She has been working for eight years. Her business is successful as a result of her mobile sales and that she goes where people have the most need for her products. Her products are well-priced and of good quality. She would like this loan to buy 25,000 francs worth of soap to resell. The loan will be used to purchase enough of a supply to strengthen her business. She has received a loan once and paid it back on time.

loans.use: to buy 25,000 francs worth of soap to resell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ibrahim has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as cash to purchase food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it at a future date for a price up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ibrahim is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dubis Esther

texts.es: Dubis de 47 años es una microempresaria residente en un barrio de Barranquilla una ciudad muy alegre y con mucha calidez humana, ubicada en el departamento del Atlántico, cuyos habitantes degustan de una gran variedad de comidas y por las noches cuando salen a pasear por los alrededores, prefieren llegan a la venta de comidas rápidas de Dubis en donde encuentran una carta llena de innovación y sabores realmente sorprendentes.  Esta actividad la aprendió en el seno de su hogar materno y durante 16 años consecutivos ha logrado cautivar a centenares de habitantes de su localidad. Cualquier día de la semana es bueno para llegar a su negocio y ordenar perros calientes en diferentes presentaciones: alemán, suizo, hawaiano, el barranquillerisimo (chorizo con butifarras), entre otros, así mismo las hamburguesas, salchipapas y asados, los ofrece en presentaciones creativas y exclusivas.  Su negocio funciona en su vivienda y no tiene demarcado sus límites es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y realizar adecuaciones para delimitar la parte habitacional de la del negocio, inversión que le permitirá contar con un espacio estipulado para los clientes y mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
Dubis, 47, is a small businesswoman living in a neighborhood of Barranquilla. It is a very cheerful city full of human warmth, located in the department of Atlántico, whose residents enjoy a great variety of foods. At night when they go out for a stroll, they prefer to come to Dubis’ fast food business, where they find a menu full of innovation and truly amazing flavors.

She learned this trade in her mother’s home, and for 16 consecutive years she has succeeded in captivating hundreds of residents in her area. Any day of the week is a good one to show up at her business and order hot dogs in different styles: German, Swiss, Hawaiian, barranquillerísimo [the quintessential Barranquilla dog] (chorizo with a type of Colombian sausage), among others; also hamburgers, French fries with hot dog strips, and grilled meats, which she offers in unique and creative styles.

She operates her business out of her house and she does not have its boundaries demarcated. It is for this reason that she made an application for a loan, a Kiva loan, an opportunity to become involved with a financial institution through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation] and make improvements to separate her living quarters from her business space, an investment that will allow her to have a dedicated space for customers and better housing conditions.

loans.use: make improvements to separate her living quarters from her business space.

loans.name: Leopoldo Sr.

texts.en:
Leopoldo Sr. is a widower with six children. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leopoldo Sr. is 56 years old and has two children who are in school.

Leopoldo Sr. has a knife-making business in the Philippines. Leopoldo Sr. requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials such as metal for his business.

Leopoldo Sr. has been in this business for 36 years. In the future, Leopoldo Sr. would like to save enough money so that he could afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials such as metal for his business.

loans.name: Miqayel

texts.en:
Miqayel is a farmer and the father of three minor children living in Noramarg village of Ararat region. He lives with his parents, wife and children and has been working in a bakery part-time.

Miqayel is the main breadwinner of the family, and his salary alone wasn't enough to cover all costs, so he started a farming business as well. He keeps piglets, calves and hens, and grows haricots, garlic, greens as well as apple and plum trees.

Miqayel requested this loan to purchase a cow, forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation. The extra income from this loan will help Miqayel to cover his family's basic needs and will allow him to provide proper nutrition for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Tasiu

texts.en:
Tasiú is a maize farmer from Jenau village. As a Babban Gona member, Tasiú is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields (up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Tasiú would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as cash to purchase food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Tasiú can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize (a premium of up to 37% relative to the market price at harvest).

Thanks to support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Tasiú no longer feels pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Tasiú hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Yahaya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Yahaya can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Yahaya has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Yahaya is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to feed his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to  eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is maize farmer from the village of Gedage. As a member of Babban Gona, Sani is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Sani can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Sani is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and hopes to use his increased earnings to provide farm employment to members of his community.

loans.use: to  eliminate the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit, her son, and daughter-in-law have been involved in agriculture for many years. They raise cows, calves, piglets, and hens, and grow tomatoes and fruit trees.

Anahit will use the loan to purchase two calves and forage for the livestock to feed in the winter season.

The family's primary income comes from the sale of milk, tomatoes, and fruit in the local markets.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and forage.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 20 years old and he lives alone. He pays rent. Henry is the owner of a minibus and he works every day.

Henry needs a loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle because he had problems with the minibus. He had an accident, but he is fine.

Henry hopes you can help him because he lost his parents a long time ago and he doesn't have any friends who can loan him some money.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replenish her store inventory of snack foods, fruits, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hajara is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Hajara would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs for such necessities as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Hajara will store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Hajara now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 53 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mercedes has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year.

Mercedes requested a loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase materials like fishing net, wood, paints, fish containers, gasoline, etc. for the maintenance of her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like fishing net, wood, paints, fish containers, gasoline, for her fishing business.

loans.name: Alh. Hamza

texts.en:
Alhaji Hamza is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to end the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Alhaji Hamza would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for such items as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, he can instead store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Alhaji Hamza has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

He is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to feed his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Grupo Xoljuyup Sector Campo Group

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de tres hijos de los cuales una estudia y las otras dos son pequeñas aun, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Guineales.
Juana desde hace 6 años se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes, pues se decidió por este negocio, porque en su comunidad no hay ninguna que ofrezca todo tipo de productos de abarrotes.  Juana  gracias a la amabilidad que posee mucha gente la visita constantemente, por esa razón ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de más productos de abarrotes, tales como: golosinas, gaseosas, y consumo diario. Con esta inversión Juana espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones en la vida es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y mejorar las condiciones  vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 29 years old and a mother. She is married and has a lovely family of three children, one of whom is in school while the other two are too young to attend. This humble family lives in a community in Guineales.

For six years, Juana has made a living buying and selling groceries. She decided to open this business because there are no other grocery shops in her community.

Thanks to how friendly she is, many customers are constantly coming in to Juana's shop. She is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy groceries, such as sweets, fizzy drinks, and other staple goods. With this investment, Juana hopes to satisfy customers' demands better.

Juana's aspirations are to continue strengthening her business and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy groceries, such as sweets, fizzy drinks, and other staple goods.

loans.name: Wendin Mete Group

texts.fr: Karidja, est âgée de 50 ans, mariée mère de 5 enfants dont tous scolarisée.Elle exerce son activité depuis 2 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est le travail bien fait, sa propriété dans son lieu d'activité, le goût particulier de ses baignés qui plait à ses clients.Elle veut acheter le petit mil à 22 500 le sac, acheter l'huile à 10 000 f, du sucre à   20 000 f, chargez son gaz à 5 000 f, et le reste 92 500 f comme fonds de roulement. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à la date prévue à ACFIME.
texts.en: Karidja is a 50-year-old, married mother of five children, all of whom are in school. She has been working for two years. Her business is successful as a result of her good work, her business' cleanliness, the flavor of her beignets, which her customers enjoy. She would like to buy pearl millet (at 22,500 francs a bag), to buy oil (at 10,000 francs), sugar (at 20,000 francs), to refill her gas (at 5,000 francs), and to use the remaining 92,500 francs for operating expenses. The loan will be used to purchase enough supplies to strengthen her business. She already received a loan once and repaid ACFIME on time.

loans.use: to buy pearl millet (at 22,500 francs a bag), oil (at 10,000 francs), sugar (at 20,000 francs), to refill her gas (at 5,000 francs), and to use the remaining 92,500 francs for operating expenses.

loans.name: Herodita

texts.es: Herodita es una mujer trabajadora de 45 años de edad que vive con su padre y su hija de 18 años de edad a los que trata de brindarles lo mejor. Ella todas las tardes se dedica a la venta de platos típicos, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Herodita desea construir una galera en su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines, pines y mano de obra para construir una galera en su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Herodita is a hardworking woman, age 45, who lives with her father and her 18 year-old daughter, for whom she tries to provide the very best. Every afternoon she works selling traditional foods, an occupation that allows her to support her family. Herodita wishes to build an outdoor shelter at her home. For this reason she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheeting, poles, pins, and labor to build a chicken coop at her home as soon as possible.

loans.use: invest in galvanized sheeting, poles, pins, and labor to build an outdoor shelter in her home.

loans.name: La Synthese Plus Group

texts.fr: Sylvie, est une femme âgée de 42  ans mariée mère de 4 enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis 20 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son expérience dans l'activité, son dynamisme, ses savon son bonne qualité, elle livre en gros dans les grandes boutiques, ses savon sont à bon prix. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter une barrique d'huile à 120 000 f et 180 000 de matière première pour la fabrication du savon. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à la bonne date prévue.
texts.en: Sylvie is a 42-year-old, married woman with four children. She has had her business for 20 years. Her business is successful as a result of her business experience, her energy, her high quality soap. She delivers in bulk to large stores. Her soap is well-priced. She would like this loan to buy a barrel of oil at 120,000 francs and 180,000 francs of ingredients to make soap. The loan will be used to purchase enough supplies to strengthen her business. She has already received one loan and repaid it on time.

loans.use: to buy a barrel of oil at 120,000 francs and 180,000 francs worth of ingredients to make soap.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Nouvellement inauguré en Octobre 2015 ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables, elles s’activent également dans l’agriculture sous pluie. 

Madame Fatou, (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 01 garçon. Elle s’active dans la vente d’arachide qu’elle achète dans son village pour le revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 10sacs de 50 kg d’arachide pour le revendre en détails dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This banc villageois has been recently launched in October 2015. It is composed of women from the same village who have joined this loan program in order to improve the profitability of their vending businesses. They also grow rain-fed farm crops.

Ms. Fatou (the one standing on the far right raising her hand in the photo) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and has one  son. She sells peanuts, buying in her village and reselling at weekly markets. With her new loan, she plans to buy 10 50-kg [110 lbs] of peanuts to sell retail at the weekly markets [and in the village]. Thanks to her loan, she plans to improve the life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy ten 50-kg bags to sell retail at the weekly market.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 51 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Emma has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 29000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, paints, etc. for her business.

Emma has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, paints, for her handicraft business

loans.name: Ricardo Abrahan

texts.es:
Ricardo, requiere de un nuevo refinanciamiento  para remodelar el equipo de trabajo en la peluquería comprando una silla reclinable para cortar cabello, considera que le será de utilidad para atender mejor a sus clientes y percibir más ingresos.
Para Ricardo el utilizar créditos en su negocio es de beneficio para equiparlo mucho más, de esta manera puede satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y tener su fuente de ingresos funcionando para cuidar de grupo familiar y resarcir sus deudas.
texts.en:
Ricardo needs a new loan to remodel the equipment in his salon, buying a reclinable seat for cutting hair.  He believes it will be useful to provide better service to his customers and receive more income.

Using loans for his business is beneficial for Ricardo in order to really equip his business.  In this way he can meet the needs of his customers and have a source of income to care for his family and pay off his debts.

loans.use: to remodel his equipment in his salon, buying a reclinable seat for cutting hair

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria lives in Oecusse. She is applying for a loan of $1,200 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.She has a shop and many people come to buy there. Maria has been involved in business activities since in 2000. She started with her own working capital of $200.She is earning a good income from selling, so she is still happy to do her business. She sells things like candy, belts, toothpaste, sandals, oil and other things. She is taking this loan because she wants to add more, including soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy sandals, toothpaste, candy, oil, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Greetings from Qarahunj village of the Syuniq region. This is Nver, living with his wife, three minor children and 15 years of farming experience.

The farm currently includes big livestock of 30 animals including cows, calves, sheep, hens, pig and piglets.

Nver works day and night to sustain his family's living. His wife helps him in the farm with cultivation of haricot, potato, and some fruit trees (walnut, apple and pear).

Nver requests this loan to purchase a cow, a sow and forage for feeding the livestock in the winter season.

He hopes to receive lenders' support and in the future, would like to see his business grow and be profitable so his family can have appropriate living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, a sow and forage for feeding the livestock in the winter season.

loans.name: Chep's Group

texts.en: Chep’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chep makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Aliyu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Aliyu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Aliyu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Aliyu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having had no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Calisto

texts.en: Calisto is a 37-year-old married father of five children who works hard to support his family. He is a staff cleaner and his wife is a housewife. Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to support the cost of their son’s education. This loan of $600 USD will allow Calisto to help his son to study in university, because his son is far from them. Calisto will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies for his son. Calisto loves his son very much and hopes that further education will help them all to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies for his son.

loans.name: Yae Kyaw (Yae) Village Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are CBO members from the Yae Kyaw (Yae) Village Group, named Daw Tin, U Kyaw, U Aung and U Thu. Yae Kyaw’s previous loan helped the village group boost its income by selling more ducks that could fetch a higher price due to the high quality feed they used. This increased income has allowed village members to increase their investment in secondary businesses such as planting betel leaf. In addition to this business reinvestment, additional income was used to fund their children’s matriculation fees.

A new loan will help the village continue to scale their duck business by purchasing more ducklings and using high quality feed. All village members are excited to continue their relationship with the Kiva lending community.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings as well as high quality feed.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.en:
Gisela is 42 years old. She is working as a driver, and she is an artisan. Gisela hired a driver, but he quit the job, so she is driving the vehicle. Lately, Gisela has been helping her mother at her business (she makes candy for Bolivian rituals for good luck).

She needs a loan to pay for the painting of her vehicle. Gisela is driving more hours than before; she is not tired, but she is still going to her secretary classes.

loans.use: to pay for the painting of her vehicle.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, es casada y tiene dos hijos que son menores de edad, por lo que dependen económicamente de ella, el esposo de Reina se dedica a la agricultura; por su parte ella se dedica a la venta de productos de revista, ya tiene 5 años de tener este negocio, ella manifiesta que comenzó este negocio al ver la situación económica por la que estaba pasando.
Reina solicita un crédito invertirá en la compra de artículos de belleza, ya que a finales de año las empresas de las cuales, ella distribuye los artículos de revista pone ofertas de combos de productos a muy bajo precio, esto le ayudaría a ella a poder percibir mayores ingresos y de esa manera mejorar la atención que da a sus clientes.
Reina sueña con poder incrementar sus ventas para poder continuar siendo un apoyo para su esposo y sus hijas, y de esa manera tener lo necesario para el buen desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
Reina is married and has two children, both under the age of 18; the children depend on their parents. Reina's husband is a farmer while Reina herself makes a living selling beauty products. She has had the business for five years, having started it as a result of her previous financial situation.

Reina is applying for a loan in order to buy beauty products. She will buy these goods at the end of the year when businesses sell products as packages for very low prices. This will help Reina to earn a higher income and to provide her customers with better service.

Reina dreams of increasing her income in order to continue supporting her husband and daughters. Reina can thus have the necessities for her family to develop well.

loans.use: to buy beauty products as sets of products will on offer at very low prices at the end of the year.

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Nouvellement inauguré en Octobre 2015 ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables, elles s’activent également dans l’agriculture sous pluie. 

Madame Amy, (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires en détails.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 01 sac de 50 kg de sucre, 01 sac de 50kg de riz, du thé et d’autres condiments qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour le revendre en détails chez elle ou elle dispose d’une cantine.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et aider son mari dans la gestion de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Newly inaugurated in October 2015, this 'banc villageois' is made up of a group of women from the village who adhered to the program in order to make their small businesses more successful. They also work in agriculture during the rainy season.

Amy (standing at the far right with her hand raised), is the star borrower of the group. She is married and has three children. She sells groceries at retail.

With her new loan, she intends to purchase one 50 kilogram bag of sugar, one 50 kilogram bag of rice, tea, and other condiments that she buys at the weekly market. She resells the groceries at retail from her home where she has a cafeteria.

With the profits, she intends to improve her family's living conditions and to help her husband manage her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy one 50 kilogram bag of sugar, one 50 kilogram bag of rice, tea, and other condiments.

loans.name: Reina Lydia

texts.es:
Reina, es acompañada, actualmente ella vive con sus tres hijos y su compañero de vida, su grupo familiar está compuesto por 5 personas, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa; esta actividad la desarrolla hace ya 8 años en los alrededores del mercado municipal de su localidad, Reina dice que ella aprendió este negocio gracias a su madre, su horario de trabajo es de las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m., ella cuenta con una gran ventaja y es que por el tiempo que ya tiene de dedicarse al negocio es muy reconocida en la zona y tiene una buena clientela.
Ella solicita un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ya que se acerca la temporada navideña donde ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
El sueño de Reina es poder tener un negocio más grande para poder gozar de solvencia económica que le permita darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Reina is in a relationship. She currently lives with her three children and her life companion so her family unit is made up of five people. She works selling clothing and she has been in this business for eight years, outside the municipal market of her community. Reina says that she learned the business thanks to her mother. Her timetable is from 8 am until 5 pm. She has one big advantage and that is the length of time she has worked in the business. She is very well known in the area and has a good clientele.

She is requesting a loan to be able to invest in the purchase of a variety of clothing for women, men and children as the Christmas season is approaching when she can make her best sales so she can meet her obligations.

Reina's dream is to have a larger business to enjoy economic stability which would allow her to provide a better quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for women, men and children as the Christmas season is approaching when she can make her best sales.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Aminu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Aminu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Aminu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Aminu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about not having money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Victoria has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Victoria would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Victoria can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Victoria will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Victoria is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family, and looks forward to using her additional earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Duyên's Group

texts.en:
Duyên is 23 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for five years and pigs for 6 months.

Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Duyên faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

This is Duyên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of Duyên's group, which consists of four members.

With her business profit, Duyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

location.town: Phú hòa, hưng lộc, Hậu Lộc

loans.name: José De Jesús

texts.es: José es un joven con muchas aspiraciones de crecimiento personal y microempresarial, a sus 19 años de edad es un comerciante de prendas de vestir, calzado y productos de cuidado personal con tres años de experiencia en el medio, actividad que inició en conjunto con su novia contando con muy buenos resultados.  Aunque sus principales limitaciones han sido el acceso a entidades crediticias y no contar con un empleo en el sector privado, José ha ideado sus propias estrategias de promoción de sus productos, permitiéndole cumplir con su meta de ventas y garantizándole un ingreso seguro.  A través de familiares, amigos y vecinos ha logrado expandir su base de clientes por los referidos que le suministran sus conocidos sumándole los pedidos que le generan sus clientes fieles.  La temporada decembrina es propicia para realizar compras de nuevas colecciones de mercancías es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y realizar compras de vestuario y calzado propicio para estas festividades que propondrá a sus clientes. A futuro proyecta un incremento en sus ventas y su meta personal es lograr formalizar un hogar con su prometida.
texts.en:
José is a young man with many aspirations for growth, both personal and as a micro-entrepreneur. At 19 years old, he sells clothing, shoes and personal care products and has been doing so for three years. He started this business with his girlfriend and they have had good results.

Although their main obstacles have been access to credit and not having work in the private sector, Jose has developed his own ideas for promoting his products, and he has been able to meet his sales goals, ensuring a reliable income. Through family, friends, and neighbors he has been able to expand his customer base thanks to the referrals they make, adding to his orders from his loyal customers.

December is a good time to purchase new merchandise, and that is why he has applied for a Kiva loan which will give him access to credit through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy clothing and shoes appropriate for the upcoming holidays which he will offer to his customers.

In the future he hopes to increase his sales and his personal goal is to establish a household with his fiancee.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Freedom 2Group

texts.en:
Abigail is 28 years old and she is married. She has been selling fish on a retail bases for eight years now. Abigail lives in Teshie district, an urban town in Accra province. Her family is a low-income household in the locality; moreover the market need is low in this area. The income from this business is not high enough for her to cover the life costs and save money.

The main hardship that Abigail faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to improve sales and increase her income by purchasing more fish to sell. Abigail joined ID-Ghana to improve her business. She has successfully repaid five loans from ID-Ghana. She is the group leader of "Freedom 2", which consists of five (5) members. In the future, Abigail hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to improve sales and increase her income by purchasing more fish to sell.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en:
Haifa is a creative 40-year-old Lebanese woman who always had a passion for candles and candle making. In 2010, she decided to turn her passion into a full-time profession by making candles and selling her production to shops and interested customers. Haifa is from the Chouf mountains and lives there with her husband and their son and daughter. While her husband works as an electrician and her children both go to school, she works on her production in a small shop right next to her house. The demand for Haifa’s products has been increasing a lot since she first started which has allowed her to support her husband in providing for the family. 

Haifa is requesting 1,543,658 LBP loan from the Kiva partner Ibdaa to buy the raw materials needed for continue candle production. This will be her first loan. Succeeding in creating new models of candles will allow Haifa to earn more income and continue to earn a living from her hobby and passion.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make candles

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a maize farmer from Sabon Garin Kuzuntu village. As a Babban Gona member, Daniel is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Daniel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Daniel can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Daniel no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Daniel hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Créer en Octobre 2015 à l’occasion de son inauguration, ce banc villageois compte en son sein des femmes déterminées à entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenu et de renforcer leur capacité de financement. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Awa, âgée de 30 ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère 04 enfants. Elle est s’active dans la vente de beignets et l’agriculture.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 10 kg de farine, 20 kg de sucre et d’autres condiments pour la préparation de ses beignets, 02 sacs de 50 kg d’arachide pour le revendre en détails dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte faire de l’embouche aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et la prise en charge des enfants. 
PC 2
texts.en:
Inaugurated in October 2015, this 'banc villageois' includes women determined to undertake income-generating activities to strengthen their financial capacity. They work in small businesses.

Awa, 30-years-old (standing at the far right with her hand raised), is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of four children. She works selling beignets and in farming.

With her new loan, she intends to buy 10 kilograms of flour, 20 kilograms of sugar, and other ingredients to make her beignets, two 50 kilogram bags of peanuts to resell in retail in weekly markets.

With the profits, she intends to raise cattle, to help her husband with management of the daily expenses, and to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 kilograms of flour, 20 kilograms of sugar, and other ingredients to make her beignets, two 50 kilogram bags of peanuts.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Two years ago Rita opened her clothing store in Kapan town of Syunik region. She trades with male and female clothing of all seasons and has a good client base due to high quality services.

She requested this loan to purchase a new stock of clothing, to prepare the store for the coming high demand season in December holidays. The loan will be very helpful for Rita's clothing service and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing, to prepare the store for the coming high demand season in December holidays.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot es una mujer trabajadora de 68 años de edad que se dedica a la elaboración de platos típicos, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años, lo cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Ella vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas ya mayores de edad que le apoyan con los gastos económicos. El servicio sanitario de Margot como se observa en la fotografía no cuenta con un cuarto adecuado además el drenaje está deteriorado, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y tuberías para reparar el drenaje y construir el cuarto del servicio sanitario.
texts.en:
Margot is a hard-working woman, 68 years old, who is dedicated to preparing and selling typical dishes, an activity she has performed for some eight years. This has permitted Margot to advance her family. She lives with her life's companion and their two daughters, already adults, who help them with household expenses.

Margot's "bathroom," as you can see in the photo, lacks an adequate room and the drainage system is deteriorated. That's why she needs a loan through FUSAI to purchase: cement, sand, gravel, blocks, and pipes in order to repair the drains and construct a decent bathroom.

loans.use: to buy the cement, sand, gravel, blocks, and pipes needed to repair the drains and construct a bathroom.

loans.name: Jamilu

texts.en:
Jamilu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Jamilu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Jamilu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Jamilu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Jamilu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Jamilu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hpa Yar Chaung Village Group

texts.en:
Hpa Yar Chaung’s previous loan was used by village members to purchase new ducklings and high-quality feed.

The team will use funds to expand their duck business. Kiva's loan helped all Hpa Yar Chaung village members to cover all monthly expenses without taking on high-interest rate loans from local moneylenders. The increased income was used to support their children’s matriculation fees.

When interviewing featured borrower Nyunt, she talked about the importance of higher education for her family. As her children continue to get high grades in the classroom, she is excited that she may be able to use her funds to give her children the chance to acquire a university education.

This relisted loan will help Hpa Yar Chaung’s group members expand their livestock business. They aim to then use boosted incomes to invest in secondary businesses, such as planting banana trees, which can be sold at a good price at the local market.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high-quality feed.

loans.name: Sahia

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Sahia, who is a 70-year-old widow with one son. Sahia is an employee. She has asked for a loan of 7,200,000 IDR from KPP-UMKM Syariah.

This loan will be used to build sanitation at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Sahia will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family.

loans.name: Grupo Yoxaja 1 Group

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 24 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de una hija de 3 años, ellos viven en una comunidad del caserío Yoxaja.

Manuela (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la producción de café, con esta actividad lleva ella 4 años de realizarlo, pues afortunadamente ella vive en una zona muy fértil.
Manuela por ser la producción de café su mayor fuente de ingreso le preocupa que ahora no cuente con suficiente dinero para pagar la mano de obra y comprar fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café  por esa razón unido con un grupo de personas solicita un préstamo para el mantenimiento de su cultivo. Ella espera obtener una buena cosecha para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 24 year old woman. She is single and has a beautiful family with a three year old daughter. They live in the community of Yoxaja.


Manuela (the first on the left in the photo) in her eagerness to get income and get her family ahead works growing coffee. She has been in this business for four years as fortunately she lives in a very fertile area.

Manuela having her coffee production as her main source of income is worried that she doesn't have enough money to pay for labor and buy fertilizer to maintain her coffee crops. For this reason she joined a group of people to request a loan for the maintenance of her crops. She hopes to have a good harvest to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ya Mouhamed's Group

texts.fr:
Créer en Octobre 2015 à l’occasion de son inauguration, ce banc villageois compte en son sein des femmes déterminées à entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenu et de renforcer leur capacité de financement. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce.
 
Madame Ya Mouhamed, âgée de 38 ans (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère 04 enfants. Elle est s’active dans la vente de légumes.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 01 sac d’oignons de 50 kg, 01 sac de 30 kg de pomme de terre qu’elle achète auprès de producteurs  pour le revendre en détails dans son village.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte participer à la prise en charge scolaire et sanitaire des enfants.
texts.en:
Created in October 2015, the date of its inauguration, this banc villageois includes women who are determined to carry out revenue-generating activities and strengthen their means of financing. They all earn a living through small-scale retail businesses.

38-year-old Ya Mouhamed (the woman standing to the far-right of the photo with her hand raised) is this group's star borrower. She is a married mother to four children. She earns a living through selling vegetables.

With this new loan, she plans to purchase one 50-kg sack of onions and one 30-kg sack of potatoes, which she will purchase from farmers then resell in her village. She plans on using the profits to see to her children's school and medical fees.

loans.use: to purchase one 50-kg sack of onions and one 30-kg sack of potatoes, which they will purchase from farmers then resell in their village.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora es una mujer de 45 años de edad, divorciada, tiene un hijo de 16 años y una hija de 19 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es emprendedora, fuerte y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max paredes’ caracterizada por concentrar la mayor parte de la producción manufacturera como, confeccionadores, carpinterías, muebles de aluminio, comercio informal y demás actividades.
Flora es de tez morena, usa el cabello largo y trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. su negocio es la venta de comida, en una pensión, este tipo de negocio se caracteriza por ofertar en el menú 3 comidas diarias, las cuales son, chuleta con papas fritas, asado con arroz y pollo con arroz y papas fritas, “inicie mi negocio con ayuda de mis hijos que me ayudan en su tiempo libre…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con muchos clientes porque no tiene competencia en el sector, la desventaja es la distancia entre su domicilio y su negocio. Su sueño es ampliar el espacio de su negocio porque en ocasiones es muy lleno, ella desea comprar mesas y sillas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Flora solicita un préstamo para comprar mesas y sillas para vender comida.
texts.en:
Flora is 45 years old and divorced. She has a 19-year-old daughter and a 16-year-old son. She has a business selling meals.
