Flora is enterprising, strong and very hard-working. Her business is in the Max Paredes area, known for the concentration of manufacturing businesses there. Business in Max Paredes include dressmakers, carpenters, those producing aluminium furniture, informal trade, and other businesses.

Flora has dark skin and has long, plaited hair. She wears traditional clothing (a hat, blanket and skirt). Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks at home, but she also speaks Spanish at work. Flora shares her life with her children, who attend school. The family lives in a house that they own. It is built with bricks and cement, and has a calamine roof. The house has running water and electricity; it is connected to the sewer system.

Flora has a business selling meals at a rented property. She sells three dishes every day: pork with chips, steak with rice, and chicken with rice and potatoes.

She says, "I started my business with the help of my children who help me in their spare time."

One strong point of Flora's business is that she has many customers as she does not have any competition in the local area. The disadvantage is the distance between her home and her business.

Flora's dream is to expand her business because her restaurant is often full. Flora also wants to buy tables and chairs. This is Flora's first loan with Emprender in the five years that she has had this business.

For the above reasons, Flora is applying for a loan in order to buy chairs and tables to sell meals.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables to sell meals.

loans.name: Husna's Group

texts.en:
Husna, who is in her early 30s, is single with one child who is still small. She has been selling clothes for four years now. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Husna's ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of clothes. She has managed to pay back all of her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for supporting their group. She used the profit to take care of her family, to repay the loan, and to reinvest in her business. She also bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy in-style clothes to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of selling bed sheets.

Husna will share this loan with her loan group, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to  buy in-style clothes to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Namalgdo Group

texts.fr: Adissa, est une femme âgée de 42 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisé. elle exerce son activité depuis plus de 10 ans. ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son accueil, le respect et l'écoute du client, elle est seule à faire l'activité dans la zone où elle habits.Elle veut acheter des condiments à 50 000 f, acheter de l'huile à 50 000 f et le reste 50 000 f pour le fond de roulement. l'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. elle a déjà reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Adissa is a 42-year-old woman and the mother of four children, all in school. She has been operating her business for over ten years. What drives her business is her accommodations and the respect and attention for her customer. She is by herself in this business, located in the area where she lives.

Adissa wants to purchase condiments worth 50,000 francs and some oil worth 50,000 francs; the 50,00 remaining is for her working capital. The loan use is to stock up on enough supplies in order to bolster her business. She has already received a loan twice and has paid them back as planned.

loans.use: to purchase some condiments and oil for her food service.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

As a member of Babban Gona, Emmanuel can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Emmanuel has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land.

Emmanuel is thankful that he no longer has to worry about not having money to pay for his children's school fees, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Grupo Panquiney Las Hermanas Group

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer amable,  responsable y sincera, tiene 27 años de edad es casada con una familia de dos hijas que aún no estudian, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Guineales.

Manuela (la primera del lado derecho en la fotografía)  para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica  a la elaboración de güipiles típicos de su región, con esta actividad lleva ella 5 años de realizarlo, le gusta esta actividad pues lo realiza desde la comodidad de su hogar.
Manuela con el afán de mejorar su producto ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y estilos para seguir elaborando hermosos trajes típicos pero también busca llamar la atención de los clientes.
Su esperanza de vida es fortalecer su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuela is a very kind, responsable and sincere woman. She is 27 years old, is married and has a family with two daughters who don´t go to school yet. This family is living in a community of Guineales.
To obtain her income and bring forward her family, Manuela (in the foto, the first one from the right) is producing güipiles (traditional guatemalan dress) who are typical of her region. She has been doing this work for 5 years now. She likes this work, because she can do it in the comfort of her own home.
With the desire to improve her product Manuela decided to request a loan in order to buy yarn in different colours and styles to further produce beautiful traditional dresses. But she also wants to draw the attention of customers.
The hope of her life is to strenghten her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy yarn in different colours and styles for the production of typical clothing

loans.name: Elsa Bellalinda

texts.es: Elsa es una mujer de 27 años de edad, está profundamente agradecido por su préstamo pues con el apoyo de ello su remodelación dio en marcha porque sus materiales logro comprar, a Dios gracias su familia ahora vive mejor, ella está muy contenta con este avance mas no conforme, pues una parte de su casa ahora necesita ampliarlo por esa razón acude a otro crédito para la compra de materiales como cemento, cal y arena. Ella tiene las esperanzas de contar nuevamente con este crédito para poder darle a su familia mejorar estabilidad. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 27-year-old woman who is profoundly grateful for her previous loan, because with this help, she was able to begin remodeling her home, purchasing the necessary construction materials.

Thanks to God, her family now lives better. Elsa is very content about these prior advances but a portion of her house now needs expanding. For this reason, she is seeking another loan to purchase materials such as cement, lime and sand.

Elsa hopes that she can count on another loan once to be able to offer her family improved stability.

Her dream is, one day, to have her own business.

loans.use: buy construction materials such as cement, lime and sand to expand a part of her house.

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr: Drissa est le client qui tient en mains la corde du mouton,un malien embaucheur d'ovins.Client dévouer pour son travail il honorant tout ses engagements avec l'institution, âgé de 32 ans analphabète, marié et père d’un (01) enfant âgé de 03 ans. Sa femme fait le petit commerce d’arachide et du savon.Ses rêves et ses espoirs sont de renouveler sa maison et  construire un bâtiment dans l’une des villes du Mali pour ses enfants. Il a fait recours au RMCR pour l’avancement durable de son embouche et fait de grandes choses pour ses enfants dans l’avenir. Il utilisera cette somme pour l’achat de deux béliers et le reste pour le stockage de céréales. Il fait ses achats et ventes dans les différents marchés de sa zone. Son bénéfice mensuel est estimé à 15 000F CFA. Ce qui lui plait dans l’embouche est l’intérêt qu’il réalise et de la fumure organique pour ses champs.
texts.en:
Drissa, the client, is the man holding on to the sheep in the photo. He is a livestock farmer from Mali who is dedicated to his work and who has kept all his promises to the institution. He is 32 years old, illiterate, and a married father to a three-year-old child. His wife earns money through selling peanuts and soap. His dreams is to be able to renovate his home and to build a town house for his children.

He turned to RMCR in order to grow his livestock business so he can provide for his children in the future. He will use this sum to purchase two rams, with the remaining money going towards cereals to feed the animals. He purchases and sells his livestock in various local markets. His estimated monthly profits are around 15,000 FCFA. He enjoys the revenue that livestock farming affords him and he likes being able to work in the open air.

loans.use: to raise six sheep over a period of six month, after which they will be resold.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando works as a driver of a bus. The vehicle is old but it is the only way that Fernando makes money  Fernando is married with two children who are going to college. Fernando needs a loan to buy tires for his vehicle. He hopes you can help him because he is the only support for his family

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha es una apasionada por la belleza y la estética, ella se capacitó en este arte, actividad en la que se ha desempeñado durante 5 años consecutivos, ofreciendo paquetes para adelgazar, tonificar, relajantes y energizantes.   Sus servicios los realiza a domicilio y en su residencia en los horarios acordados con sus clientes; ella no tiene horario laborar, puesto que se acomoda a los requerimientos de ellos para beneficio mutuo. Martha entrega lo mejor de sí en su labor por el agrado que ella siente hacia su trabajo, además de ser su único sustento y el de sus tres hijos, al ser madre cabeza de familia, un desafío que ha tenido que afrontar con mucha fortaleza y  compromiso. Para poder realizar un efectivo manejo corporal, requiere de una serie de productos estéticos que comprará con los recursos que le serán entregados a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, por intermedio de un  credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera y poder adquirir los productos adecuados para sus servicios: cremas reductoras, geles calientes y fríos entre otros. Su meta a futuro es adecuar una habitación de su vivienda con herramientas y maquinas especializadas en tratamientos de belleza.
texts.en:
Martha is passionate for beauty and esthetics. She has trained in this art, a business she has carried out for five consecutive years offering packages for reducing weight, toning. relaxing and energizing. She does her work in people's homes or at her residence at times agreeable to her clients. She has no set timetable as she accommodates her clients needs to their mutual benefit.

Martha gives the best of herself in her work as she is grateful for her work. Besides being the only source of sustenance for herself and her three children, for her as a single mother and the head of the family it is a challenge that she had to face with great strength and commitment.

In order to preform an effective body treatment she needs a series of beauty products that she will buy with the resources that will be given to her by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in the form of a loan from Kiva. It is an opportunity for her to access the financial world and be able to acquire the appropriate products for her services; reducing cream, hot and cold gels amongst others.

Her goal in the future is to adapt a room in her house with equipment and specialized machines for beauty treatments.

loans.use: to acquire appropriate products for her services: reducing cream and hot and cold gels amongst others.

loans.name: Marie Thérèse

texts.fr:
A 49 ans, Marie Thérèse est  célibataire. Elle vit avec l’enfant de sa sœur qui vient de réussir son baccalauréat et qui l’aide dans l'exercice de ses activités .
L’activité de Marie Thérèse est l’élevage porcin depuis 3 années, plus précisément l’engraissement porcin. Après quelques mois d’engraissement, les porcs seront vendus. Elle a déjà bénéficié  d’un premier prêt pour l’engraissement d’un porcelet , les bénéfices obtenus ont permis de couvrir les dépenses pour les soins médicaux de sa mère , mais malheureusement sa mère a été décédée, des dépenses ont été également engagées dans la préparation des funérailles. D’où cette demande de second prêt pour augmenter l’effectif du cheptel porcin. Le suivi technique de l’élevage est assuré par un vétérinaire. Les porcs engraissés sont vendus  à un client  (membre de la famille).  
Elle a également comme source de revenus une activité de confection de drap. Elle habite dans une maison héritée de ses parents. Son projet est de développer l’élevage et de diversifier ses sources de revenus. Elle dispose assez de temps pour s’occuper d’autres activités car l’élevage ne prend pas beaucoup de temps.
texts.en:
Marie Thérèse is a 49-year-old single woman. She lives with the child of her sister who has just finished her baccalauréat exams and who helps her out with her business.

For three years Marie Thérèse has been involved in raising pigs - more specifically, in fattening the pigs. After a few months of fattening, the pigs will be sold. She already received a first loan used for fattening a piglet. The profits gained covered the costs of her mother’s health care but unfortunately her mother died and some of the profits were also used for funeral arrangements. Due to this, she is requesting a second loan to increase the size of her pig herd. Technical farming support is provided by a vet. The fattened pigs are sold to a client (a member of the family). 

She also earns money from making bed sheets. She lives in a house that she inherited from her parents. Her plan is to develop the farm and to diversify her sources of income. She has enough time to carry out other activities as the farming does not take up a lot of time.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and some bran.

loans.name: Leona Isabel

texts.es:
Leona es una mujer de 39 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia con la que vive en una comunidad de la aldea camanche grande.
Leona para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se sacrifica mucho todos los días para generar algo de ganancia, el negocio que ella escogió es la compra y venta de ropa típica de su región lleva 6 años de realizarlo. Con el acercamiento de la época navideña y del fin de año, Leona busca surtir mejor su negocio para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes pues esta es la época con la que incrementa la demanda de la ropa por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como: fajas, cortes y güipiles.
Con esta inversión espera fortalecer mejor su negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Leona is a 39-year-old woman. She is married and has a pretty family with which she is living in a community in the village camanche grande.
To obtain her income and bring ahead her family Leona sacrifies herself a lot every day to generate some earnings. The business she has chosen is the buying and selling of clothing typical of her region, which she has been doing for 6 years now.
With the christmas season and the end of the year coming closer, Leona tries to stock up her business more to better meet the customer´s needs. Since this is the season when the demand of clothing increases, she is requesting a loan to buy products like: fajas (wrap-around skirts), cortes (belts) and güipiles (traditional blouses). With this investment, she hopes to further strenghten her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy typical clothing products such as: fajas (wrap-around skirts), cortes (belts) and güipiles (traditional blouses).

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 59 years old, divorced and takes care of her children. Eva invested her money by purchasing a vehicle and hiring a driver. Eva needs a loan to buy spare parts for her vehicle

Eva is still making candy for Bolivian and Andean rituals used to bring good luck. In Bolivia many people believe in those things so Eva has a lot of work. She makes the candy from 5 a.m. Now she is being assisted by her daughter. She also distributes the candy to many small towns.

Eva is happy to have more than one income and she hopes you can help her again

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her vehicle.

loans.name: Furaha Majohe Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her mid 30s, is single with two childrens who are still at school. For 10 years now she has been a tailor and enjoys her work. She works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will Joyce's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy materials and fabrics to make quality suits and dresses. She dreams of expanding her business to reach her targeted customers.

She will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials and fabrics to make quality suits and dresses.

loans.name: Kujenga Amani Group

texts.fr: Grâce à l'expérience puisée auprès de familiers, Valériane a démarré son affaire de vente de tissus en 1995. Cette activité lui plait car elle participe à la survie familiale; le seul obstacle est l'insuffisance de moyens financiers mais elle est confiante que son capital accroitra grâce aux crédits PAIDEK et cela aura une répercussion positive sur l'amélioration de ses conditions familiales. De gauche à droite, Valériane est en deuxième position habillée en blouse jaune.
texts.en: With the help of experience gained from her close friends and family, Valériane started her fabric-selling business in 1995. She enjoys this activity because it provides for her family. The only obstacle she faces is the lack of financing. But she is confident that her capital with grow thanks to loans from PAIDEK. This will have a positive effect on her family's living conditions. Valériane is the woman sitting to the right of the photo wearing the yellow blouse.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics in order to increase their stock.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La prestataria creció en la sierra sur del Perú. Desde muy joven vino a la capital a trabajar, donde se casó y tuvo hijos. Actualmente, su esposo tiene problemas de salud mental, estuvo hospitalizado y recibió apoyo de Socios En Salud (SES) para el manejo de su enfermedad. Él no pudo trabajar debido a su condición durante unos años, por lo que la prestataria se puso a trabajar en un mercado de ropa, mientras que SES apoyaba a la familia con víveres. Al principio era ayudante en la venta de ropa pero aprendió rápidamente y abrió su propio negocio de lencería con capital prestado y luego, con apoyo de SES. Ahora le gustaría ampliar su negocio, por lo que necesita un mayor capital para comprar mercadería surtida y venderla en su local y por docena en un mercado más grande. 
El esposo de la prestataria está trabajando como ayudante en un taller automotriz y contribuye a los ingresos del hogar, donde también viven dos hijos, un adolescente viviendo con una enfermedad crónica y un pequeño de 8 años.
texts.en:
The borrower grew up in the southern highlands of Peru. When she was very young she came to the capital to work. She got married and had children. Her husband currently has mental health problems. He was hospitalized, and he received support from the Socios En Salud (SES) in order to manage his illness. He was not able to work for some years due to his condition. Therefore, the borrower went to work at a clothes market while SES supported the family with food.

In the beginning, she was a helper selling clothes, but she learned rapidly. She opened her own underwear business with capital that was lent to her and later with support from SES.

Now she would like to expand her business. In order to do so she needs more capital to buy a stock of merchandise. She will sell it at her place and by the dozen at a bigger market.

The borrower's husband is working as a helper at an automotive shop and contributes to the household income. Two children also live at the house, one adolescent who is living with a chronic illness and a little eight year old.

loans.use: to buy supplies for selling underwear.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Habila is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Habila would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Habila will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Habila now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is a construction worker living in Sisan town with his retired parents. He asks for this loan to purchase tools needed for construction work such as a rotary hammer and drill. This will help him to cover current orders and will make his work more effective.

Suren hopes for lenders' support and faith in his business.

loans.use: to pay for tools needed for construction work, such as a(rotary hammer and drill..

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is 59 years old and single. He doesn't have children. He pays rent and drives a micro-bus. It is the only way Pedro makes money, and he works from Sunday to Monday. He starts his job at 6am and drives until midnight.

Pedro would like to have his own house in the future. He needs a loan to buy an engine for his micro-bus. Because he has many expenses for his health, he cannot buy a new vehicle.

He is desperate and hopes that you can help. He doesn't know where to go, is alone, and doesn't have close relatives.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 71 años de edad,  es casada, tiene 5 hijos que ya son mayores y trabajan, vive con su esposo en una aldea del Municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Doña María Josefa , cuenta con una fuente de ingreso que es un negocio de pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como,  harina, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, medicinas, golosinas, productos de abarrotería, y refrescos desde hace 12 años. Ella esta solicitando su quinto préstamo a ODEF por 25,000 lempiras para comprar mas productos para mantener surtido el negocio como ser huevos, azucar, manteca, arroz, frijoles, harina, embutidos, lácteos, productos de limpieza, churros, pan y refrescos Para cumplir con la demanda de los clientes.
Su objetivo es incrementar las ventas para obtener mas ingresos, mejorar su casa, ampliar su negocio y  lograr tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en: Doña María is 71 years old, married with 5 children who are working adults. She lives with her husband in a village in the municipality of Choloma, in the department of Cortes.  For the last 12 years Doña María Josefa has relied her on business running a general store as a source of income. She sells foodstuffs like flour, beans, rice, sugar, butter, medicines, sweets,  groceries, and soft drinks. She has applied for her fifth loan from ODEF for 25,000 Honduran Lempiras. She will buy stock for her shop including eggs, sugar, butter, rice, beans, flour, cold cuts, milk, cleaning products, churros (doughnut fritters formed into sticks), bread and soft drinks. This will allow her to meet the demand from her customers. Her goal is to increase sales and generate more income, improve her home, expand her business and be able to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to stock up with products such as eggs, sugar, butter, rice, beans, flour, sausages, milk, cleaning products, churros (donut fritters formed into sticks) , bread and soft drinks.

loans.name: Halliru

texts.en:
Halliru is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a solution to end the cycle of poverty and has renewed his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Halliru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as money to purchase food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Halliru can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for a price that is up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Halliru has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Halliru is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having insufficient money to feed his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 52 years old, and he pays rent. He is divorced, and he drives a car to earn money. Ricardo is working many hours at night because he knows he can make more money.

Ricardo needs a loan to buy tires and to fix his vehicle. The problem is that his car is old, and he doesn't have money to buy a new one. Although Ricardo is divorced, he collaborates with his ex-wife to support his daughter.

He hopes you can help him again.

loans.use: to buy tires and to fix his vehicle.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a happily married woman and the owner of a minibus. Flora needs a loan to repaint her minibus and to make some repairs.  Flora doesn't drive but she hired a driver. Flora lives with her family. Flora's husband is unemployed right now and that is why she needs your help

loans.use: to repaint her minibus and to make some repairs

loans.name: Ado

texts.en:
Ado is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ado has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ado would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as cash to purchase food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ado can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for a price that is up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ado will benefit from marketing support that could help him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ado is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Saratu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Saratu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Saratu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Saratu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer from Makwalla village. As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields (up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer).

Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as cash to purchase food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize (a premium of up to 37% relative to the market price at harvest).

Thanks to support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Kabiru no longer feels pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Kabiru hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín a sus 62 años de edad vive con su esposa en vivienda propia desde hace 38 años, por lo que son muy reconocidos por sus vecinos por su carisma y carácter trabajador. Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa de la capital, lo cual le permite obtener los ingresos necesarios para que no falte nada en su hogar. Efraín desea mejorar el área del lavadero, ya que en época de invierno, no se puede llegar hasta el lavadero, por lo que él solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, lámina, polines y pines para mejorar el área del lavadero, en el piso y techo.
texts.en: Efraín is 62 years old and has lived with his wife in their own home for 38 years. They are very well-known among their neighbors for their charisma and hard-working character. He works providing security services in a company in the capital city. This allows him to obtain the necessary income so that nothing is lacking in their household. Efraín wants to improve his outdoor laundry area, since in the winter season it is not possible to get there from the house. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, metal sheets, boards and beams to improve the roof and floor of the laundry area.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, metal sheets, boards and beams to improve his laundry area floor and roof.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 48-year-old mother and owner of a grocery store in North Lebanon. Her husband has been a construction painter for more than 25 years and their son recently started learning the job from his father to help his parents cover the family expenses.

Nadia saw an opportunity in opening her own grocery store in January 2014 as a way to increase her household's income. The store is located next to her house, in the neighborhood where she grew up. She has known her clients for many years and is very friendly with them, which helped give her a good reputation in the area.

Nadia is asking for a 1,234,327 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She is planning on using the loan to buy food products and sell them in her store. In fact, with the winter season approaching, she is expecting an increase in the demand for certain products. Her main priority for the moment is to satisfy her clients, increase her income and help her son start his own future.

loans.use: buy food products for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos y hortalizas desde hace 2 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene es como logra salir adelante, el joven vive en casa propia con su madre, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la foptografia y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: The young man whose face is pixelated is 26 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He has worked in the cultivation of basic grains and vegetables for 2 years. He sells his products in the various markets that are near his home. It is with the earnings obtained that he is as able to get ahead. The young man lives at home with his mother. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc. and to improve the soil shown in the photo, and in this way be able to continue with his work which generates good profits for him.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc. and to improve the soil.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is a maize farmer from Jidde Suddu village. As a Babban Gona member, Yusif is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yusif would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Yusif can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yusif no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Yusif hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rose is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Rose would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Rose will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Rose now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a maize farmer from Baure village. As a Babban Gona member, Suleiman is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Suleiman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Suleiman can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Suleiman no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Suleiman hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Not By Might Group

texts.en: Juliana is a 40-year-old woman. She is a native of Mempeasem in the Assin Central District of the Central Region of Ghana. Juliana (middle in the group picture) is married with two children with their ages ranging between 7 and 10 years old. Juliana is the leader and group representative of Not by Might. She sells bananas, yam, cassava, and plantain as her source of income. Juliana also sells pieces of clothes to supplement her income. Juliana’s husband is a cocoa farmer who has been responsible and very supportive. Inadequate capital and the high cost of rent affects her business. Juliana's dreams are to open up a supermarket in the heart of the town and to educate her children up to university. Juliana will use the current loan to buy more yam, bananas, plantain and cassava for resale to her numerous customers. The demand for these fast moving goods is quite high. Juliana and her other group member's thank all their Kiva micro lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy bananas, yam, plantain and cassava for resale.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Yahaya now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members, and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Count Your Blessings Group

texts.en: Ajara is a 45-year-old woman who hails from Efutu in the Cape Coast Municipal of the Central Region of Ghana. She is married with five children whose ages range from 15 to 26 years old. All of her children are attending school. She lives with her family and husband. Ajara is a trader who sells bags of maize, rice, beans, yam etc.  She also owns a provision shop, which serves as her other source of income. Ajara has been doing this business for the past 13 years and this is how she assists her husband to cater to their children’s education and other expenses.   As a serious business-minded person, she decided to include Elsa stove distribution in her business after she witnessed its demonstration and climate change education by the field officers in her community. Ajara has already surveyed the market for the stove that uses palm kernel shells (virgin pellets), which is a commonly known waste material within her surrounding communities. There is a high demand for the Elsa stoves since the fuel cost is zero. Additionally, it improves indoor air quality and the health of the users. Ajara and her group member need a micro loan to buy more stoves to meet the demands of clients through their market assessment. Funding their loan will also mean reducing deforestation and put an end to the cutting down of trees for firewood and charcoal by the communities of the stove users. Ajara thanks all her Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy Elsa stoves for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 31 years old. She is married with two children. She has had a sandal selling business for some time now.

Janet will be using the loan to buy more bulk sandals to sell to her customers, to make more income to educate her children. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children and provide food for her family.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her sandal selling business, make more income and be able to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy more bulk of sandals to sell to her customers so as to make more income to educate her children.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: Jorge works as a driver and he needs a loan to buy tires for his vehicle. Jorge is married and he has two kids who are very young and are going to school. His wife attends the house.  Jorge has to work many hours but he will do anything for his family.  He hopes you can help him because he is the only support for his family

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Marielse

texts.es: Marielse es una microempresaria que heredó el negocio familiar de venta de productos alimenticios, recipientes plásticos y video juegos, actividad que fue administrada por sus tíos, primos y por último su madre quien se la entregó por problemas de salud. Ella ha realizado una excelente labor y lleva 10 años en esta actividad, demostrando un crecimiento progresivo del negocio y un entusiasmo por continuar con mucho compromiso y dedicación, pues todos los días debe estar en una actitud de servicio para mantener los clientes actuales y captar nuevos. Marielse es soltera y tiene 27 años de edad, y su meta es terminar de construir su vivienda, una mujer muy organizada y con una buena proyección microempresarial que se preocupa por cada aspecto de su negocio, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y poder comprar al por mayor pollo, queso, huevo y recipientes plásticos, para que sus clientes encuentren todo lo que necesitan en un solo lugar. A futuro desea ampliar su oferta de productos y tener muchas mas ventas.
texts.en:
Marielse is a small businesswoman who inherited the family business selling food products, plastic containers, and video games, a trade that was managed by her uncles, cousins, and finally, her mother, who turned it over to her because of health problems. She has done an excellent job and has spent 10 years in this occupation, showing a progressive growth in the business and an enthusiasm to continue with great commitment and dedication, since every day she must have an attitude of service in order to retain existing customers and attract new ones.

Marielse is single and is 27 years old, and her goal is to finish building her home. A very organized woman and with a good entrepreneurial outlook, she tends to every aspect of her business. It is for this reason that she made an application for a loan, a Kiva loan, an opportunity to become involved with a financial institution through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation] and be able to buy chicken, cheese, eggs, and plastic containers wholesale, so that her customers might find everything they need in one place. In the future she wishes to expand her product offerings and have many more sales.

loans.use: buy chicken, cheese, eggs, and plastic containers wholesale.

loans.name: Sereolipi Group

texts.en:
Dhadho owns a barbershop, salon, and phone charging business in Sereolipi, Kenya. Sereolipi is a small village in Samburu County in Northern Kenya. Traditionally, the village is pastoralist, but recently it has been developing to have more retail shops and businesses. It is 65 kilometers from the national electricity grid, meaning it is unlikely to be connected anytime soon. Dhadho currently has a solar home system and a diesel generator to operate his business. The solar does not provide enough energy and the diesel generator produces toxic fumes and noise that are unhealthy and unpleasant for Dhadho and his customers. Furthermore, his generator is unreliable and breaks often, forcing him to close his business and lose revenue.

A new solar micro-grid has just been installed in Sereolipi. The micro-grid will replace the kerosene lanterns and diesel generators that residents currently use to meet their energy needs. It will offer constant, reliable, and clean energy. With his connection to electricity, Dhadho plans to expand his business by offering more salon services and a cyber café. Dhadho has five children, all currently in school. With his additional income and savings on energy expenditure, he will have more money for school fees for his children.

In additional to Dhadho, 25 other home and business owners will connect to the solar micro-grid. The micro-grid will allow them to keep their businesses open later with improved lighting and increase their standard of living with electrical appliances like refrigerators. Dhadho believes the solar micro-grid will really help the economic development of the town by encouraging residents to come up with new businesses.

loans.use: to connect his barbershop, salon, and phone charging business to the solar micro-grid in Sereolipi.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ahmadu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Ahmadu can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ahmadu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Ahmadu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
The 28-year-old lady by the name Peace is married and a mother of two children. Peace sells clothes, trousers (jeans), skirts and nickles at the market place where she attends to her regular buyers.

Peace uses her income with the support of her husband to take care of the family and the payment of school fees. Her heart's desire is to improve their standard of living by investing more into her children's schooling. Her loyalty and faithfulness in the repayment of her loans has brought her this far. Peace seeks a loan to purchase more stocks to resell on gradual wholesale basis.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to resell on gradual wholesale basis.

texts.fr: Mamounata, est une femme âgée de 36 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants. Elle exerce son activité depuis 5 an. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son dynamisme, elle vend des habits de bonne qualité à bon prix, elle est ambulante ce qui fait qu'elle arrive à écouler facilement sa marchandise. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter des habits de bébé à 10 000 F. et acheter  des habits d'adultes à 15 000 F. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité pour renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à la date prévue à ACFIME.
texts.en: Mamounata is a 36-year-old woman and the married mother of three. She has had her business for five years. What drives her business is her energy. She sells good-quality clothing at good prices. She goes door to door, so she manage to sell her merchandise easily. She wants a loan to purchase baby clothing worth 10,000 francs and some adult clothing worth 15,000 francs. The purpose of the loan is to stock up with enough goods to bolster her business. She has already had a loan before and paid it back to ACFIME by the due date.

loans.use: to purchase baby clothing worth 10,000 francs and adult clothing worth 15,000 francs.

loans.name: Delmy

texts.es:
La señora Delmy  tiene 70 años de edad, es de nacionalidad salvadoreña, jefa de hogar y madre de un hijo mayor de edad con quién vive. Hace más de 35 años reside en Costa Rica, para esa época ella y sus hermanos se vieron obligados a dejar su país por la guerra civil que atravesaba el Salvador. 
Ella es una señora muy activa, su edad no es impedimento para seguir trabajando, generar ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de su hogar, además de considerar su actividad productiva como una terapia mental. Disfruta mucho cocinar y se considera con mucha habilidad.  Su experiencia en panaderías y sodas le permiten poner a disposición de su clientela todo tipo de reposterías y comidas, todas por encargos que prepara desde su casa para ser retirados por los clientes. Su menú es muy variado elabora todo tipo de repostería, pastelería, bocadillos dulce y salados, así como comidas en general, variedad de arroces, pasteles como de pollo, palmito, yuca, vegetales y otros
Sus clientes son vecinos de la comunidad, que la conocen muy bien y la refieren a nuevos compradores, así como empresas, instituciones, universidades y colegios  de la misma comunidad, también grupos de mujeres organizadas y clientes en general que tengan una celebración o evento. Todos de la misma comunidad a la que pertenece, Santo Domingo de Heredia y otras comunidades de la misma provincia. Trabaja por encargos con fecha y hora de entrega y son sus clientes quienes retiran los productos. Las ventas se mantiene estable durante todo el año, sin embargo el pico más alto de venta son de noviembre a febrero. Doña Delmy asegura que existen muchas otras personas que brindan el servicio de elaboración de repostería, sin embargo la calidad de sus productos, su receta, ya que muchos de complementos de la repostería como las cremas, rellenos, jaleas, dulces  y otros los prepara ella misma, asegurando la calidad y buen sabor. Otra de sus fortalezas es la accesibilidad en los precios de sus comidas, aunado al buen sabor que garantiza la solicitante. 
En lo que con respecta a los desechos de su actividad y los domésticos, realiza una separación adecuada, todos son clasificados en reciclables y no reciclables, para ser entregados a los recolectores de basura de la comunidad quiénes pasan tres veces a la semana.
texts.en:
Mrs. Delmy is 70 years old. She is salvadorian, head of the household and mother of a an adult son, who is living with her. For more than 35 years she has been living in Costa Rica. At the time she and her brothers were constrained to leave their country because of the civil war that afflicted El Salvador.
She is a very busy lady. Her age is no hindrance to continue working. She generates income to contribute to her household expenses.
Besides she considers her productive work as a mental therapy. She enjoys cooking a lot and considers herself as very able. Her experience in bakeries and sodas (stand with typical food) allow her to make all kinds of pastries and meals available to her clients, all on demand, which she prepares at her home to be then picked up by the costumers.
Her menu is very diverse. She produces every kind of pastries, confectionary, sweet and salty sandwiches, as well as general meals, a variety of rice dishes, stuffed pastries for example with chicken, palmetto, yuca, vegetables and others.
Her clients are neighbors from the community, who know her well and recommend her to other customers, as well as enterprises, institutes, universities and colleges of the same community, even organized groups of women or clients in general who are having a celebration or event. They´re all from her community Santo Domingo de Heredia and from other communities af the same province.
She is working on commissions with date and time of delivery and it´s her clients who are picking up the products.
She maintains the sales stable throughout the year, nontheless the highest peak of sale is from november till february. Mrs. Delmy affirms that there exist many other people who offer the service of producing pastries. Nonetheless she assures the quality of her products, her recipies, since she produces many of the supplements, like creams, fillings, jelly, sweets and others, herself, thus ensuring the quality and good flavour.
The accessible prices of her meals joined with the good flavour are another of her strenghts, guarantees the petitioner.
As to the waste from her business and from her household, she makes a proper separation. They´re all divided into recyclables and non-recyclables, to be handed over to the community´s garbage collectors, who are passing three times a week.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for the production of pastries and meals

loans.name: Tomasa De Jesus

texts.es: Tomasa 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica desde hace 20 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Tomasa is 46, she lives in her own home with her daughter. For twenty years she has worked making and selling tortillas. She runs her business out of her home, and has many customers. With her earnings she is able to cover some of her household expenses. She is seeking a loan to purchase corn in bulk and lime so she can continue making tortillas, increase her earnings and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime.
