texts.es: Doña Juana de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres nietos y su tio, ella posee una molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 14 años, posee muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas ya que ahí llegan a moler el maíz, adicional a eso también vende productos de uso personal por catalogo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, ella solicita un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana is 64 years old and lives in a house of her own with her three grandchildren and an uncle. She has operated a nixtamal [corn] mill in her residence for 14 years.

She has many customers, especially the women who make tortillas, because they come to her to grind the corn. In addition, she also sells personal care products by catalog. With the proceeds from her sales, she is able to cover some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy items she needs for her mill, such as drive belts, disks, knives, etc. This will allow her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy necessities for her mill, such as drive belts, disks, knives, etc.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer from Dantani village. As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Yahaya can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yahaya no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Yahaya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Yahaya now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hussaini has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hussaini would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Hussaini can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Hussaini will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Hussaini is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mallam Jinaidu

texts.en:
Mallam Jinaidu is a maize farmer from Liman village. As a Babban Gona member, Mallam Jinaidu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than that of the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mallam Jinaidu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Mallam Jinaidu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Mallam Jinaidu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Mallam Jinaidu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.fr:
Alphonsine est une femme très courageuse, combattive et travailleuse. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés mais son problème est le traitement de son ainé qui a une maladie depuis sa naissance (16 ans). Son mari est chauffeur salarié dans une entreprise privée. Quant à Alphonsine, elle tient un petit commerce de fruits, des volailles et un taxi-phone depuis 2009. Le couple exerce ensemble une activité de petit élevage à part tout ça. Avant 2009, elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche.
Pour pouvoir améliorer son revenu, elle voudrait développer et étendre de plus en plus ses activités, d'où la raison de sa demande de crédit. En plus, le traitement de son enfant est encore long.
texts.en:
Alphonsine is a very courageous woman who is determined and hard-working. She is the married mother of three, all in school. But her problem is the medical treatment for her oldest (aged 16), who has a congenital condition. Alphonsine’s husband is a salaried driver in a private company. She herself has a small-scale business involving fruit, poultry, and a public phone services, since 2009. On the side, the couple jointly have a business raising livestock. Before 2009, she used to work at a private company in the free one.

To be able to improve her income, she would like to develop and expand her business more and more, thus the reason for her loan application. In addition, medical care for her child is still long-term.

loans.use: to purchase fruit: mangoes, pineapples, papayas, bananas, strawberries, etc.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 15 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 44, she lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. For fifteen years she has run a small store out of their house, selling a variety of products such as candies, soft drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar, etc. and she has many customers because of her low prices. She is applying for a loan to purchase more merchandise at wholesale, since this is her sole source of income and in this way she can increase her earnings and have a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase candies, soft drinks, staple grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatins, sugar, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago is 45 years old. He has been a mason for over 20 years, and he needs a loan to buy a cement mixer. This is a great opportunity for him, so he hopes you can help him.

Santiago works hard, and he is the father of five kids. He would like to give them a better life. Santiago is an independent man, and he is happily married.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is an industrious woman from a humble background. She is married with five children, all of whom are in school.

With her hardworking attitude of supporting her husband in taking care of the children, Patience sells gents' trousers, panties, brassieres, and other ladies' underwear in a very busy market area of Teshie. She has been in this business for 16 years now.

Patience seeks a loan of 1,800 GHS to buy more clothing in bulk to sell to her regular customers since demand is high. She will use her income to support her children's schooling. This is her fourth loan and she promises to repay with regards to the terms and conditions applied as usual.

loans.use: To buy more clothing in bulk to sell to her regular customers since demand is high.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a single woman. She describes herself as industrious. She operates a retail business selling firewood. She has been involved in this business for ten years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the ID Ghana loan to buy more stock of firewood to increase her supply for her customers.

Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a better businesswoman. This is her sixth loan with ID Ghana. All her previous loans were repaid successfully.

She will use the anticipated profits to take care of her younger sisters who are in school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to increase her supply for customers.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de 4 hijos de las edades entre 15 y 20 años de edad, esta familia vive en una comunidad de san Antonio.
Teresa para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia es vendedora de chocolate con esta actividad lleva ella 4 años de realizarlo.
Teresa con el afán de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia a decidió solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales para remodelación de su vivienda pues ya se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y ella espera darle a su familia un hogar más digno. Su mayor sueño es terminar la remodelación de su casa y mejorar sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 43-year-old mother of a family. She is married and has a pretty family with 4 children aged 15 to 20. This family lives in a community of San Antonio.

To obtain income and bring her family forward, Teresa works as a chocolate seller. She is doing this work for 4 years now.
With the desire to improve the quality of life of her family she decided to request a loan to buy materials for the renovation of her dwelling, since it is already in a very bad state and she hopes to give her family a more dignified home. Her biggest dream is to finish the renovation of her house and improve her economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials for the renovation of her house.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a happy married woman she is an artisan, and her husband makes hats. Josefina needs a loan to buy a machine that will help her to increase her craft production.

As you can see in the picture, Josefina is a talented woman. She doesn't have children because she can't, but that is no problem for her to be a happy woman. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a machine that will help her to increase her craft production

loans.name: Paraguay Group

texts.es:
Shirley es una mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy emprendedora. Su negocio lo realiza ambulando en inmediaciones del estadio, donde se juegan partidos de futbol nacionales y algunos internacionales.
Shirley es morena de cabello negro largo y físico robusto (la primera de la izquierda, viste polera sin magas verde clarito), su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Las ganas de mejorar su negocio la llevaron a formar una banca de  personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, pensión familiar, venta de cosméticos, taller de carpintería, venta de fruta, panadería y taller de costura. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida como hamburguesas, sándwich de huevo, sándwich de pollo y otros, “con este pequeño emprendimiento mejoraré mi negocio y mi situación económica…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que existe demanda de comida rápida, la desventaja es la falta de un carrito hamburguesero. Su sueño es tener un lugar fijo para vender comida y dejar de ambular, ella desea comprar un carrito hamburguesero, mesas y sillas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Shirley solicita un préstamo para comprar un carrito hamburguesero, mesas y sillas para vender comida rápida.
texts.en:
Shirley, 25, is single, she has two children, ages four and six. Her business is selling fast food.

She is a good mother, independent and very enterprising. She conducts her business going around to different locations around the stadium where national and international soccer games are played.

Shirley has dark skin, with long black hair and a sturdy frame (she is the first one on the left in the photo, in a light green tank top). Her native language is Guarani, and she speaks Spanish. She lives with her children who attend school. They live in their family home which has running water, electricity and heat. Her desire to improve her business compelled her to join a communal bank with others running businesses such as: selling second-hand clothing, running a bed and breakfast, selling cosmetics, a carpenter shop, selling fruit, a bakery and a tailoring business. Her business is selling fast food such as hamburgers, egg sandwiches, chicken sandwiches and more. "With this small investment I will improve my business and my financial situation," she comments. The advantage of her business is the high demand for fast food, the challenge is she does not have a mobile stand. Her dream is to have a fixed location to sell her food and stop moving around to different places. She wants to buy a stand, tables and chairs. This is the first loan with the institution in her first year of running this business. For these reasons Shirley is seeking a loan to buy a mobile hamburger stand, tables and chairs for selling fast food.

loans.use: to buy a hamburger stand, tables, and chairs to sell fast food.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is a button seller. He lives with his son. Jesus is 52 years old, and he would like a loan to buy more clothing accessories.

Jesus would like to have a big store in the future because he is tired of going to many places. He would like to work with his wife also; she takes care of the house but she is unemployed.

In the picture, Jesus is at the place where he buys the buttons.

loans.use: to buy more clothing accesories

loans.name: Moises

texts.en:
Moises lives in a little apartment, for which he pays rent. He is a driver, and he works in El Alto. Moises drives his own taxi. He is a divorced man but he takes care of his daughter.

He needs a loan to pay for the repair of his car. Moises would like to buy a new car in the future, but right now he must do whatever he can to maintain his vehicle.

Moises works hard, he is healthy, and he hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of his car.

loans.name: Nancy Sebastiana

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 6 meses y de 2 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de regalos.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy emprendedora, su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por albergar la mayor parte de la población y por concentrar la mayor parte de la producción manufacturera en todas las áreas. 
Nancy es morena de ojos pardos y baja estatura, su vida la comparte con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en casa propiedad de su madre que está construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de regalos como, osos de peluche, muñecas, ropas de bebé, porta retratos, adornos y otros, “vendo casi de todo porque los regalos son para cualquier ocasión…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que está bien surtido, la desventaja es que la mercadería sufre daños al estar al aire libre. Su sueño es mejorar su ventas para darle un futuro mejor a sus bebes, ella desea comprar vitrinas para exponer regalos y protegerlos del aire libre. El reto que enfrenta su negocio es conservar en buen estado los regalos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nancy solicita un préstamo para comprar vitrinas para exponer regalos.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 19-year-old woman, single, with two children ages 6 months and two years. She sells gift items.
She is a good mother, independent and very enterprising. She works in the south zone of the city, where the majority of the city's population lives and where the majority of the manufacturing takes place.
Nancy is short, dark-skinned, and has brown eyes. She shares her life with her children. They are not yet school-aged. She lives in her mother's home, made of bricks and cement with a corrugated iron roof. The home has running water, electricity, and heat.
Nancy sells gift items such as teddy bears, dolls, baby clothing, decorations, and other items. "I sell just about everything because the gifts are for any occasion", she says. Her business' advantage is that it is well-stocked. A disadvantage is that her merchandise gets damaged from being exposed. She dreams of improving her sales in order to give her babies a better future. She wants to buy display cases to show off the gifts and to protect them.
Her challenge in her business is keeping the merchandise in good shape. This is her first loan sequence with this institution in the four years she has been doing this business.
For these reasons, Nancy is requesting a loan to purchase display cases to display giftware.

loans.use: to buy display cases to display gifts.

loans.name: Gulipa

texts.ru: Гулипа, 28 лет, замужем, есть 4 летний сын. У нее среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как об оптимистичной и трудолюбивой женщине. Гулипа в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2013 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. Дополнительно у Гулипы есть земельный надел мерою 0,50 ГА, где она выращивает кукурузу. Благодаря упорному труду Гулипы, ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на оплату услуг по сбору экологически чистой кукурузы. Доходы от кредита Гулипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса и увеличение площади орошаемых земель.
texts.en:
Gulipa is 28 years old, married and has a four years old son. She has secondary education. She gets very good references from her neighbors. They talk of her as an optimistic and hardworking woman.

As a main income for her family, Gulipa has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 2013. She has two cows on her farm. In addition, she has a plot of land of 0.50 hectares, where she grows sweet corn. Thanks to Gulipa's persistent work, her business brings in around 15,000 som (KGS) per month, which is vital for covering the family's food and household expenses.

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulipa turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) to pay for help to harvest her ecological corn. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving her business an increasing the area of irrigated land.

loans.use: to pay for help to gather her harvest of ecological corn

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad has a passion for music and has been working in the industry since he graduated from school nearly ten years ago. He is now 29 and lives in a camp for Palestinian refugees in North Lebanon. He has been married for four years, but his wife is unemployed. This always pushes him to work hard in order to provide for the family.

In 2011, he opened a shop inside the camp, in which he sells CDs and audio equipment. He also organizes parties and events upon request, which ensures him diverse sources of income. The demand for party hosting and events has been increasing lately, which convinced Ahmad to start investing in some new equipment.

He is asking for a 4,112,376 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He needs that amount to buy a good-quality sound system that he will use for the events he organizes.

Ahmad is very successful at what he does and is well-known in the camp for his nice taste in music that he adapts depending on the client. He is a responsible young man who works hard to always improve his business. He is hoping that with his loan, he will succeed in attracting new clients.

loans.use: to buy a sound system for the events he organizes.

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
Abdulaziz is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abdulaziz has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulaziz would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Abdulaziz can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abdulaziz will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Abdulaziz is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mgwirizano Wa Amai Group

texts.en:
Annie is 50 years old. She is married with six children who depend on her. Her husband works as a welder.

Annie runs a second-hand clothing business. She is requesting this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes to expand her business. She has a family member and an employee who help her with the daily activities of the business.

With the profits from her larger sales, she hopes to pay school fees for her children and renovate her dwelling house. She started her business with the aim of supporting her husband in providing for the family financially.

Her plan is to build a new big house, and she also hopes to open a tailoring business and sell her own designs.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Virgina

texts.fr:
Virgina a 34 ans. Elle est divorcée. Les deux enfants, scolarisés dans une école privée  sont à sa charge 
( paiement  d’écolage). C’est une femme courageuse  qui déploie tous ses efforts pour pouvoir éduquer ses enfants en raison de sa situation matrimoniale. Elle n’hésite pas à saisir les différentes opportunités qui lui sont offertes pour diversifier ses sources de revenus. Avant, elle travaillait dans  une entreprise franche, 
 et puis a fait comme activité une gargote depuis 2007. Ensuite pour diversifier ses activités et améliorer le revenu elle exerce une activité de vente de vêtements  friperie en même temps que les produits de la gargote. Elle a une culture de crédit, les 4 prêts obtenus lui ont permis de développer ses activités , de faire une épargne, les remboursements ont  été réguliers. 
Son rêve est de pouvoir donner à ses enfants des meilleures  conditions  de vie, la priorité étant leur éducation.
texts.en:
Virgina is 34 years old. She is divorced and supports (school fees) two children attending a private school. She is a courageous woman who makes every effort to provide an education for her children because of her marriage situation. She does not hesitate to seize opportunities provided to her for diversifying her income sources.

In the past, she used to work at an enterprise in the free zone, and she used to have a commercial stall since 2007. Then, to diversify her work and improve her income, she had a business selling secondhand clothing while running her stall. She has a culture of loans. The four loans obtained have enable her to develop her businesses and to save some money. The payments have been made regularly.

Her dream is to be able to provide the best living conditions for her children. The priority is their education.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bales of used clothing

loans.name: Shailesh

texts.en: Shailesh is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He comes from a farming family and has learned rice cultivation. Previously, he helped his parents in their fields. Now, he works independently with small loans from MFI Seva. Those loans he has repaid fully. Shailesh plants hire plots and wants to save for his own plots. To do this, he has expanded his rice areas this season. To cover the cost of this expansion Shailesh needs a loan of SRD 7,500 for the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 39 years old, and she is the mother of three kids; two of them are going to school. She is married, and her husband is a mason.

Flora makes blankets using vicuña and alpaca wool. In the picture, you can see the alpaca wool. She goes to many fairs to offer her products. She needs a loan to buy a knitting machine that will allow her to work faster.

loans.use: to buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina continua dedicándose a al su negocio de vender pasamanería, ella se dedica  hace muchos años a esta actividad y muchas horas, para sacar adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar peines, cepillos y pasta dental. Ella se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas y agrádese a los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella.
texts.en:
Member Bernardina continues with her business selling sundry items. She has been doing this for many years and many hours in order to provide for her family.

She has asked for this loan so she can buy combs, brushes, and toothpaste. She is committed to repaying her loan on time and in accordance with the terms. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for continuing to have confidence in her.

loans.use: to buy combs, brushes, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Samaila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Samaila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Samaila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, John has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, John would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, John can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, John will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. John is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yakubu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Madalitso Group

texts.en:
Alice is 44 years old. She is married with five children, two relatives and one orphan who depend on her. Her husband works as an office clerk.

Alice owns a grocery store. She would like to use this loan she has requested to buy five bags of soap and one bag of beans for her store.

The profits from the business will enable her to pay school fees for her children. She started her business with the hope of becoming independent financially. At the moment, she has three family members who are helping her with the running of the business.

Alice hopes to buy a plot of land to build a house. She also plans to expand her business to buying ten bags of soap from five bags per order in a couple of years.

loans.use: to buy five bags of soap and one bag of beans for her store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad runs a coffee shop in a Palestinian refugee camp located in Beirut. He is a Palestinian refugee himself, 56 years old and living with his wife, his daughter and his son inside the same refugee camp.

He opened his coffee shop four years ago, together with his wife, and they are putting a lot of effort into expanding the business. They sell all types of juice and coffee, and they also bake bagels and bread. The shop gradually became a meeting spot for locals with whom Ahmad and his wife are friendly and welcoming. Customers also like the fresh products sold at the shop.

Ahmad has been renting the shop since he opened it, which is a considerable cost for him, especially with the increasing cost of living inside the camp. That is why he is asking for a 4,420,528 Lebanese pounds (LBP) loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa.

In fact, he will be using the loan and part of his savings to buy the shop and cut out rent costs. Buying the shop will allow him to make more profits, and he hopes it will thus enable him to support his kids in paying their university tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy the coffee shop he has been renting

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a maize farmer from Liman Mahuta village. As a member of Babban Gona, Abbas is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abbas would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Abbas can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Abbas is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Transito

texts.es:
Transito es un hombre de 32 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de hijos de las edades entre 3 y 6 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Transito para  generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como encarado de cosechas en una finca desde hace 3 años, él tiene la fortuna de contar con el apoyo de su esposa quien trabaja lavando de ropa.
Él como padre de familia le preocupa el bienestar de su familia, pues a su casa le hace falta piso, él por varios años ha buscado la forma de poder contar con el dinero suficiente para hacer este trabajo pero no le ha sido posible por esa razón solicita un préstamo  para comprar cemento, cal, arena esto para poder instalar piso a su casa. Su gran sueño es terminar de colocarle piso a su casa y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Transito is a 32-year-old man who is married and has a beautiful family of children between the ages of 3 and 6. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

In order to support his family, Transito has been working as a harvest manager at a farm for the past three years. He is lucky that his wife contributes to the family's income by washing clothes.

As head of the household he is worried about his family's well being. His house does not have a floor and he has been trying for several years to scrape together enough money for this project, but he has not been successful. So he is asking for a loan so he can buy cement, lime, and sand to be able to put a floor in his house.

His big dream is to finish putting in the floor and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, and sand.

loans.name: Ma'mura

texts.ru:
Маъмура занимается земледелием уже более 9 лет. У нее есть участок земли, где она сажает и получает богатый урожай. Маъмура всегда радуется, когда она собирает хороший и качественный урожай. Она сеет в основном тыква. 
Маъмуре 47 лет. Она прекрасная жена и мать двоих детей. У нее двое сыновья. Один из них вместе с отцом находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Маъмура проживает в городе Вахдат вместе с сыном и невесткой. Маъмура сейчас готовит почву для посадки нового урожая, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и семена тыкву. Это кредит поможет ей провести ранний посев и весной получить хороший урожай. Маъмура надеется на Вашу отзывчивость. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас.
texts.en:
Ma'mura has worked with field crop cultivation for more than nine years. She has a plot of land on which she plants and gets a rich harvest. Ma'mura is always happy when she gets a good and high quality harvest. She mainly sows pumpkins.

Ma'mura is 47 years old. She is a good wife and the mother of two children. She has two sons. One of them is together with his father in the Russian Federation, as migrant workers. Ma'mura lives in the city of Vahdat together with her other son and her daughter-in-law.

Currently Ma'mura is preparing the soil for sowing a new harvest. For this reason she applied for a loan, in order to purchase mineral fertilizers and pumpkin seeds. This loan will allow her to carry out the early planting and receive a good harvest in the spring. Ma'mura hopes for your response. You can support her now.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and pumpkin seeds

loans.name: Saidmurod

texts.ru: 58 летный дедушка Саидмурод. Он имеет большую и счастливую семью. Саидмурод отец 5 детей. Двое сыновья находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Один из них служить в армии. Другой находится на заработках в городе Душанбе. Его дочь замужем и живет отдельно. Саидмурод имеет троих внуков, и две невестки. Саидмурод опытный колхозник. Он с молодостью занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Саидмурод любить работать на земле, поэтому он больше времени проводить на большом поле. Его соседи берут пример  с него. Саидмурод хочет обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями. Он в этом году посадил хлопок. Саидмуроду не хватает денег для купли больше количество минеральных удобрений. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Саидмурод верит в Вас и на Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Saidmurod is a 58 years old grandfather. He has a large and happy family. Saidmurod is the father of five children. Two of his sons are migrant workers in the Russian Federation. One of them is serving in the army. The other is working in the city of Dushanbe. His daughter is married and lives separately. Saidmurod has three grandchildren and two daughters-in-law.

Saidmurod is an experienced farmer. Since his youth he has worked with agriculture. He loves working the land, and therefore he spends much of his time on his large field. His neighbors look up to him.

Saidmurod would like to process the land with mineral fertilizers. This year he sowed cotton. He does not have enough money to purchase more mineral fertilizers. Therefore he applied for a loan. Saidmurod puts his faith in you and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 48 years old and from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Oscar, a driver, and they have four children. Two of their children are in the elementary level in school, and the other two are already working. The couple finds ways to adequately provide for their needs and their children's education.

Melinda has a transportation business and a small general store. She has been a tricycle and van operator for four years already. Her husband drives the van, and she hires a driver for her tricycle. A tricycle is a motorcycle with a side car that carries around four passengers. It is a common means of transportation in the Philippines and serves as a kind of taxi for short distance travel. She trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of PHP 20,000 to properly maintain her tricycle and van to ensure efficient and safe service.

Melinda prays for continued success of her transportation business and for her store to grow. She wants to be able to send her children to high school and college. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle and van

loans.name: Rowilma

texts.en:
Rowilma is glad that her previous loan from KIVA helped sustain her livelihood and thus enabled her to augment the income to provide for her family.

She is again humbly asking for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda and rice noodles, which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the last 15 years; it has funded her family's basic needs.

Rowilma's simple dream is to grow her store and be able to send her children to college. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Abdulkarim

texts.en:
Abdulkarim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abdulkarim has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulkarim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Abdulkarim can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abdulkarim will benefit from the marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Abdulkarim is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hassan is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Hassan would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Hassan will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Hassan now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en:
Irimiya is a maize farmer from Kargo village. As a member of Babban Gona, Irimiya is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support ,he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Irimiya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Irimiya can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Irimiya is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Abdullahi is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Abdullahi can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Abdullahi has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Abdullahi is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having money to pay for his children's school fees, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Iliya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Iliya can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Iliya has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Iliya is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having money to increase his farmland, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia Andrea continua dedicándose a su tienda de abarrotes, ella es muy trabajadora y aporta muy bien a su hogar.
La socia quiere ampliar su tienda por esta temporada de fin de año por eso solicito el préstamo para comprar aceite, fideos y galletas.
La socia está muy agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por confiar en ella, y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Andrea continues to run her grocery store. She is very hardworking and contributes to the household finances.

She now wishes to add more stock in time for the year-end season so she is seeking a loan to buy oil, noodles, and cookies.

Andrea is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their trust in her. She promises to make the repayments at the scheduled time..

loans.use: buy oil, noodles, and cookies

loans.name: Dianalyn

texts.en:
Dianalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.
She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Dianalyn requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear like shorts, blouses, bags, etc. to sell.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear like shorts, blouses, bags, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 49 years old and has seven children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Gemma is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Gemma has been farming vegetables for seven years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 28 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jennifer raises livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 55 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lita has been in this business for two years.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

In the future, Lita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 39 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Rita works very hard to provide for them.

Rita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, candies, soft drinks, noodles, detergent soap, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Rita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, candies, soft drinks, noodles, detergent soap, biscuits, etc.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, candies, soft drinks, noodles, detergent soap, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Pachapaccari Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Pachapaccari está formado por personas luchadoras, alegres y carismáticas que buscan día a día la manera de salir adelante con sus familias y viven en la ciudad del Cusco. 
 El socio pertenece al  banco comunal “Pachapacari” .
El socio Cesar continua dedicándose a su negocio de imprenta, el socio lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio espera mediante su negocio poder obtener  más ganancia sopara de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
 El  socio solicito el crédito para la compra de papeles, cartuchos, tientes entre otros.    
Los socios que salen adjuntos  a la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito y se comprometen  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The community bank Pachapaccari is composed of hardworking, lively, and charismatic members who look every day for ways to help themselves and their families advance. They live in the city of Cusco.

Cesar is a member of the Pachapaccari group. He's run his printing business for many years, and all is going well thanks to the effort he puts in each day. He is a responsible and diligent man who hopes to earn more money from his business so he can help his family make progress.

He is seeking a loan to buy paper, cartridges, and ink etc.

The members in the side photos had permission to attend the meeting late as they had work commitments. All are grateful for the loan and promise to make the repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: buy paper, cartridges, and ink etc.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto con sus padres y un hijo, reside en una de las aldeas del Municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Él trabajaba en una entidad del estado, pero con el fin de obtener más ingresos decidió cultivar su propia finca de café. Este cultivo lo tiene hace 4 años. Ofrece los productos de café en oro y lo vende en el mercado de la zona.  Ha invertido ya tres prestamos anteriores a su cultivo, actualmente solicita la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras para la reparación de su vehículo de trabajo con el cual labora dentro de la finca en el acarreo del café, esto le ayudara a sacar mejor su cosecha. Su plan es poder sembrar más y mejorar sus producciones de café.
texts.en:
Miguel is 26 years old. He is living together with his parents and a son. He resides in one of the villages of the municipality of Gracias, Lempira. He has been working in a state entity, but with the aim to obtain more income he decided to cultivate his own coffee farm. He is doing this cultivation for 4 years now.
He offers his coffe products raw and unroasted and sells them at the local market. He has already invested three previous loans in his crop. Now he is requesting the amount of 15,000 Lempiras for the reparation of his work vehicle with which he is working in the fields, transporting the coffee. It will help him to bring in his harvest more easily. His plan is to sow a lot more and to improve his coffee productions.

loans.use: to repair his work vehicle to bring in his harvest

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 59 years old and married with three children.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalie has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elsa is 47 years old and has three children who are in school.

Elsa has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Elsa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 38 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Arlyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Arlyn has been in pig fattening for 8 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 58 years old and has eight children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Avelina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Avelina has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Miharinirina Sandrah Gaëlle

texts.fr:
Miharinirina a 22 ans, elle est mariée. Le mari est chauffeur. Le couple a un enfant non encore scolarisé.
Elle travaille beaucoup, elle s’occupe du magasin général. Le développement d’une telle activité dépend de la capacité à répondre aux besoins des clients : diversification des produits vendus et existence de quantité suffisante. Elle a des expériences dans l’activité de petit commerce, en effet, en parallèle, elle a également une unité de vente de charbons mais cette deuxième activité est tenue par un salarié. 
Le lieu de vente se situe au marché, par souci de sécurité, les marchandises sont ramenés à son  domicile à chaque fin de journée car, il n’existe pas de gardien dans le lieu de vente. Son projet est d’être autonome sur le plan financier  pour le développement des activités (investissement de son épargne) .
texts.en:
Miharinirina is 22 years old, she is married. Her husband is a driver. The couple has a child who does not yet attend school. She works a lot, she takes care of the general store.

The development of such an activity depends on the capacity to respond to client needs: diversification of products sold and availability of sufficient quantities. She has experience in the petty trade activity; indeed, in parallel, she also has a charcoal sales unit, but this second activity is managed by an employee.

The sales location is at the market. In a concern for security, the merchandise is brought back to her home every end of day as there is no guard on location. Her goal is to be financially autonomous for the development of her activities (investing her savings).

loans.use: to buy basic necessity products: rice, flour, sugar, salt, candles, soap, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Tiana Viviane

texts.fr:
A 41 ans, Tiana a 3 enfants scolarisés dans une école privée (donc paiement d’un écolage). Son mari a pu trouver un travail comme chauffeur auprès d‘un particulier. 
Tiana  travaillait comme  coiffeuse, elle dispose tant d'années expériences dans le domaine. Depuis un an, elle a ouvert un salon de coiffure.  Elle a toujours cherché les moyens pour développer cette activité. Les matériels étaient encore insuffisants  pour offrir des services de qualité d’où ce deuxième prêt pour compléter les matériels. Ce travail nécessite une endurance physique, le salon est ouvert à 5 heures du matin et ferme à la fin de la journée à 18h30. 
Le projet du couple  est le développement de l’activité dans l’objectif de préparer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants
texts.en:
At 41, Tiana has three children who attend private school (she therefore pays tuition). Her husband was able to find a job as someone’s chauffeur.

Tiana works as a hairdresser; she has years of experience in the domain. A year ago, she opened a hair salon. She has always looked for ways to grow this business. Her equipment still wasn’t enough to offer quality services, so she is seeking this second loan to supplement her equipment. This job requires physical endurance, as the salon is open at 5am and closes at the end of the day at 6:30pm.

The couple’s plan is to grow this business with the goal of preparing for a better future for their children.

loans.use: to buy a blowdryer, a hair straightener, shears, two chairs, and some products.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 63-year-old, separated woman who does domestic work for a living. For many years, she has raised and sold hogs. She has seven grown children, and she lives in the rural town of Dumanjug, Cebu.

She is looking for additional funds to improve her hog raising business. She has requested a loan to purchase a pig and feed. These are vitals that enable her to raise and sell quality hogs. In that way, these will slowly augment her financial needs. Thus, she will continue to seek ways to become more efficient and to start to invest other sources of income.

For the future, Ana is hoping that she will become successful in her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a pig and feed.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa is 57 years old and married with eleven children. For the past seven years she has fattened and sold pigs to earn a living in the Philippines. She also earns extra money by running a sari-sari, or small general store.

Maria Luisa has applied for a 21,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She is working tirelessly to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Hanaly

texts.en:
Hanaly is 44 years old and has two children, one of whom is still in school. She is married.

Hanaly is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Hanaly has been raising livestock for 30 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Hanaly would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials, like fabric, threads, pins, a tape measure, and other materials, for her business. Magdalena has been in this business for 7 years, and she also earns income from raising pigs.

Magdalena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and through loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, like fabric, threads, pins, a tape measure, and other materials, for her business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married and works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been involved with for 6 years now.

Leonora requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients, like sticky rice, coconut, sugar, etc., for her food production business.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, like sticky rice, coconut, sugar, etc., for her food production business.

loans.name: Nomenjanahary Elizara

texts.fr:
Nomenjanahary a 41 ans, il est marié. Le couple a cinq enfants, l’un est déjà marié, trois suivent encore leurs études, le dernier non encore scolarisé. 
Il a 5 années d’expériences dans la culture de tomate. C’est une activité héritée de ses parents. Avant, il aidait ses parents dans l’agriculture.  La culture  de tomate est une activité saisonnière, le prix du produit est compétitif en cette saison. La culture varie donc selon la saison.
Sa priorité est l’éducation de ses enfants  pour que ces derniers, c'est-à-dire ses enfants,  ne deviennent pas seulement cultivateurs comme son père mais auront chacun une bonne carrière, meilleur avenir. Il a comme projet l’extension de sa maison, à cela s’ajoute la constitution d’une épargne suffisante pour préparer sa retraite.
texts.en:
Nomenjanahary is 41 years old, he is married. The couple has five children; one is already married, three are still doing studies, the last is not yet in school.

He has five years' experience in cultivating tomatoes. It is an activity he inherited from his parents. Before, he helped his parents with agriculture. Tomato cultivation is a seasonal activity, the price is competitive in this season. The cultivation hence varies according to the season.

His priority is his children's education so that they, meaning his children, not only become cultivators like their father but will each have a good career, a better future. His project is the extension of his house, added to this is building sufficient savings to prepare his retirement.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Canopio Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 28 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 5 y 10 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Maria para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la crianza de pollos con esta actividad lleva 5 años de realizarlo, le gusta hacer este actividad pues lo realiza desde  la comodidad de su hogar.
Maria con el afán de incrementar su crianza de pollos solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos de crianza, concentrado, mallas y tablas, esto con el fin de poder venderlos este fin de año.  Su gran esperanza de vida es tener su propio local para su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a 28 year old woman, is married, and has a beautiful family of three children between the ages of 5 and 10. This humble family lives in a community in Solola.

To generate income and raise her family, Maria makes a living raising chickens, which she has been doing for the past five years. She enjoys doing this activity because she is able to do it from the comfort of her home.

Maria, with the aim of increased the amount of chickens she raises, is requesting a loan to purchase more breeding chickens, food, screens, and tables. She then hopes to sell them this new year. Her life goal is to have her own place of business, and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy breeding chickens, food, screens, and tables.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.fr:
Claudine est mariée et âgée de 42 ans. Elle a trois enfants dont deux encore scolarisés. Le couple exerce ensemble l'activité. Elle a comme source de revenus l’achat et la revente de viandes (boucherie) depuis 1992. C’est une activité dont la rentabilité dépend du fonds utilisé. Les produits sont écoulés sur le marché de la capitale. Il faut bien connaître le marché pour réussir dans l’activité (qualité et quantité des produits) afin d’éviter une mévente car les marchandises ne sont pas stockables.
Le couple a comme projet l’acquisition d’un terrain  pour la construction d’une maison et la création d’une unité d’élevage de poulets de chair dans le but d’assurer des conditions de vie meilleure à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Claudine is married and 42 years old. She has three children, two of whom still attend school. The couple runs the business together. As a source of income, she has been buying and reselling (butcher) meat since 1992. This is a business whose profitability depends on the funds put into it. The products are sold at the capital’s market. One needs to know the market well in order to succeed in the business (quality and quantity of products) in order to avoid a slump in sales, as the merchandise isn’t stockable.

The couple plans to acquire land to build a house and create a poultry farming unit with the goal of ensuring better living conditions for their children.

loans.use: to buy pork.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando hails from the town of Getafe, Bohol and lives with his wife and two young children. He engages in a business where he buys and sells dried fish to locals. Due to high demand, he needs more capital to purchase a variety of dried fish. With more capital, he could improve his income and cater to the needs of his entire family.

He decided to grow his current business, but his main challenge is overcoming insufficient supplies. Thus, Rolando is applying for a Kiva loan (through Kiva's field partner, CEVI) to buy additional stock of dried fish. With the loan, he could cope with higher demand, and he can also use the profits as savings to fulfill future needs.

Rolando is very thankful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dried fish.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is deeply encouraged by Kiva and its lenders for their kind hearts and for lending her funds several times in the past, which really helped sustain and grow her store. It has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business, and she is forever grateful for your help.

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of PHP 10,000 to pay for peanuts, oil, sugar, and plastic bottles to make peanut butter, and to refill her store with canned goods, coffee, soda, and instant noodles, which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income that sustained her family's basic needs and helped in sending her child to school.

She prays that God will prosper and bless her family and business. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/ clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 community partners each, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for peanuts, oil, sugar, and plastic bottles to make peanut butter, and to buy grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old and married. For the past six years she has run a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as seasonings, vinegar, coffee, sugar, detergent soap and snack foods.

Jocelyn has applied for a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more merchandise to sell in her store. She is working steadily to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in her sari-sari, or small general store.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 46 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past fifteen years she has raised livestock in the Philippines to earn an income.

Regina has taken out and successfully repaid three prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF to help sustain her business. She has now applied for a 14,000 PHP loan to buy feed and other supplies for her livestock. She would like to build up her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Domohina Sylvia

texts.fr:
Domohina a 30 ans, elle est mère célibataire, elle s’occupe seule de son enfant. Elle exerce deux activités : l’élevage de poulets de chair et la vente de friperies. Elle est actuellement à son troisième prêt. Les deux premiers prêts ont servi à développer la vente de friperies. Ce troisième sert à démarrer l’élevage de poulets de chair. Après 45 jours d’élevage, un poulet atteint le poids moyen de 2 kg par tête. C’est un élevage à cycle court. Le marché est sûr. Les revenus tirés des deux activités se complètent. C’est une femme pleine de volonté qui déploie ses efforts pour le développement des deux activités qui constituent ses principales sources de revenus. 
Son projet est la réussite de son enfant: assurer son éducation lui donner une meilleure condition de vie.
texts.en:
Domohina is a 30-year-old single mother raising her child alone. She runs two businesses: raising chickens and selling secondhand clothes. She is currently on her third loan. The first two loans helped to develop her secondhand clothes business. This third will help launch the business of raising chickens. After 45 days of farming, a chicken will reach an average of 2kg each. This is a short farming cycle. The market is guaranteed. The income from the two businesses complement each other. This is a woman full of drive who exerts her efforts towards the development of the two businesses that make up her main sources of income.

Her goal is the success of her child: to ensure his education will give him a better life.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.fr:
Marie a 49 ans, elle est mariée. Son mari a comme activité la vente  de manioc. La famille vit dans leur propre maison.  Le couple a 3 enfants (28-25-24 ans). Les deux premiers n’habitent plus auprès de la famille. Le  dernier  travaille et appui la famille sur le plan financier. 
Elle n’hésite pas à saisir les opportunités qui sont offertes: commerce, briqueterie, activité agricole. Les bénéfices tirés des activités antérieures lui ont permis de construire une maison qu’elle met en location. Ce prêt va être utilisé dans l’élevage porcin, les porcs seront vendus après quelques mois d’engraissement. Le marché est sûr. Elle a 25 années d’expérience dans cette activité héritée de ses parents. Les fonds utilisés dans ces activités ont été dépensés en raison de la maladie qui l’a frappée d’où ce nouveau prêt.
Le projet est de pouvoir reconstituer les fonds antérieurs qui ont servi à couvrir les dépenses sanitaires dans l’objectif d’augmenter l’effectif du cheptel de l’élevage.
texts.en:
Marie is 49 years old, she is married. Her husband's activity is cassava sales. The family live in their own house. The couple has three children (28, 25 and 24 years old). The first two no longer live with the family. The last one works and helps the family with finances.

She does not hesitate to seize opportunities that are offered: trade, brickworks, agricultural activity. The profits earned from prior activities allowed her to build a house that she rents out. The loan will be used for pig breeding. The pigs will be sold after a few months' fattening. The market is assured. She has 25 yeears' experience in this activity inherited from her parents.

The funds used in these activities were spent because of an illness that afflicted her, hence this new loan. The goal is to be able to rebuild the prior funds which were used to cover health expenses, with an objective of increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to buy two piglets, and feed.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda was able to sustain her store through the untiring support of Kiva and its lenders. This has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business, and she is forever thankful for your help.

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of PHP 15,000 to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles, which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income that sustained her family's basic needs. She is hopeful for your positive response.

She prays for God to abundantly bless her children's families. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/ clients are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 community partners each, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell at her small store.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora, 35, is married and has four school-aged children. Her husband is a carpenter. For the past five years she has raised and sold pigs to residents in her town. The money she makes supplements the family’s income in providing for its needs and expenses. The main challenge she faces in her enterprise is the lack of liquidity, which limits her ability to build up her business.

Melchora has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy piglets, plus feed and vitamins for them. In the future she hopes to expand the number of pigs she can support. She is thankful for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy piglets, plus feed and vitamins for them.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a hardworking, 53-year-old fisherman. He is married and has three children, one of whom is still attending school. He has been a fisherman for many years and earns his living by selling fish. He wakes up early and arrives in the morning to work. He sells his catch to local residents.

Romeo has requested a loan to buy fuel, a motorboat engine, and materials (like plywood, paint, and nails) to repair his pump boat. These items will help him improve his day-to-day fishing activity and will provide comfort and ease in transporting his catch. Thus, his income will improve, and he will be able to settle his obligations and handle his finances wisely.

Romeo is very positive that he will become successful in his livelihood based on his hard work and determination to prosper.

loans.use: to buy fuel, a motorboat engine, and other materials (like plywood, paint, and nails) to repair his pump boat.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia es una persona que su vida ha cambiado gracias al crédito, pues con la ayuda de ello logro comprar las puertas de su casa y ahora su familia tiene mejor estabilidad de vida, con este avance ella está contenta más no conforme pues nuevamente tiene la necesidad de otro crédito que lo utilizará para la construcción de un ambiente más de su casa, pues este ambiente es muy necesario para su familia.
Ella tiene las esperanzas puestas en el crédito  para poder hacer posible la construcción. Su sueño es comenzar la construcción y finalizarlo lo más pronto posible para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Amalia’s life has changed thanks to the loan. She was able to buy the doors for her house and her family now has better stability of life. She is happy with this improvement but a new necessity arose.

Amalia requests a loan to construct a room in her house because it is necessary for her family. She has high hopes for the loan to enable the construction.

Her dream is to start and finish the construction as soon as possible so that her family can live better.

loans.use: to buy the materials to build a room in her house.
